Reviews.Title: “A good consistent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nwest_mail
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and it really hasn't altered over that period of time. The location is ok and very convenient to Wynyard Train Station. The rooms are looking abit tired and maybe the place is ready for some serious renovation if it want to keep competing in the 5 star category. Breakfast was good, but the only time we ate dinner in their restaurant, service was slow and inattentive, however the food was quite good. Overall a good experience but until we hear of a renovation I don't think we will come back. Too many other options in Sydney to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Leanne_M1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one weekend on a Mystery Deal. The room was large and hotel met all ourt requirements. Close to the Rocks and Circular Quay and not far from PIT Strip Mall or Wynard Station. Little cosy Bar with Happy hour at night. Really enjoyed our stay. Leanne & Paul

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location not the height of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Calderooni
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in a great location to explore Sydney. It is a big hotel so not that personal however the staff are helpful and friendly. After a few stays i did start to get upgraded to a larger lighter room which was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice parts but dissapointing overall”
Reviews.Author: vicnzsa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few Amora hotels but this was the first time at this one. The reception was well designed and welcoming, check in was OK. Breakfast was also OK and the room was well decorated and comfortable. Unfortunatately my room (the only one I can write about) was dull, spartan and just unwelcoming. The bathroom plumbing was old and needed an upgrade. The bed was comfortable enough and I slept well. So I do not know if I got the last room to be upgraded or not but I hope they have better ones as reported by others. As a very frequent traveller I expect more than this. Next time in Sydney I will try somewhere else equally well located.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad, Worse, I really don't know how to say it in one sentence.”
Reviews.Author: RichardOZ12345
Reviews.Content: Words escape me. From the second we checked in, the Hotel determined to make our stay among the worst we have ever had. On check in we agreed to upgrade our room by 2 levels from the deluxe room we had booked to a suite. I really would have hated to see the base level room. We checked in late and had decided on the way from the airport to have room service and then go to bed ready for the following day. My wife then rang for food and we were told that it would be a minimum of 45 minutes and the excuse quoted was really not satisfactory. ( Based purely around poor management ) I then called reception to speak to the duty manager to find out that I could not understand one word of what he was saying to me as his grasp of the English language and His annunciation was so poor. At this point I handed the phone to my wife hoping that she could understand his English, alas she was also unable to hold a meaningful conversation with the gentleman. The next day things got worse, we decided to try and relax in the morning by going to the Spa for a swim and jacuzzi, wow more stress. It would seem that the maintenance section of the hotel uses the Swimming pool and Jacuzzi area as a thoroughfare to their office/workshop. So for the hour we were there, we had to put up with Maintenance men constantly opening and closing doors and walking though the area leering at my wife in her bikini, as you can imagine my wife felt very uncomfortable. After this, Â we contacted the hotel management and the Front Office manager attempted to placate us and offered us a further upgrade to an Executive Suite, another back fire I'm afraid. Although the room was set out well, it was tired and in need of renovation. The worst feature we did not find out until later that night, the bed should have been disposed of years ago, it was so warped and was actually shaped like a banana. Anyway we did not arrive back until very late so we decided not to start things all over again. Imagine our surprise however in the morning as we found out that due to the fact that the room had no black out curtains we were rudely awoken at sunrise. To cap the whole thing off and put the proverbial icing on the Cake, just prior to us going to check out we asked the hotel for their email address so that we could send our aeroplane tickets to them to be printed out. Bad mistake, the first time we asked we were given:- Jareception@sydneyamorahotels.com.au ( given to us by the duty manager ) We sent our tickets and immediately the email bounced back. We then decided to wait until we got downstairs and while checking out, Â we checked the address and were told it was actually Jareception@sydneyamorahotels.com (with no .au) So we sat down and proceeded to send again ( a long process as the 3G network was slow and the documents were .pdfs ) well guess what .. they bounced again. This time we were told it was actually: Jareception@sydney.amorahotels.comÂ  Guess again, it is actually : Jareception@sydney.amorahotels.com.au WHAT A JOKE. And a waste of another hour of our short holiday. Being seasoned international travellers, we were appalled, on each occasion the Hotel attempted to rectify problems they actually made it worse. It is so hard to understand how this hotel can remain in business. What was supposed to be a pleasant weekend away visiting friends, turned out to be a complete nightmare that we paid the privilege for. It just was not worth complaining any further and we checked out and left, both agreeing that we would spread the word as far and as wide as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jardzy Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a few days. The location is good, walking distance to attractions. I would stay there again if I had to. The only prob for me in the room was someone staying top or bottom room was smoking in the bathroom and I got the smell. Ventilation problem in the bathroom?? That was awkward. The price for internet is too high but please try the conference room lobby where you have the breakfast. It was also strange to see at breakfast, the lovely lady cleaning the table, chairs and legs of the table with the same rag and use it again in the same order for other tables. But it changed the next day, they assigned a guy just to clean the legs of the chairs and the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Nottoofussed_12
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the Amora Jamison in Sydney and was very impressed. We did one of the 4 star mystery deals on Wotif and couldn't have been happier with the experience. The room was great and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Deco, great locatio.”
Reviews.Author: Serrafield
Reviews.Content: This is last night in this hotel and we are very sorry to have to leave. We've had a wonderful experience - excellent service, gorgeous rooms with Art Deco styling and handy location. Looking forward to staying here again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “super location, small room.”
Reviews.Author: CarlyAP
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, close to Circular Quay, however the room was quite small. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location love how close it is to Wynyard Station”
Reviews.Author: dness65
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel - great massage. We love the position of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Corners Cut”
Reviews.Author: nothappyjanBelmont
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with good rooms in general, however, the management leaves a lot to be desired in the cutting of corners to save a few dollars. In this day and age having to pay $9.95 per hour for internet is outrageous when you can free wifi for the price of a cup of coffee at any nearby cafe. The bathroom is well appointed but short on towels and toiletries over a three day period were not replaced - penny pinching at its worst. The blind in our room was tattered and torn and unsightly. The bed was very comfortable with a great selection of pillows. I have stayed here many times on business but will stay elsewhere until they drop this silly internet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Strange for a reputable hotel”
Reviews.Author: GolfNutCanberra
Reviews.Content: Got a very nice suite at the Amora Jamison Sydney Australia. 2 strange things about the hotel: 1. I use a CPAP (forced air breathing pump to stop snoring) at night. There were no empty power points around the bed. I asked if I could get an extension cord and double adaptor (so the TV could also be used while machine plugged in). Answer "You might have to choose between your machine or the TV". He went away to check after a mild rebuff.\ 2. The suite had 2 new digital TVs. Can't get any of the digital channels!!!! "It's not setup for that yet." Too bad if you wanted to watch the final round of the US Masters... You may note golf is an interest of mine from the login. Might be worth checking before you book if you need either 1 or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Good CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzypete
Reviews.Content: Very good location for Pitt st. shops,and an easy walk to the Rocks area.Hotel clean and staff attentive.Decor a bit dark and dull throughout including the room,but the bathroom was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice view, but you can do better for the money”
Reviews.Author: aliciajoy
Reviews.Content: The staff here is very friendly, the view is great if you are on a high floor, but for the money there are many hotels that are far better for the money. Our room is clean... but when I sit at the desk I smell traces of urine in the carpet. There is a spa here but the prices are not great and the gym is horrible. The equipment looks l like it is 15 years old and half of it seems broken or rusted. There is a pool but it is indoor and doesn't get much natural sunlight. The hotel room is very spacious but the bed creaks very badly when you roll over at night but the absolute worse thing of all is that there is no wi-fi. I know AU is supposedly a late adopter to wi-fi, but this is ridiculous. They also charge $25 for 24 hours of very slow internet which is just un-acceptable. 3 years ago this might have been okay. Parking is very expensive and there are many restaurants near by where you can get much better value for not too much more money. The location is great and it is a short walk to CBD, Wynyard light rail, Sydney Harbor, and Darling Harbor but there are also several other hotels in the area that serve the same purpose. I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Stella Y
Reviews.Content: Book via wotif ,the hotel is located in CBD,close to many attractions and shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in hiding”
Reviews.Author: Maxine P
Reviews.Content: This hotel hides away in Jamison Street in Sydney - handy to The Rocks. We boked through a mystery deail on wotif and paid a small amount to upgrade to Club Level - had a wonderful view of the harbour and huge room with a great bathroom. Wonderful drinks before a show and breakfast next morning. Staff all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: 88Emily88
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and seeing photos on trip advisor I was very concerned that I had made the wrong choice. We booked the hotel through a mystery deal on wotif. I even called wotif and the hotel to get a refund but could not. However, when we arrived at the hotel we were extremely surprised at how nice the hotel was. The staff were very accommodating, the conceage took our bags immediately to our rooms and the interior of the hotel was modern (both in the foyer and room). The location is EXCELENT! Could not ask for a better location. It was close to everything. The gym located on the 1st floor was also very adequate, including the pool and spa. Overall we had an excellent stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra H
Reviews.Content: Great location, walk down the the Rocks, or down George St for some shopping. Beautiful indoor pool, spa, steam room & sauna. Day beds to relax on & overlooking the city. Upgrade to the club floor for free cocktails & food for 2 hrs in the evening & free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kfer6
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Rooms are very pleasant and spacious although need some maintenance. Couldn't work out how to use the lights in the room, far too complicated ! Lift card was dodgy too but overall a nice hotel but not in the league of a good 5 star accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: smiley_watson
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and the location is ideal, especially if you are going on a cruise as it is a short downhill walk to Circular Quay or over to Darling Harbour passenger terminal. The staff were very helpful to us with some queries that we had

Reviews.Title: “Very poor experience”
Reviews.Author: FunkyBeat
Reviews.Content: Ohh my, this was a very poor experience. The hotel it self is very modern however, the service was not so great, there was attitude while trying to check in, bags where lost someone where in the hotel, even though there was heads up there could be an early check in, due to flights. Most hotels would be accommodating if you have been travelling 16+ hours and all you want is a hot shower however there was no offer of that at all. The room was modern and clean however the bed was not so comfortable, the bed felt something from Ikiea.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star? Definitely not!”
Reviews.Author: smoochthemule
Reviews.Content: Outrageous internet charges for the slowest cable internet I've experienced (was told it was due to high occupancy). Room not made up until 2pm. Office workers could stare straight into the room, forcing us to keep the blinds shut during the day. Good location, but they're kidding themselves with a 5 star rating. Will I stay here again? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but not rave worthy”
Reviews.Author: Jacjosh87
Reviews.Content: Room was fine as we were out and about most of the time. Large really nice bathroom. Staff were friendly and it is in a good central location, only a 5 - 10 minute walk to the Pitt St mall. I cant identify anything wrong with the hotel but it also wasn't the as luxurious as I was hoping given it's 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Ruth_Mark_and_Hansel
Reviews.Content: We were offered (at an extra charge) and accepted an upgrade to a suite when we arrived. The room was fine, the bed was comfortable and it was clean. However it seemed over priced, even at the discounted rate - maybe this is just a reflection of the hotel room market in Sydney at the moment. In relation to comparable hotels overseas we would have rated this about a 4 star, it just didn't seem to have the same level of service and features. Overall it was fine. The TV didn't work very well which is very important to my wife who likes to watch tv in bed at hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sydney CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0liday-all-the-time
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my wife's 30th birthday over the weekend at this hotel. We had one of our best hotel experiences here. We stayed for one night on the 26th floor overlooking the Menzies Park. The location of this hotel in the city is its best aspect - in the CBD, close to Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and very close to public transport. The Amora Spa experience was out of this world. My wife enjoyed the 90 minute massage and facial treatment thoroughly and recommends it to everyone considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony really adds to the room”
Reviews.Author: yolc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here curtesy of one of the mystery hotel deals on Wotif. It is still a bit expensive however the location is fabulous, so handy for The Rocks, Circular Quay and the Opera House. We were given a balcony room and that allowed us to leave the door to the balcony open and have fresh air! How often do you stay in a 5 star hotel and feel like your in a sealed container with excessively hot or cold air conditioning. Staff were friendly but we chose to eat out of the hotel for breakfast as it was not good value for money. We did however have a good coffee from the coffee cart at the front door of the hotel in the morning. Loved the 5 star amenties such as pillow menu, robes and slippers in the room. This is a worthwhile hotel if you want to have a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable bit of luxury in the cbd”
Reviews.Author: Mipanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a mystery stay with Wotif just after Christmas. We loved it! - Beautiful bathroom with a massive deep bathtub. - nice spacious room and bed - great location If I had to complain about anything, the bar area was quite dated. It could be lovely, with it's massive windows creating a lot of light, but it looks sort of 70s-80s style at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased”
Reviews.Author: greata p
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through the secret deal and were very pleased. i had read some if the reviews on here prior to our stay so was a little worried but we were very happy with the hotel. Central localtion excellent service and room was great - we asked for a balconly so don't know if that made a difference to the room but it was lovely. I can see what people mean about the design of the TV in the room but it is watchable.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is its best attribute.All the standard room ammentities are there but it is a little impersonal and the food presentation and standard at breakfast just average.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time a Rydges?”
Reviews.Author: ContributinTraveller
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at this hotel before but I noticed that on Google Maps it appeared to indicate it was once a Rydges. Obviously some money has been spent on it and the rooms are quite pleasant. Room service prices were outrageous with the cheapest breakfast option something like $40 including a service charge. Staff were pleasant and the hotel is well located to Wynyard train station, the Rocks, and Circular Quay. I thought the price I paid was getting close to a 5 star hotel, but this is not the case. Because this was a business trip and because of the location I may stay there again, but Swissotel is superior and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “This is 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Abi2005
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 1 night prior to flying out of Sydney on an early morning flight. I got a mystery deal on wotif and wanted somewhere near the Rocks and Circular Quay so was pleased to find the location of the mystery hotel. Many of the reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor were negative so we were pleasantly surprise about the quality of the services and the great room. The room was huge and had a massive bathroom, with a lovely big bathtub. the bed was comfortable and had lovely pillows! We wish we could have stayed for longer and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No point staying hereGot better service from 3 star places”
Reviews.Author: vve007
Reviews.Content: Found several issues - room we got was not what we paid for- we booked a superior, got standard - bell boy lost one of our bags, they later found them -bed was uncomfortable- was sagging in the middle - the TV was no bigger than a computer monitor (22inch) and locked in top cupboard. Difficult to watch without the cupboard doors getting in the way -useless concierge- we wanted to go to sake (Japanese) was told they couldn't book table for us because it would already be full for the night. We called the restraunt ourselves and get a table without a problem Everything about the place was sub par- wouldn't even call it 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Great Bath Tub!!”
Reviews.Author: golfinggirl1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after buying a Secret Hotel on Wotif. I was more than pleased with the transaction and when we arrived early, not only did we get an early check in, we were upgraded to a corner room! This room has a MASSIVE bathroom with seperate bath and shower. You can sit in the tub and view the city below! The staff were all friendly, the hotel was very clean and the amenities were first class. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay- The room was very comfortable, with a good view of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pedfield
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. We got upgraded to a suite and were welcomed with champagne and strawberries. Friendly, helpful staff, lovely accommodation and overall a very nice time had while there. Close to shops, Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Booked through Wotif”
Reviews.Author: FuriousCowgirl
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by a very rude staff member who took my details coldly and just left me standing there, in the foyer 'Um, excuse me, where are the lifts?' I had to ask. No-one offered to help me with my bags and I felt like I was immediately unwelcome. The Room however was lovely and the view was fabulous. There was a bath and a huge shower and the Pool/sauna/spa was pleasant. What I did find slightly off were the prices, $5 water and $10 per hour for the internet the whole mini bar was just over the top. It makes me feel embarrassed when you compare a 5 star in Sydney to one in Europe where you don't have to pay exorbitant prices for extra's particularly the internet. Feels like a con and made it seem like a ridiculous option to eat/drink in the hotel, I went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Colleen B
Reviews.Content: I booked the Amora through a Wotif mystery deal and was delighted. The hotel is lovely, staff were all super friendly, accomodating and obviously happy to be there. I stayed there with my husband to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary and received an upgrade, late checkout and card from the hotel. All unexpected but delightful. The hotel is in a great location easy walk to Pitt Street Mall or to the Rocks. I didn't want to leave. I will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “handy location great staff”
Reviews.Author: sandersonsAustralia
Reviews.Content: recently cruised from brisbane to sydney had one night stay in the amora booked through wotif mystery deal very affordable 5 star ,reception staff very freindly and helpfull we got of the boat at 9 am and the hotel gave us our room straight away on the seven floor with a pleasent veiw ,which was great for a relaxing shower and change and off to explore the sights of sydney , pre dinner drinks at the hotel with very freindly bar staff , $8.50 a beer a bit steep but was about to find out thats the norm in sydney hotels , the service we receieved in this hotel is fautless in every aspect , rooms a little on the small side but clean and comfrotable fanatstic location 2 minurtes from the rocks and circular quay

Reviews.Title: “Unsuitable to be listed as a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on the fourth floor after requesting a higher floor but That is OK, but the room was not up to five star standard. I did give a feedback form to the hotel indicating my concerns and asked then to contact me but they have not.The staf were efficient but uninterested The room old and worn. Our room the blind on the window was torn and numerous areas the stiching had come undone with concerns to would operate correctly. Carpet stained. The safe in the room did not work. Several of the cupboards would not open or close properly. The wall had so many touch ups of the paint work done it was very unappealing. The door frame to the bathroom the paint was peeling and obvious signs of dampness. The bed was not of a standard I would have expected in a five star room and we both found it uncomfortable. The best thing about the hotel is the location but there are much better hotels nearby. tried this once never again.Certainly not 5 star more a 3.5 or average 4

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 5 star..”
Reviews.Author: Moretravel68
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers I also booked this hotel through the motif mystery deal, for a 3 night stay with my daughter. The location is very good for exploring the city and we were able to walk comfortably to The Rocks, Darling Harbour and the Powerhouse Museum. For travel further afield the hotel is a very short walk to Wynyard Station and buses. The room was a very good size with a large comfortable bathroom. We had a view of Observatory Hill from the bath. It was easy to see that once upon a time the hotel was of 5 star standard but minor maintenance issues with the fixtures now lets the room down. We had two beds and they were not very comfortable, nor were the pillows. When compared to comfort at 5 star hotels, these beds were 3-4 star. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, the selection was very good and the food was a good temperature. It was cheaper to pre- purchase the breakfast option at check-in. Room service was expensive as one would expect, but to charge an extra $6 on top of the already inflated prices made us choose to eat out. The rooms were quite clean, the shower was starting to show signs of wear and tear. This also applied to the window furnishings and the wardrobe in the bedroom, with signs of water damage, and a dodgy shelf in the entrance. Light switches were a little tricky to figure out at first. The staff were welcoming at all times and we could not fault their service. They were only too happy for us to leave our bags after check-out. I would recommend this hotel to others if they can get a discounted price but I would warn them that it is not currently a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay in Sydney. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: cricketfan97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2012, while the wife was attending a symposium in the same hotel. Nice room. The service could have been a bit more accomodating. The parking is a bit confusing. The parking ticket expires every 24 hours. So make sure you explain your parking timings to the front desk when you're trying to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Had high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hy_Pie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a night due to a wedding I The Rocks. The room was clean and had everything you need for a short stay. The only real issue was the bathroom drains. The water from the shower went to the drain in the middle of the room rather than the one in the actual shower, so the bathroom floor got soaking wet everyone you took a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: OzACT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night here whilst on a business trip in Sydney. We booked a mystery deal through Wotif which wasn't really a huge discount on the standard price but thought we couldn't go too wrong with a 5 star hotel. The hotel is in a great location, interior was lovely and I can't complain about the staff but our room was a disappointment. We were given a disabled room. The room was pretty small and I can't imagine how anyone in a wheelchair could easily navigate their way around the place. The tv was placed to the side of the bed which made it really awkward to watch - this seems to be the case in a lot of rooms. But what really surprised me was the bathroom. It was spacious and of course had no bath (tough luck if I wanted to soak myself after a long day) but it also had absolutely nowhere to put your toiletries! The bathroom is plenty big enough to have shelf somewhere but I had to put everything on a shelf located outside the bathroom door! I'm sure wheelchair bound guests would find this even more of an inconvenience. Also, the slightly mouldy shower had no soap holder or anywhere to place the shampoos. Everything had to go on the floor. Watch out for Mystery Deals! Not a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “The worst staff, 1 star experience.”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: In summary - Terrible service and poor attitude from staff. I stayed at the Amora Jamison Sydney on 21 January 2012. When we arrived we were greeted by concierge who took our bags. When we finished checking in we looked around for our bags and the concierge. Our bags were still sitting out the front of the hotel with the conceirge chatting away at a desk. (Thanks - I enjoy my luggage being left for anyone to take). We went to our room which was reasonable. After a short time we noticed a beeping. The safe had an error code and would not close, lock or reset (we had not used it). I called the reception and was told someone would come up. Twenty minutes later, I called again. The receptionist made it clear I was pestering her and someone was coming. Ten minutes later, the maintenance man arrived. He was friendly and apologetic and was trying to fix the safe for about fifteen minutes. He then called the duty manager and requested he come up with a device to reset the safe. I could tell from the conversation that the maintenance man was getting frustrated at this persons refusal to attend the room. I was told someone would be coming up shortly. Twenty minutes later, I called to find out what was happening with the safe that was still beeping every minute or so. Once again the receptionist had a poor attitude. About twenty minutes later, (over an hour by now of beeping and waiting to relax) the manager attends. His attitude was poor from the first second and did not improve. He even went to trouble of showing me a list of things he had to do when he dealt with my issue. The manager then told me the maintenance man would only be there for another hour so if there was anything further I needed to call before he left. I questioned him on what would happen if it started to beep again after that time and he said maintenance would not be back till the morning. About one minute after the manager left the safe commenced beeping again. I call reception again and yes got the same poor attitude. I requested a new room or a refund. I was informed conceirge would attend with a new room key. About twenty minutes later, I received a call from the manager who told me to send the conceirge back down when they arrived. He explained to me that he had fixed it and it was not beeping so I did not need a new room. After an argument he basically said whatever and ended the call. About twenty minutes later, (as I was packing my back to check out) conceirge attended with new room keys. The new room was the same style and size. In the morning, I asked for the hotel manager's details to make a complaint. The morning manager took down the details and informed me he would follow this up and call me. So one month on I have not heard anything and can only assume this poor service is the standard. With so many good hotels in Sydney avoid this one. The service is one star.

Reviews.Title: “Business 1 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: vik871
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Rooms are not practical. Bed is not as comfortable as other similar hotels. Small TV in cupboard on side. Viewing angle bad. Not much thought bu interior designers. . In room dining expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, dirty, drugs!”
Reviews.Author: Bw1122
Reviews.Content: On arriving in my room it quickly became obvious that the room had not been properly cleaned. There was hair in the sink and a 'funny' smell. It didn't take long to find out what the smell was when I saw on the carpet in plain sight a (still nearly full) bag of marajiana. Shocked and unsure of what to do I called the concierge, no answer. I considered calling the police but was honestly uncertain what to do, I had an important dinner appointment for business so I rushed off to it. When I returned (although it was quite late) there wasn't anyone at reception to enquire about this so I went up to the room to wait and call back down later. I had a shower only to discover the head was broken and a had to hold it with one hand to it didn't just spray on the wall. Suffice to say at that stage I was glad that I was checking out the following morning, and as I was leaving quite early not worth my time or effort to try and remedy the situation. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Poor Poor”
Reviews.Author: shaun s
Reviews.Content: What a bad experience. They made an error wit my booking giving me a twin room when I wanted a knig room, refused to change it, the duty manager jason [---] was rude telling me that they wouldnt allow a cancellation, the bed rocks so far that it feels like it could fall over any minute, the carpet is dirty...need I go on. Dont stay here. For the money and the promise of a "free upgrade" (I would hate to see what the bad rooms were like) you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “About to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Pointyhead_10
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers here we got this as our Last Minute mystery 5 star booking and were similarly disappointed at the prospect. The reality was much as others have reported: a hotel that once was better, trading on past glories and with rooms that are decidedly tired (battered, bashed, curled at the edges and stained). In fairness the beds are comfy, the shower is excellent, there are no crashing doors or braying voices in the corridors at night, and it's a good position close to Circular Quay. As we only paid $262 what can I complain about really, except it wasn't what I had hoped for when I threw the dice for a 5 star mystery booking. It was our wedding anniversary and I had hoped for something suitably wedding anniversary-ish. Maybe I expected too much. Anyway, on check out they asked how the room was so I said I thought was rather tired and they advised that a refurb is underway. So things will look up ....

Reviews.Title: “Beware mystery hotel deals”
Reviews.Author: Napier1
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel certainly not 5 star, don't eat in the restaurant, not that many people do, food was cold and despite the offer of re heating both courses the waitress was quite surprised that I had commented on the meal, beware mystery deals

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Wedding Anniversary. The check in was so quick we had literally got out of our car and the valet parked it and where in our room within 5 mins. We got an upgrade to a deluxe corner room on the 25th floor with a complimentary 12 noon checkout. The staff were very nice, the room was very clean and overall we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after paying for a mystery night in Sydney. Check in was ok, but not overly friendly. The room was a bit worn (carpet a little stained) and the TV was in a cabinet to the side of the bed. The bath was good though, nice and deep. Room service...well...I asked for a Baileys and milk at about 1 in the morning, but was told that room service was not available. I opened 2 bottles of Kahlua, one which was Kahlua and one that was water...or something else. I asked for room service to bring another 2 bottles as i did not trust what I had pored. I asked the room service guy to wait while I pored the bottles he had brought and the same thing happened. One Kahlua and one bottle that was something else. I asked room service to come back with a real drink and did not see him again. My friend asked for a Taxi and there was much confusion about that too. Definitely a hotel trying to be five star, but they don't know where to start when it comes to customer service. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad; very modern and new”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy13132008
Reviews.Content: One night stay in the city, close to Circular Quay, very neat room, good tv though abit small with various channels, beautiful bathroom

Reviews.Title: “5 star? Really?”
Reviews.Author: DJT01
Reviews.Content: Like many previous reviewers, we stayed at this hotel through a 'last minute' booking firm, being told it would be a 5 star hotel in the heart of the CBD. Doing a quick trip to Sydney, it seemed like a good option. The entrance, lobby and reception areas are certainly very nice, but the room we had was lucky to be in the 4 star bracket. It didn't help that we overlooked an office block, but hey, we weren't paying full rates so you get what you're given. But my biggest gripe is that they obviously decided to recoup the reduced rates by charging ridiculous amounts for all of the add-on. The mini bar prices were an absolute rip off ($5 for still water!) But the worst example of overcharging was breakfast @ $37 pp for a very average, bland buffet, oh and espresso coffee was extra. If you're not paying full rates I suppose this place if OK. Other than that? I would try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a nice get away”
Reviews.Author: glasseyed
Reviews.Content: beautiful room, great spacious bathroom great breakfast, friendly staff a good home from home atmosphere (one thing an experienced waiter should not berate a new member of staff in front of customers, if at all, for not knowing what an affogato was he should teach her what it is and how to make one.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany H
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a 5 Star Mystery Deal, and the location was perfect for us as we had dinner reservations at The Rocks, so we were within a 10 minute walk. The service on arrival was wonderful and fast. Our room was nice, on Level 5, carpet was a bit worn and stained, and the shower could do with a very good scrub. Other than that though the room was very clean and comfortable. The television was quite small, and located in a cupboard to the side of the bed. It did not pull all the way out so we could not see if we were laying in bed, which was annoying. Room service menu was VERY expensive, which is expected, but to also have a $6.00 charge to deliver it to the room was a bit much, so we opted out of this for breakfast. The pool and spa were lovely, and we enjoyed a late night cocktail in the bar. Service here was wonderful. We did had a very enjoyable stay, and while we did book on the mystery deal we were expecting a little bit more for a 5 Star Hotel. Not sure if we would stay here and pay the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the centre of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Amora a number of times over the past few years. The hotel is very elegant and it is nice to have the door opened for you at the end of the day by a friendly porter. The concierge/porter staff are fantastic, but they could teach the receptionists a few lessons in small talk and how to smile. The rooms are good value, the bathrooms are quite luxurious and beds very comfortable. I have dined in their restaurant for breakfast and dinner and also utilised their room service option, the food is generally pretty good but don't expect any special service in the restaurant. Overall my previous stay's at the Amora have always been enjoyable and problem free, my only tip is to request a high floor level. I will definitely be returning to the Amora in the near future, if only for the fantastic concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with high service level”
Reviews.Author: laneotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid January after booking through a web offer citing 5 star hotel. This rating is based on the type of amenities, not the quality of them in this case. Pros: Personnel were extremely nice and accommodating. Twin room on the 23rd floor was large enough and overlooked a park .....so pleasant view. Bathroom was huge and well appointed. Blackout shades rolled down behind the mesh privacy screen and it fit tight leaving no leakage for those of us with light issues. Location for our three day "let us see as much as possible without using taxis" stay in Sydney was awesome and we felt safe walking the area at night. It is located 100 meters from a subway stop and massive food court with any number of adequate food places to eat in or take away, great coffee and good desserts. There is a pharmacy and Woolworths in there too along with a flower vendor and some souvenir and clothing stores. Around the corner is a Vodaphone store with great service personnel who helped get wireless for our iPad/service for our phone. Cons: tired furnishings including beds although mattresses were fine and sheets were crisp. For us, the level of business travelers made it a more transactional visit and more sterile. Although not a hotel fault, we found sketchy people in the sauna and loud people using the dining facilities so in both cases declined those amenities. For the proximity to the subway, walking distance from places we wanted to see, and the services we would recommend and advise to just look past the tired appearance. In our opinion it was not THAT distracting to overshadow the "pros" offered especially if you got a reduced rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: freddo56
Reviews.Content: Booked as a "mystery hotel", we were pleased to have the Amora Jamison chosen for our stay. As we were there on Australia Day, it was a fabulous location to enjoy the festivities at Circular Quay, the Rocks and Darling Harbour. Central to all these. We requested a high floor and were pleased to be allocated the 29th floor. Lovely corner room with 2 large windows with fabulous views across Sydney. The bathroom was spectacular with great views also. Room was spacious and bed very comfortable. Service was good, bags brought to our room, doors opened on entry and exit of hotel. All in all a lovely stay...would do it again. Thank you Amora Jamison!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing....”
Reviews.Author: rachele313
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel last week on a 5 star "mystery deal", which seems to be the trap most people have fallen into. Very disappointing as I now know to go for a 4 star mystery deal should I ever book that way again as Amora Jamison is certainly not 5 star. I booked it on a whim for myself and my partner as a special "treat" last week for the night before Australia Day. I arrived for check in in the middle of a down pour with my hands full of bags and umbrellas, the door man was too busy staring into space to even open the door for me! Check in was reasonably fast and I was sent off to my room (still carrying all my bags with no offer of help). The room was incredibly old and worn. Stained carpet, falling apart furniture and terrible lighting (not from sun as there was none but from the actual lights installed!). The next morning my partner and I both woke up exceptionally early as we were in so much pain from the awfully uncomfortabel bed/pillows. We had ordered pillows from the pillow menu which basically offered 3 types of soft pillows (already found on your bed) or a "chiropractic pillow" which I was told was similar to a latex pillow. The only thing chiropractic about it was that I now need to visit the chiropractor after sleeping on it! The reason I know the bed was so bad was that my partner was in pain and unable to sleep from it and he can sleep anywhere usually.Gosh we are 25 not 75, yet that is how I felt all of the next day! This hotel is not five star. Obviously its rating has not been reviewed in a long time. Compare it to hotels like the Sheraton, Hilton, InterContinental it is not even a fraction as good. I am glad I got special rates as there is absolutely no chance I would pay regular price. The only good thing about this hotel is it is in a reasonably good location close to the rocks and circular quay. However, there are FAR BETTER hotels within the same vicinity. Trust me! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: BHNZ
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I was sent to Sydney from London for a 3 week stay on business. A pokey room is the worst thing. Was I disappointed...No way! From the minute I checked in the service was fantastic. Anything you wanted, just call and they sort it. the concierge even organised a rental car for me and had it dropped off to the hotel ready for the weekend- and it was no more expensive then when I looked to book online with Avis! A great little bar, and several restaurants to choose. One was a little too pricey but the normal restaurant is fine by hotel standards. Breakfast was nice, and the service was very good considering the place was popular and always busy. All the daily papers too- even on Sunday. Room Service was brilliant- always quick, always hot, very tasty, fresh and healthy (that surprised me). Laundry was pricey (but it always is!) but it was quick and well done The room was great. Deluxe Park Suite on the 27th floor. Had a view over the park and could see the harbour at a distance. A good sitting area with stereo and TV, desk area, big bedroom and huge bath and shower. Great bed and plenty of room to put stuff- good when you move in for a while. All very modern and luxurious Gym was also good, but popular, so go at the quiet times. Thanks to all the team! This is a great hotel and better than any I have stayed in in Europe

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Secret Deals”
Reviews.Author: cherylann06
Reviews.Content: I recently booked for a secret deal and the booking was for the Amora Jamison, Sydney for one night in late January 2012. On arrival I was checked in and assumed we would be give a standard double room. However the room we got was a disabled room. As I have worked in the field of disabilities I understand and support the need for modified/disability accommodation. However I was not advised of this when I was booked in and the room was unsuitable for our needs. We had a dinner engagement that evening and the bathroom had no bathroom vanity or space to place makeup etc. when getting ready. The bathroom had only a mirror and washbasin, very unsatisfactory even for a disabled person. On checkout the next day I complained and they offered me a reduced rate/free upgrade on my next stay. I declined saying I would not book or choose to stay again. The location is good (if you want the Rocks) and I agree with JubesSydney this did not meet my expectation of a 5 star hotel. Parking was $38 a day, don't try and park yourself as it is a nightmare. I would do the valet even though it is about $10 more. Furnishings were tired and our room had no view at all. I think you can do a lot better and beware of the Secret Deal as the Amora Jamison seems to pop up a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: flipperPerth
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a side street, but traditionally warm and welcoming from the moment the taxi pulls up. Rooms are comfortable, but no views (from my window anyway). Only real negative for me was that the breakfast is slipping in quality compared to prior visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but getting a lot tired”
Reviews.Author: Ballo71
Reviews.Content: Bouquets: location, clean bathroom. Brickbats: tired furnishings (stained carpets, broken/soiled curtains, sub-standard bed & linen) poor mini-bar & small LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, tired furnishings.”
Reviews.Author: JubesSydney
Reviews.Content: This was rated as a five star hotel, so even though our experience here was good it was not really five star except for the service. All the furniture in the hotel needs replacing. The tables are chipped and the fabrics are stained and damaged, from the foyer to the rooms. It seems more of a busines traveller hotel. The location is good near the rocks, but it is a few streets back from the quay so not many rooms would have more than filtered views of the harbour. We booked a mystery 5 star hotel night ( are they all at the Jamison? some of my friends have also booked the 'mystery' and all got the Jamison) It was our anniversary so I asked for an upgrade and got one. The staff could not have been better, from the door men to the room service and front desk. Very attentive but unobtrusive. The room was very clean with a great bathroom with separate bath and shower. Spacious room, just furnishing a little tired. Get a corner room as it has two windows and more room. The pool and spa were good and there is sauna and steam room. Again broken furniture. We didnt use the day spa but it looked very nice. We really enjoyed our stay,and it was great value for money, but I think it is not quite 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYAustralia
Reviews.Content: I chose a 'secret hotel' online at $140pn. All it said was 5 star, close to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.It did not disappoint. Guest services were excellent from the doorman to rooms. We paid $70 for an upgrade and it was so worth it. Top floor executive king with pre dinner drinks and canapÃ©s (didnt need dinner) in the Jamison Club and breakfast in there too. For us it was value for money for what we paid. For those who pay the going rate, enjoy it. Thanks Amora will stay again. For those of you unsure about trying a secret hotel, choose 5 star in good location and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jmcf171
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here after picking up a Wotif mystery deal. Centrally located, it is 5 mins walk from Ivy with its bars and restaurants, 5 minutes to Wynyard train station, and about 15 minutes to the Pitt Street shopping area. The hotel has been recently renovated, and our large balcony room provided a glimpse of the harbour looking NW over observatory hill. The rooms are large and modern, but to us didn't feel like a five star hotel. A couple of light bulbs didn't work, and there were a few marks on the bedsheets and on the walls (all easily rectified in 5mins if someone in housekeeping had an eye for detail) A large shower and bath were provided, with decent water flow and hot water. The bed was comfortable, and a 'pillow menu' was available, as is all the rage these days. Our main disappointment was with the valet parking; calling ahead at 8:20 on a Sunday morning, it took over 45mins for our car to be produced, after an apparent 'problem' with the ticket, causing us to be rather late for a scheduled breakfast with friends. Not the end of the world of course, but disappointing when you pay $48 for the privilege. This hotel is probably more suited to the business traveller, than those looking for a romantic getaway, as it just felt a bit sterile. For the price though, this is a great place to stay if you're catching a show at the Opera House, having dinner in the city, or indulging in some retail therapy.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Bargain”
Reviews.Author: 3littlepigsgotroppo
Reviews.Content: We needed a bed to sleep in near Circular Quay after a concert so went for a "Secret 5* hotel near the Rocks and Quay" at $150 for a Deluxe King Room. The location is excellent, very close to both Wynyard station, the Rocks and the Quay. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room we were allocated. Whilst it was only on the 7th Floor it was a corner room with an open view across the city towards the western side of the Bridge. The bathroom was enormous, separate big tub and shower huge picture window for a view from the bath if you were game! Towels big but a little thin and only 2 of them. The room itself wasn't huge but was considerably bigger than the equivalent at the Sofitel Wentworth where we have stayed a couple of times. The standout feature was the bed, incredibly comfortable, I wanted to take it home! There is a pillow menu but no listing for my favourite firm foam pillow so I stuck with what was on offer. The hotel could certainly do with a refresh. There is some wear and tear to carpets and surfaces in the room. The hotel information guide had VERY grubby pages that really should be replaced. The room was clean, but needed more attention to detail (eg the dirty information guide) The Amora isnt in the league of the big Sydney 5 Star hotels, we have stayed at the Hilton, Sheraton on the Park, Blu Hotel and Sofitel and the Amora doesnt punch at the same weight, however, I would give it a solid 4 1/2 stars and rank it WAY above the 4* Sydney hotels we've stayed in (Marque, Vibe, Travelodge just around the corner) which would have cost us at least as much if not more. Would we stay here again, certainly. For the price we paid it was the best bargain bed in Sydney that night!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: motherhen1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my daughter, excellent location, two minutes from Wynyard train station so handy for airport and view of part of Opera house. Room clean and comfortable but overlooking office so blinds had to be permanently closed. Check mini bar contents as ours was not at listed. Ordered through bucket shop site so paid $150 which for city centre fantastic. Arrived from Auckland at 10am and was able to check in and didn't leave until 5:30pm but was able to leave bags. Would do again for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: tastetattler
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Amora Jamison and we found it to be very good. Probably would not rate it a 5 star...more 4 - 4.5 star. Great location, service was prompt, efficient and pleasant. Nice bathroom, rooms on the small side but we only paid $155- $165 a night so we are hardly complaining. Room service was fine, we ate out at Tetsuyas and Wildfire so the location from both restaurants was great. So close to The Establishment. We had a really enjoyable stay.....loved our time in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “5 Star and you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: MSIMaker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and I only stay if its a mystery deal.....which seems to be very common as I have got this place the last 3 times I stayed in town. The rooms are excellent with big bathrooms which are quite elegant. Its the prices for everything though. Nothing is complimentary.....and you pay a surcharge of $6 for room service....that's $6 every time you order something. They charge $9.50 for a bottle of beer and then $6 on top surcharge. Parking is the other gouger..... ridiculous pricing really.Just a rip off really. I only ever stay for business and I would not stay here if I was on a trip or a holiday....I'm sure I can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Five star???”
Reviews.Author: Jon J
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel, very well located in the Sydney CBD. Their self rating of being a five star hotel is a surprise. Here are a few basic things I noticed when I arrived: No wifi in your room in a five star?? They did have an ancient modem in the room, requiring a phone line. Instant coffee, motel quality. I thought a "five star" property would have something a little better. Had I known, I would have brought a plunger and some gounds. Very small television. Not a problem for me. None of these things really were. I was happy with the place and its location. I just find it astonishing that they rate themselve as five star. Other little quirks: Their advertised 530pm happy hour doesn't apply to their main bar. They don't tell you that unless you ask. A room full of people thinking they are paying "happy hour prices. Silly and deceptive. I would recomend the Amora and would stay there again, but they need a more realistic 3.5 rating

Reviews.Title: “so dissapointing - dirty, loud hammering & just totally did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jessica4492
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write on here.. this is my first ever review. but I think people need to be aware: After booking a mystery deal online I was so excited to stay at the Amora. And now - so glad I did the mystery deal and only paid half the price because that is all it was worth! First impression of the room was that it was modern & nice. Looking into further detail, our view consisted of a brick wall, the shower was filthy - hair in the corners, soap stains & mould.. looking at the mini bar stuff (RIP OFF- & the wine corker was filthy!) The T.v came out on rolls out of a cupboard, which was pointless if you wanted to watch a movie in bed or anything because the cupboard door completely blocked the view!! As there wasnt much to do in the room, we thought we may go down for a swim... With limited beds, and dirty towels on every bed the hot tub 'out of order' with it empty and pieces pulled out everywhere.. we decided to head back to our room. (would of been nice to be informed when we checked in!) Dinner that evening we had at the gallery - dont even bother with that. We went on a monday night, quiet night with maybe 10 people in the restaraunt.. We ordered a bottle of sweet wine.. 20 minutes later the waiter (who seemed to be training) still could not find this wine so he came to tell us he was going to have another look.... finally he came with a bottle which was not at all cold, and did taste like a cheap drop. ($29 in the restaraunt) After watching everyone else get there meals (55minutes later) I hate asking but I asked the waiter if our meals were almost ready as we had been waiting quiet some time.. he goes to the kitchen and comes back and tells us that our order had been lost, for that they gave us complimentary steamed vegetables - they were not in anyway steamed, they were hard as rock. I had the ratatoulle canneloni which was tasteless & watery, my partner had the pork which was enjoyable... On the plus side the bed was so comfy I didn't want to move... Although we were woken at 7am to a loud banging/hammering/drilling noise which seemed to maybe be above our room.. this noise still did not stop even after we checked out. VERY inconsiderate. For a 5 star hotel I was not in anyway impressed, I did leave a letter with management - and still no response, no email no nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: katensean
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a secret deal hotel for one night as we were transiting from interstate flights and i have to say that we were more than impressed with the hotel. It is right near Wyndard Train station making it easy to get the train into town, our room was on the 25th floor and we has a great city view looking right at the centrepoint tower. It was new years day when we arrived so not too much available in the way of food for dinner around the hotel, we went to the rocks and had an overpriced pizza, but knew we would be paying over the odds in the rocks. The room was lovely! Big bathroom, huge bath, lovely big shower, big bed! Fairly good choice of channels to watch, although we didn't have all that much time to watch tv! We also got a free bottle of wine upon checkin and the checkin ladies couldn't have been more friendly. Check out was really busy, they had loads of people checking in and out and some people were getting a bit cranky, but it was right on check out time and maybe people just needed to chill a little, it was only a short wait. All in all i would be happy to stay here again if the need arised.PS...the lovely hosuekeeping lady was really friendly, she wished us a good morning when we went past and was really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: londonbabe73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Over new years good location right by circular quay ( 5 min walk ) and train station ( wynyard) Big rooms , great bathroom tub or shower sparkling clean and free wifi in the lobby Also nice small pool and steam / sauna . Room had a fridge and kettle , we just emptied it and put our own stuff in and it a d didn't have any problems as mini bar was crazy. Also there is a woolworths supermarket in the station in the basement for getting snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value?”
Reviews.Author: DGM2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in December. Problem started when checking in. Even though check-in is at 2pm our room was not ready until 5pm. They wouldn't find an alternative room and wouldn't upgrade so had to hang around for 3 hours. No apology, just threw 2 free glasses of wine which would cost them $1. One of the reasons we booked here was because it claimed to have broadband Internet in room. So trying to get online but no, I can't. There is no wi-fi. Need to use adsl cable which doesn't work with apple laptops or iPad. HELLLO half the world is using apple so why not say in big letters NO WI-FI at the Amora Jamison before you charged me extra for this option. Of course they wouldn't refund the cost of no Internet availability. Instead just threw some temporary Internet access codes from the business center which is only open 9-5. I will use a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sagreatdan
Reviews.Content: Central location close to shops and Sydney icons. Modern room. Good value as a secret deal hotel. Views from back of the hotel are of surrounding office buildings from tenth floor. In room food very expensive. Nice indoor pool, more pretty than practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: BB88888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 for one week on business. Like most hotels in Australia, service is exceptional and the staff are polite and can't do enough for you. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, bathrooms are roomy, in-room dining offers a limited selection but the food is of good quality, and the hotel location is fantastic - right in the middle of the CBD. Recommended for business and leisure, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lindy B
Reviews.Content: Not up to the standards of a five star hotel.Quiet position,staff not that friendly or go out of their way to be helpful. We were told we would have an adjoinong room,which wasn`t provided. The rooms were not that clean,marked rooms,untidy made beds, marked carpet, empty bottle of alcohol found under one bed. Views from one room,both windows looked straight into office blocks. The airconditioning wasn`t working in one of our rooms ,after three phone calls, we were finally moved to another room, five and a half hours later,at 10.30pm. Would not go back and wouldn`t recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not as posh as expected”
Reviews.Author: Arfan A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive and not as posh as expected. The furniture in the bedroom does not match at all with different coloured wood for the headboard to the closet to the table. The TV was not LCD as indicated on the website, and was located at the side (in the closet) of the bed instead of in front of the bed. Furthermore, the room is small for the price! The mattress is not ideal if you plan on having a 'romantic' night with your significant other. It was squeaking and unpleasant. However, the bathroom was excellent with a separate tub to take a bath. The lift to the carpark is small and has a horrible smell to it.

Reviews.Title: “great hide-away in the city”
Reviews.Author: Amelaur
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist, you want to be close enough to the rocks, the opera house & the bridge, also darling harbour so for a day or two, this hotel is really well located. Also convenient for shops.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A_Moose123
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Amora started off a little bit rocky with the staff putting us in a room that really did require a little more TLC. Room smelt very funny and there were watermarks throughout. Cupboards were still extremely dusty (not very pleasent for 2 very tall people) and there were large scratches on the furniture. Once we requested a change and moved to another room (which was MUCH nicer), we realised they had left some of our bags in the previous room. This didn't set the mood fantastically. Despite this, the new room was wonderful (beautiful bathrooms!) and everything functioned perfectly. Our friends were able to locate the hotel with ease and it was a short walk to the Rocks. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I want for my business trips”
Reviews.Author: Mr M
Reviews.Content: I always stay here for business trips and I can't fault it for the price on wotif. Polite and clean. Not five star but based on Thai hotels. Even the staff.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: MagicFamily
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Amora hotel. We had the most basic room bought through Expedia. The staff are efficient and courteous and our room was excellent. We had a king size bed which was extremely comfy with no extraneous noise making a good night's sleep. We also had a comfy chair and footstool, a telly which could be slid in and out and a luxurious bathroom with separate bath and shower. Our only gripes: the door to the bathroom was in fact a very elegant 2-door which didn't close tightly shut. Looked posh but meant there was no privacy once inside. Please also be advised that the internet is not free and the Playstation console option, which looks enticing, is a very expensive way of spending an evening. Overall though, a great find in the centre of town and we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Room”
Reviews.Author: Burgsey
Reviews.Content: As with many of my other reviews, I can only review what I expreienced, which may differ from others (so do take with a pinch of salt!). My wife and I stayed as part of a "Wotif" Deal. We did not dine or have breakfast or used the leisure facilities, and did not use the parking facilities, so must pass on these. Staff were polite and friendly. Room was well laid out (on the 7th floor - no view) but was "tired" with stained (but clean) carpets and curtains that you neeed to be a weight trainer to operate! Quite a lot of noise, due presumably to not ideal sound insulation between door and corridor. Having said that it was ok, just dissapointing for the level of hotel. Location very good, close to the City, Circular Quay, the Rocks, Darling Harbour etc, and this was a big plus Minor other Gripe: Lifts tended to have a bit of a mind of their own, not recognising our room card (others had the same problem). Wouldn't put anyone off staying here (at a Wotif price!), but would not suggest this is the best in the City - however we did feel we got value for monrey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy69Brisbane
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Christmas Eve at approx 9am. Well before the usual check in time. They checked us in early which I thought was very good of them. Our room was excellent with plenty of room. We upgraded to Club Lounge and Junior Suite. WiFi complimentary. All staff remember your name and drink preferences in the morning and evening, at valet parking, reception and house keeping. The hotel is close to Circular Quay and only a short walk to Sydney CBD. This hotel is very comfortable delux hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending. It offers excellent value for money and should be ranked substanially higher. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Personalised service, great location, value for what we paid on a misty deal.”
Reviews.Author: GeoffandAndrea
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights on a mistry deal at the Amora Jamison and it was faultless. We were a bit apprehensive at first after reading some of the comments on here, but once we arrived we were quite surprised at the level of Personalised service. Yes, it was a little quiet at the hotel, but we were acknowledged by the front desk team all the time. The room was clean and spacious and the best bit was the spacious bathroom with a bath and large shower. Having stayed in a few city hotels in Perth, Melbourne and Brisbane, this was by far the most spacious room with a proper king bed without that uncomfortable base and mattress. The housekeeping team could not be more courteous, making our room early afternoon and leaving a few extra herbal tea bags as we like our tea. Breakfast was a treat with the chef making us scrambled eggs and an omelet. We will tell our close friends who travel frequently about our stay and we will definetliy be staying here again. KH & GA (Adelaide)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: Mushfiq R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and the hotel was excellent. The rooms were large, as were the amenities. We had a small view of the Opera House from our room, which was a nice bonus. The gym/spa facilities were adequate, and relaxing whilst pouring down with rain outside. The location is good, and only a small walk to major attractions near the CBD. The only downside was parking. It was very cramped and expensive, but I guess typical for a hotel in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!! We want to keep it to ourselves.”
Reviews.Author: thengtiger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I regularly stay at the Amora on our special occasions - so when it came time to celebrating our wedding anniversary, this hidden gem was a no brainer. The staff went the extra mile for us, hiding a special secret treat in our room of chilled champagne and gorgeously packaged chocolate. Moreover, they upgraded us to one of the highest floors. Obviously, this will always be down to availability but we are certain that our wonderful Amora would have done their utmost to make sure we felt treated well. No other hotel in Sydney comes close to the standard of excellence in overseas hotels, but the Amora hits the mark. 6 star service! The only disappointment was going home.

Reviews.Title: “Try Mystery Hotel 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: RuralDreaming
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a mystery hotel deal which we thought was 5 stars. When we checked in we were told we were upgraded to a corner suite. The room was clean and tidy but the decor was very dated and quite rough. Having stayed at other 5 star hotels in Sydney this did not even come close. The room was small and the bed was uncomfortable. The best thing about the room was the bathroom which was of a very generous size with a freestanding bath. The room service was awful. We rang on Friday night around 11pm for 10 minutes. Finally we called the reception number from our mobile before someone answered the phone. The same thing happened when we tried to contact the valet service for our car on Sunday. They promote on their website and on in-room information that room service is 24 hours. Considering we didn't pay full rates and were upgraded it was reasonably good value for money, however it does not come close to the 5 stars it promotes and I can think of other hotels in the city that are a true 5 star that only cost a little bit extra. I would not stay here again and as it was the first time I tried a mystery hotel I am hesitant to try again.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyboyFinland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in November. Excellent situation, nearby you can find all the best department stores, parks and the Circular Quay is within walking distance. Try the set menus in the hotel restaurant, good food with excellent value for money. Rooms are clean and nice. Only minus side is, that the wifi does not work in the rooms and in the lobby you need to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Well established,convenient and comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russell4220
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the city to attend a Xmas party. We found the hotel very comfortable with friendly staff and convenient to the harbourside activities.Our room was well appointed and the general ambience matched the Hotel's 5 star rating. Russell & Jane Sydney

Reviews.Title: “"Business Style 5*"”
Reviews.Author: duke_star11
Reviews.Content: stayed at the amora with my partner and was impressed with the packages on offer, was trying to decide what was better the seafood buffet or the run away package definitely value in both. the rooms do need some minor work but lived up to my expectations, the reviews for those who paid full price do differ from those who were looking for a bargain, i was given complimentary upgrades to a corner room which is normally extra $40.00. thank you will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “A real mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: cmchi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Amora on a number of occasions over the past five years - generally when my preferred hotels have been unavailable. There are a number of aspects that are quite positive; deep bath with a view, comfortable bed, dinky wooden cabinets with receding doors The food in the "better" restaurant is delicious but over priced for what it is. I'd like to see some gluten free options on the room service menu. Location wise it is quite central but really awkward to get to...like much of Sydney...it involves hills, one way streets...you can see it in the distance but it just seems to get further and further away. In my recent stay the Amora really let themselves down by giving me a room with a horrific looking stain on the carpet. It was possibly coffee but it did look quite gruesome and was still damp. I can't understand why it wasn't cleaned better and covered up with a rug - it really ruining the vibe of what was otherwise a great looking room

Reviews.Title: “Where did 5 Star Come From”
Reviews.Author: Fusion14
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a mystery hotel deal, and were excited when we found out it was this horel. However as the stay progressed we were very disappointed. The room was old, the bedspread had threads everywhere, bits missing from the architraves. The carpet had stains on it, the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, the desk in the room had a large scratch on the side, a picture in the hallway was cracked. The cocktails were tiny and expensive and they over charged us. The elevator to the carpark was not work on arrival. Overall, we would believe it to be a 3 Star at best, maybe as a mystery hotel booking you get the sub-standard rooms. . . . . Very, very disappointed and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see why it has copped so many poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: Birdie56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amora on a Friday night recently, paying $280 through Wotif. (There was nothing cheaper at that end of Sydney CBD at the time I was looking and so I thought I would give it a go.) From the moment we pulled up in our car, the staff were very friendly and efficient. The room (on the 30th floor) was quite big and I loved the bathroom. It was spacious and very modern, with a separate bath that could have come out of an up-market bathroom showroom. The bed was very comfortable. I had been apprehensive after reading reviews referring to small and tired rooms. Perhaps we had been lucky in the room we were allocated. The carpet was the only thing that looked a little jaded, with a couple of marks (red wine spills perhaps?). However, I doubt I would have noticed if I had not read the criticism of the rooms and was wondering why. I did not try the gym or restaurants this time and so can't comment on whether the hotel deserves 4 or 5 stars but I would be happy to stay there again. The biggest plus was being in a quiet street - the CBD can be noisy on Friday night. Tip: The expresso bar next door in Jamison St makes a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: bsandds
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't be more helpful and the hotel was in a great downtown location. The rooms were quite large and tastefully decorated. As we found all over Australia internet service is not the best and they don't offer wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star? Not by my standards!”
Reviews.Author: rickorick
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I can't agree with the 5 Star rating.... Romantic boutique Hotel, I don't think so.... It was a basic 4 Star hotel with a simple room by my ratings. The location is good but the rooms are very simple and in need of a freshen up.

Reviews.Title: “Barely a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Ozmanian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not even close to being a 5 star property. It is all about expectation management - it would be a decent 3.5 star or perhaps even a 4 star at a stretch but a 5 star it is not. A good central location but short on service and the rooms are very tired. The concierge did not know of any Greek restaurants anywhere in Sydney. Had to ask him to check the Restaurant Guide that was sitting on the desk - there were at least 3 within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. A basic English Breakfast is $40 pp - the property next door does a good EB for less than $20. Definitely not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mcittc
Reviews.Content: Purchased as mystery CBD hotel. Had a lovely twin corner room on 11th floor. Lovely, quiet and clean with comfy beds. Delish dinner at Charr with great service. Lovely food at the casual restaurant with service lacking. All in all a pleasant surprise - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are in need of redecorating”
Reviews.Author: LionHongKong
Reviews.Content: We booked as a mystery hotel on lastminute and paid $270 for the night. For the price I definitely expected more from our room. The decor was very tired - looked like what I would expect from a 3 star hotel. The lifts were also troublesome and had to get a new key cut twice because it wouldn't work in the lift - and we were only there for 1 night! On the plus side the concierge were friendly and helpful and the common areas look a million times better than the room. I have lived in Sydney previously and stayed in a few different hotels in the last few years - I wouldn't stay here again unless I knew that all the rooms had been renovated or it was half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location - Strange Lift System”
Reviews.Author: Sammone40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 30th of October until the 6th of November. First impression when arriving is thta it was very close to the centre of the city, has a nice lobby, reasonably good variety of guests staying there. Was given a corner room which was a lot better than the one my colleague was staying at which had a cubicle feel to it. I think the room was around 400sq ft for around AUD350 per night without discounts. Room service was excellent as was the quality of food. Also the service at the bar downstairs was excellent. The gym was quite poor for a hotel of that price. Did not try the Spa. Guest Services were always very friendly and helpful EXCEPT when they botched up our booking at Huricane's Bar & Grill and we ended up waiting an hour and a half for a table. You'd think that for a hotel at this price they would be able to manage that. Was centrally located so about ten minutes walk to darling harbour, ten minutes to The Rocks twenty minutes to the Harbour. Very close to Wynyard Station and cabs always waiting outside as well which was a plus. Very comfortable rooms though the top of the cupboard was dirty, toilet cistern leaked (no noise just seemed like a waste of water despite two attempts by maintenance to repair), the `Pillow Menu` was lovely and the rooms were generally very clean and well designed. One thing would have been nicer is if the desk did not have such a worn look to it. The lift system is really strange (but seems standard at the other hotel I stayed in Australia) where you'd get three people in a lift going to different floors and a card security system that usually meant by the time the first person had entered their floor the other two had missed theirs.
