All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Nice Tidy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: storm_fan1998
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel for work quite a lot and would recommend it for travellers and those wanting to stay in a central location to the CBD. The rooms are tidy and beds comfortable with a good choice of pillows. The check in and check out was quick and getting a taxi is no issue as the guys at the entrance will get you one very quickly. Do not get them to book one of their private vehicles as they are more expensive and not any better than a standard taxi. The hotel is central to the CBD and a short cab ride to Surrey Hills will give you a good choice of restaurants etc. The continental buffet for breakfast was okay..probably not worth the price and the variety was not great. You could get better at a cafe in the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a mystery 5 star deal for our anniversary, we arrived and all was OK until we got to the room, first thing we noticed was what looked like feces on the bed head and then look on the chair in the corner and there was massive skid marks in the middle of the chair, the cupboards where falling apart and the decor was well past it's date, so we rang front desk and they where quick to change our room, but that room had what looked like sperm stains on the floor and the curtain was torn and falling down, we sat on the bed and something went bang underneath. So we cut our losses and booked back out of the hotel, with not much care from assistant manager either, lucky we got another hotel on short notice. We did manage to get a refund a couple of days later through the booking agent lucky. But 5 star hotel this is not, how it got 5 stars also I would question also, don't risk the disappointment on this one, it is the first hotel I have ever refused to stay at and hopefully the last.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellor_7
Reviews.Content: I stay here, not by choice, on a regular basis. I can't really find anything to complain about, but equally, nothing to rave about. It is "ordinary", but the rates seem to be 5 Star! The rooms are a little on the small side (compared to other 5 Stars). I guess my biggest gripe would be the all-in-one joinery (Robe, mini bar, tea/coffee, safe, storage, etc) in every room -poorly designed and not very user-friendly. Bed is fine, bathroom good. In summary, comfortable, but un-spectacluar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Hippychic65
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Sydney began with arrival at the Amora Jamison earlier than the usual check in time but we were lucky enough to have our room ready for us. We were shown to the fourth floor and found ourselves in a spacious room, very well appointed, with a HUGE bathroom and a very comfortable bed. Only downside would be our commanding view of some gravel, cunningly placed to look decorative but as this was the only issue, there's really nothing to complain about. We busied ourselves for the rest of the day sightseeing and getting to know Sydney. This hotel is in a FANTASTIC location, very central to everything and only 5 minutes walk to the harbor and circular quay. As Jamison is a laneway, we had no traffic noise whatsoever which I am told is very unusual for Sydney. The next morning we indulged in a buffet breakfast with plenty on offer and the promise of freshly cooked eggs any way you like them which arrived hot and delicious to the table. Coffee and Tea is made fresh and delivered to you in large individual pots. Wonderful and no need to flag a passing staff member for refills. Our plan was to stay for 2 nights but thanks to a small problem with our airline (something about grounding the entire fleet) we were obliged to extend our stay by an extra 2 nights. It was during this time that the Amora came into it's own. To stay that the staff were helpful would be the understatement of the millennia!!!! They moved mountains to help us, assisting with extending our stay and allowing us to keep our existing room so no packing up and moving was required. Words cannot express how wonderful the staff were and how much we appreciated all their help. Our memories of Sydney are not in any way tainted by the airlines grounding but focus instead on the wonderful service we received at the Amora Jamison. When next in Sydney I would throughly recommend the Amora Jamison Hotel, for it's location, facilities and most of all it's wonderfully caring staff, who give a new meaning to the word "service".

Reviews.Title: “Booked as a 4 star on Hotwire.com”
Reviews.Author: cassidy24
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night before we left for the airport, so I booked a mystery hotel on Hotwire.com that was labeled four stars for $209. I was not thrilled when the name came up, since the reviews were fair at best. The good news is that we had a very high floor and a harbor view, and the location was wonderful. The bad news is that the walls were scuffed up, the blanket was scratchy, the light wouldn't turn off in the cabinet and the phone by the bed didn't work. In other words, not four stars. I would call it a three at best. For a business traveler, it is a good value for a downtown location. For a pleasure traveler, there are better hotels. I think that most of their business is booked on mystery hotel sites that should be sued for calling this property four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,very professional,great free eats”
Reviews.Author: oliviadavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Nov2009. Great little free eats when you upgrade. It was well worth it and saved us a lot of money. Sydney is very expensive. Nice free happy hour too. We had a corner suit that looked out over the harbor. The room was extremely modern and clean, also very quiet. I stayed there with my 2 year old and walked everywhere. Staff very helpful. Also huge bathroom and from the tub had a view of the city( really awesome).

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: ABColby
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business and upon arrival was greeted by some lovely flowers which were organised by my hubby who was back home on our anniversary, the concierge had personally gone out and purchased them on behalf of my husband as he had very short notice. The service offered by this hotel went far beyond any expectations, best I have experienced in a long time. Would recommend amd will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend excellent three days.”
Reviews.Author: Work&Play1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here via a Wotif Mystery deal booking. From the moment we arrived the service was outstanding and attentive from every staff member encountered from the door attendant to management. On check in we asked if there were any upgrades available and were offered the Jamison Club at $70.00 per night and a higher floor room, 34th which it the top floor. The upgrade was well worth the money with: nightly drinks and canapes, free internet and breakfast. Also tea and coffee througout the day with pastries which we did not try. Pocation is great for tourist or business given its location in the CBD but also access to the Rocks and Circular Quay. We were in Sydney for a family function and were able to catch a ferry to where we needed to go. Good eating at the Rocks, especially Peter Doyles at the Cruise Terminal, excellent value compared adjacent resturants. Overall a great long weekend enhanced by the service at the Amora. PS rooms are a little tired but clean and well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the quiet street off George Street. The location is excellent. It's only 5 minute walk to the Circular Quay and Pitt Street Mall. Since it's off the main street, you don't get the traffic noise or the nightclub music at night. The service at the hotel is excellent. The room is clean. We have booked this room through Wotif secrete hotel which was $220 per night. We were given a room with disabled access. The positives were it is spacious especially the bathroom. It's quiet, it's elegant. The king size bed was comfortable. The only negative is because it has disabled access, the sink is low and there weren't a lot of shelves and benches but overall it's a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Discreet hotel, good service, older rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently October 2011 for a business trip for three days. Rooms are functional if a little small, no wow factor. Annoyed that Internet use was $9.95 per hour, really a bit of a price gouge. Very close to rail underground which is the only way to get around Sydney, Well developed rail system. The hotel is very close to QVB so great shopping. We thinknthey used latex rubber matress which we find excellent for sleep. Will stay at sir Stamford next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Rafalicious80
Reviews.Content: Had a corner room - nice spacious. TV in weird place though and small. Bathroom clean with a window. service good. breakfast - poor variety, only once there was a chef doing omlettes. Expect more from a 5 star hotel breakfast. Concierge and recepton really helpful. Received free 20min access to internet at business lounge to check-in for flight. Close to Opera Housa and train station. Had a good deal from Wotif and upgraded the room to a corner one on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't forget to draw blinds when in bathtub!”
Reviews.Author: Bharatvanshi
Reviews.Content: Overall a good 5 star hotel with a beautiful black marble style bathroom and good facilities generally except for a a major let down being the TV- it was a small one and worst of all, it was inside a cupboard so you had to open a door to watch TV! You had to watch it from your bed which isn't great if you prefer to sit on a couch. Location is convenient, but downside is that the views from your window can be pretty terrible. A few sides are inches away from an office buildign, so you'll look directly into an office building from your bedroom or even you transparent bathroom window!!! I can't help but wonder how many office workers have been (un)lucky enough to have a clear view of someone having a bath from their desks at work! Overall a decent hotel I was glad to pay 'mystery hotel' rates for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: Got this for 2 nights in a deluxe King room on a Secret Deal at lastminute.com. Really good deal. We got a great room on the 11th floor. Service was exceptional. Room was more than we excepted after reading some of the more negative reviews. Our experience was nothing like some have mentioned. We got room-service pronto everytime, no dramas. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Reception was more than helpful and the location is amazing. Easy access to everything. Would recommend this for sure. Service: 5/5 Room: 4/5 Location: 5/5 Overall: 4.5/5

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Runninguy1011
Reviews.Content: Unlike some other reviewers I would give this hotel 5 stars but then the fact that we were upgraded to a park view suite has coloured my judgement. The room was very spacious and the bathroom particularly large. I especially liked how quiet the room was considering how noisy some places are and how Sydney CBD can be noisy at night. The service was fast friendly and professional. The location is great. The facilities were modern and well serviced. The only negatives were that the gym was on the small side for such a large hotel and there was no wi-fi either paid or free. Overall I would be happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and position”
Reviews.Author: brissietravellers
Reviews.Content: The Amora was a great choice for 2 nights in Sydney. Never knew it existed and now i do, it will be my choice when staying in Sydney. Position is excellent, rooms are very big, very quiet and we had a great view from the top floor (didnt pay extra either!). Treat yourself to a drink in the lobby bar to get the nuts that they give you - by far the best nuts/nibbles i have ever tasted. Once noticable thing for me was the service - from check-in to the bar staff to the front door men, there are staff everywhere and they are all excellent (sometimes hard to find in oz hotels compared to os). Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnycoast10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amora in sydney last weekend ( we usually stay at The Observatory,) we found that Amora on Jamison is perfectly positioned for city shopping, walking distance to the Rocks, and close the the Harbour Bridge. We were offered an "up-grade" to a Jamison Club King room, this we found was great value. We not only got a room on the top floor ( it has 34 floors), but a Club room gives you unlimited access to the library, reading/dining room, where Canapes and drinks are complimentary ( with no limit to drinks ( within reason!) , tea, coffee and muffins/pastries available all day, breakfast is also included in the upgrade currently $90 per room per night. We would definately stay here again, the staff were so friendly and efficient, our room was spotlessly clean, the hotel in general is super clean but we never saw the room cleaners or their carts in any hallways or on any floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey W
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at the Amora, with a group of friends and my mum! From the time that we arrived we did not touch a door handle!!! Very impressive service! My mum is gluten free and being so, she finds it difficult at times to pick food suitable! The restaurant managers went above the call of duty and went through the food with her on the buffet and breakfasts, so she knew what she could eat. The food was very imporesssive, fabulous breakfasts and seafood dinner on Saturday night, a must! Awesome location! Close to the water and a stone throw away from awesome shopping. Room cleaned daily, concierge was amazing, Will be back! Didn't want to leave! The only thing that I thought it relaly needed was a pool upgrade! Otherwise lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: evertonbilly
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute and was not disappointed. Been to better 5 star hotels but this was a basic room so not complaining. Location is good and you have all the usual amenities in your room. Would definently recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very good Except....”
Reviews.Author: KennyLauer
Reviews.Content: In general I was very happy with my stay. The staff was friendly and attentive and the food was excellent. It is in a great location to access to the major attractions and right next to a great mall and food court. I will not stay there again, though, because the internet speed was unacceptable. First they didn't have wireless which for US travelers wanting to use their iphone or ipad was very disappointing. But that would be ok if their wired internet access was fast. It isn't. It took me hours to send a file to my colleagues and no videos would stream. I was there on business and it was almost impossible to get things done. So, good on all things, but let me down big time on the most important thing to a business traveler these days...fast internet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, and a bit classy”
Reviews.Author: flipperPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for business. Got upgraded to a suite style room, which was quite spacious and comfortable, with a good bathroom, 2 TV's etc. Had the cooked breakfast each day which was reasonable quality for a hotel buffet, but ate out each night - recommend the Chinese on the corner!

Reviews.Title: “If location is important....”
Reviews.Author: Bigbear072
Reviews.Content: If location is important to you, then the Amora Hotel Jamison in Sydney may be worth the weight in gold. When I travel to Sydney, I need somewhere central and close to my work. Food, entertainment and shopping are all close by. A short walk from the Darling Harbour Precint and Circular Key. The rooms are comfortable with all the facilities you expect. The staff are pleasant to deal with and assist with any queries you may have. The only disappointment is wifi is not complimentary for hotel guests. It is at other hotels close by though. The Amora needs to look at new and inviting enticements they can present to continue bringing in business colleagues who use them as a hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at again.”
Reviews.Author: Katelyn C
Reviews.Content: We booked on a mystery deal and I assure you the biggest mystery is how this hotel has receieved a 5 star rating. The quality of service was extremely poor. I ordered a bottle of wine to the room because the bar closed early and 30 mins later I called to cancel it as it still hadn't arrived. The mattress was thin, the linen was dirty and so were the robes. The service button on the phone was either engaged or no-one answered. I only stayed one night and it was amazing the amount of problems we encounted. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eoin L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerandjosie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 6 years ago when it was a Rydges Hotel and we stayed again in September 2011. The location is excellent : within easy walking distance of the Quayside, Opera House etc. Everything is very comfortable : the rooms, the staff.... excellent concierge. We will stay here again on our next visit to Sydney in March 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything in the city”
Reviews.Author: AdelePh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay a night in the city so that we can spend the night enjoying dinner and drinks with some mates in the city. We decided to stay at the Amora Jamison given the location of the hotel and frankly the price was right. We paid just under $200 for the night (Friday night). The checking in was easy, hassle free. We got our room upgraded given that it was a special occasion that we were celebrating. We had a room on the 20th floor and it was spacious. The bed was lovely and the separate living area was nice and quite large. The bathroom was great, clean and we had a bath tub and a separate shower. Overall, we couldn't fault the place. I asked for a late check out given our big night out and the hotel accommodated our request without any hassle. We found the hotel to be clean and all in all, it met all our expectations. Location wise, it was perfect, it is close to The Rocks as well as the city strip. We went to the Argyle for night out and dinner at Sake, so the location was perfect for us. The hotel was surprisingly quiet and not noisy as others suggested. We would stay there again if we decided to have another big night out with our mates!

Reviews.Title: “Triple C! Convenient, comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: jam_aus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Amora Jamison as a Wotif mystery deal. We found the hotel to be excellent value and well located for our needs. We went to Sydney to see the Swans play and it was an easy train trip to Central to meet the buses to the game, as an arcade to Wynyard tunnel is right near the front door of the hotel. Alternatively we could have taken a bus up nearby George St, which we did when returning from dinner with friends in Glebe. In the morning it was an easy amble to Circular Quay for a lovely breakfast by the harbour, followed by a leisurely stroll through the Botanic Gardens and back to the hotel.We didn't have any cause to move our car from the secure parking which was subsidized by our hotel booking. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The only minor complaint I have is that the bed, although large and luxurious, was a little too soft for my liking- but I guess that my personal taste is for a hard mattress. We found the staff friendly and helpful- particularly as I forgot to bring my licence for ID which is required for a Wotif booking! (In the end they transferred the booking into my partner's name as he had his ID with him). I would definitely stay at the Amora Jamison again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: seal_loves_holidays
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel after booking on wotif.com for a mystery hotel. I have read a number of the other reviews and have to say our experience was not necessarily the same. We had a corner room on the 29th floor. Twin beds as requested. Furniture was in good condition. Rooms were clean and smelled fresh. Also the room was very quiet. We did not hear street noise like others have. For a Saturday night, we appreciated not hearing traffic or people late at night. The bathroom was beautiful. Lovely deep bath if you felt that way inclined. The shower was amazing. Great water pressure, non stop hot water - and i mean hot, not just warm! Beds were very comfortable. Unusual for a twin bed arrangement and we both had a great night sleep. We did not eat at the hotel or use the internet. Agree that the internet price looked expensive - $9.95 per hour so I'm glad we didn't need it! The staff were lovely. Nothing was too much trouble. Friendly, attentive but not ridiculously over the top. For us, the close proximity to Wynyard station - a short walk after taking the train from the airport, close to shopping and Darling Harbour, and the price on wotif.com around $200 for the night it suited us. We didn't want or need anything else and for this particular weekend, there were no other hotels in the same price range. 4*, 5* we didn't care. It was an effortless, lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but NOT a 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gustypants
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as 5 star (we booked a lastminute.com surprise package) but it is nowhere near as good as its local competition (Four Seasons etc.). The location is perfect, situated a short walk from the shops, Circular Quay and even Darling Harbour but the rooms, especially the upholstery, are dirty, the decor is drab and a whole bunch of stuff did not work â€“ we had to have the air-conditioning fixed on arrival and had to make a special request for a DVD player. I am fairly sure this used to be a Ridges Hotel and it is clear that the new owners have done nothing to improve the hotel other than stick new logos over the old. On the plus side the staff was excellent. If it was advertised as a 4 star hotel you would be suitably impressed but those of you accustomed to genuine 5 star accommodation will almost certainly will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: lingaz
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel in a great location. A stone's throw away from the Rocks and Darling Harbour. Everything in the room is hidden away in a cupboard, which is odd - however you get used to it. The bathroom is large with a stand-alone shower and bath tub. It is very clean and the room is well furnished with modern design. I'd recommend this place for a short stay in Sydney, if you're only planning to stay around the city area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, centrally located, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Amyrlin
Reviews.Content: An unexpected pleasure, this hotel is centrally located in Sydney within walking distance of Circular Quay (if going east), Darling Harbour (going west), and spitting distance (to the north) of the Rocks. My room was spotless; a large bathroom with separate bath; quiet, and very comfortable with a delightful view out to an inner city children's playground - several stories up. Welcome to inner city living. Reception was polite and efficient and the concierge very helpful; directing footsteps and helping to plan walking tours; connecting wish lists with achievable goals in limited time frames; coordinating sitting in the bar with a drink - with the assistance of helpful bar staff - while waiting for the transfer to the airport. Although I know it looks very untidy - because everyone stands outside with a fag in their mouth looking miserable - I was professionally very impressed seeing people standing outside smoking - because I saw no one inside smoking; lifts, bars, corridors, reception rooms . . . Is this hotel a truly non-smoking hotel? I did not eat in this hotel so cannot comment on the food or service, and my only grizzle would be the usual. Queuing at the cocktail bar in the evening to buy a drink and being ignored because one is a small single foreign looking female. It happens everywhere - otherwise this would have been close to perfect. Perhaps it was Australia. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DebDeb07
Reviews.Content: This is would be a good 4 star hotel, except that its supposed to be a 5 star hotel. The rooms are a bit old, the walls are scuffed, its a strange layout (the tv is next to the bed not at the end of the bed so its awkward to watch tv), the furniture doesn't match and the bathrooms are in need of updating. The location is ok, being near the rocks. But there wasn't any views from our room. Breakfast was pretty poor. It felt like a cafeteria (no white tableclothes as shown in their pictures), there wasn't much variety and there was certainly no made order eggs. If you get a very cheap price then stay here but certainly don't pay 5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were filthy and disgusting. Obvious black stains on the carpet and old and tired bedspreads.”
Reviews.Author: travelingconsultant1
Reviews.Content: Walk in the door to find two large black strains on the carpet. Bedspreads are worn and could be replaced. Best trying is the location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Qldstar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location in Sydney, close to the Rocks, Circular Quay and Sydney Shopping. The room offered amazing harbour views, particularly from the VERY comfortable tub chair & ottoman. Spacious room, large bathroom. Conceirge, club lounge and housekeeping staff were all a great asset to the hotel and helped make my work trip a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard of cleanliness let the hotel down”
Reviews.Author: HJM001
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights to attend an interstate conference and book at triple room to accomodate myself two friends for a girls weekend. We arrived around 1pm and the original room they had allocated was not ready so we were allocated a room on the 27th floor. We arrived in the room and the bed linen on the twin beds was very dated - one bed had dried detergent stains and the other bed had a hole on the centre of the bed cover. The carpet was torn and the blind at the window was also torn. We had paid full price not a mystery deal or any other offer. We asked to move rooms which we did - in the second room they delivered the rollaway for the third person which we made up with a blanket from the cupboard - which had not been cleaned - it was covered in long black hairs. We obtained a clean blanket and changed the rollaway because the sheets were also covered in hairs. The bathroom had not been cleaned properly as there were short black hairs in the bathtub. We did not eat in the hotel - the reception and concierge and door staff were all very helpful and friendly but unfortunately the standard of cleanliness was appalling - I have had cleaner rooms in much lower starred hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: I was here from 17 August to 21 August, (4 nights) I was coming home to Melbourne from Townsville and had decided to spend 5 days visiting friends in Sydney and use it as an excuse to visit the Blue Mountains Jenolan Caves and Hunter Valley on day trips. When i was initially looking for hotels Sydney is a really expensive city and i found a lastminute.com.au 5 star mystery hotel deal for $210 a night. I figured i'd risk it hoping it was something other than the Swissotel (See previous review). Once booked When i saw it was the Amora Jamison i had never heard of it and i'll admit i was a little unnerved by the reviews. The day finally arrived and once flying into Sydney i jumped on the Airport Link train and got off at the closest station (Wynyard) it was about a block and a half walk. From the outside the building looks really tall and like it was built in may be the late 70's, early 80's? I proceeded into the lobby, First impressions good and it had a very airy and upmarket look to it, The girl at check in was very bubbly and friendly and i get issued Room 2810. (28th floor) Once in the lift i discover the hotel is actually 34 stories high, and i get excited thinking of my potential view. Once i get off the lift and to my room i open the door and walk in, My room itself....It was clean, a VERY comfortable bed and there is a huge entertainment wall unit with multiple compartments which contains the Tv, Minibar, Storage space, etc Unfortunately the tv can't be manouvered though (At least not from what i could see) so you can't really watch tv from bed unless you crane your neck to the right. The tv had about 20 channels including some cable channels, But who goes to Sydney to watch tv? My room was a little bit worn carpet wise and a couple of wear and tear on the walls, My view is partial and mainly overlooks the office tower opposite (Beware if you have the window open they can see you and vice versa) and also has a partial view of the bridge area and Circular Quay. The curtains fold down to give you enough privacy. In all honesty the room is probably more of a 4 star standard. The bathroom has a seperate Bath and Shower with Hydro tolietries, Housekeeping forgot to restock mine one day but a quick phonecall and they came up to replace them. The bathroom is very nice and spacious. I never used the gym but i used the pool and spa (Open until 10:30pm) a few nights, These areas are definitely what i'd call 5 star, The pool has a roman kind of a feel to it and a neat feature wall with water trickling down it, The Spa is huge and very relaxing and they also have sauna facilities The location is great, An easy 10 minute walk to Darling harbour, The Rocks, Sydney Opera House and all the major tourist attractions. Or for retail therapy Pitt Street and George Street have you covered! On to my tours, I booked through Viator and my first full day tour was Blue Mountains/Jenolan Caves through Australian Pacific Touring. I HIGHLY recommend this tour, The Blue Mountains are extremely pretty and once you get out to Jenolan Caves they are just stunningly beautiful with lots of caverns to explore, My second tour also with Australian Pacific Touring was to the Hunter Valley, After a stop through Woolombi, it was on for wine tasting at Lindemans, followed by the Hunter Valley resort and then McGuigans followed by a trip to a local chocolate shop (yummy!) it was also a great tour, both tours picked up at 7am and dropped me back at the hotel (Pending rush hour in Sydney) at 8pm, so they were both long days but as i said especially for international tourists who may want to see our rural areas it's definitely worth it! Here's a tip: For those who don't want to eat in the city and get a more localised experience jump on the train and travel to an inner city suburb called "Newtown" it has some great restaurants, bars and cafe's and will give you a more in depth look into life in Sydney. The whole 5 days in my room i never heard my neighbours and check out was smooth and they were happy to hold my bags whilst i filled in time before i headed off to the airport as my flight wasnt until 2pm. (And i recommend the Airport train link at $15 one way) Like i said it wasn't the most luxurious hotel but for a place to rest your head and explore i'd definitely be happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ellemic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amora Hotel for 3 nights on a short break holiday. The Hotel I thought was in a good location, close walk to circular quay and darling harbour. Also walking distance to the shops. The service at the front desk was good. Had no complaints really. The room itself I thought was quite good too. I stayed in a deluxe twin room. Room could have been a bit bigger and the television would have been better suited in front of the beds, not on the side. Apart from that I thought the room was fine. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The best thing was the breakfast, plenty of food to choose and great variety. Would definitely stay here again if I come back to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Not as lovely as I had remembered.. still good though”
Reviews.Author: HappyGlamper
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here a few years ago so thought I would stay again. The room i had was a king corner room and the bathroom is wonderful but the room itself didn't seem that much bigger than a standard room. Can't really fault the hotel as it does all the things a big hotel does. Fairly nice however I got quite sick during the night (not hotels fault) so when I checked I was feeling very sorry for myself. It made me aware that upon check out the assistant manager (I think i saw that on his tag) did not even ask me how the stay was - just took my money and handed me my reciept and said - thanks... not really 5 star treatment. Nice hotel however I think that the 4 seasons up the road is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have had in a long time! Stay elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: AllanCanberra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past and have been relatively happy but after last night I will not be back again. I missed a connecting flight out of Sydney yesterday evening and needed to find a hotel room for the night. I booked a special Mystery Deal on Wotif and was allocated the Amora Hotel in Jamieson Street. After checking in at the hotel I was horrified to discover that I had been allocated a disabled room (room 705). The room was very poorly designed and water flooded everywhere. The room was very tired and run down more like a two star hotel and certainly not five stars. In addition, the hot water was at best only lukewarm with very little pressure. Lukewarm water for a disabled room is understandable as a disabled person may have problems regulating the temperature and flow. For an able bodied businessman it is totally unsuitable. Furthermore, I was woken by loud banging on my door at 6:30am in the morning. Room Service was waking me up to try and deliver a breakfast I had not even ordered. I didn't even receive an apology for the early morning interruption. This hotel is lousy and not suited to the business and leisure traveler. Do not stay here! I am passing my comments on to the hotel management. There is much better value to be found elsewhere, again do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights recently before a friends wedding. The hotel itself is fairly nice but the "king size bed" was TERRIBLE! It was just 2 single beds zipped together. Very uncomfortable. The carpet in the room was in desperate need of cleaning but otherwise the room was neat and tidy. The service we recieved from the staff was mixed, most were friendly. The best part of the hotel is the buffet breakfast, all of the staff there were lovely and the food was great. For the money I would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sheridan318
Reviews.Content: we had an exceptionaly great time at this hotel, the service was excellent and the staff couldnt do more if you asked them

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as i thought”
Reviews.Author: bookmarks42
Reviews.Content: We got this holiday through a mystery deal at wotif.com. I was concerned after reading the reviews thinking that we were going to stay in a filthy dump. It wasnt that bad. The staff are ok, we got upgraded to a room with a balcony for an extra fee. As for the room, it was pretty standard, but clean. Decor is a little dated but that didnt matter. In a good location and central to shops and attractions. Swimming pool was ok but over crowded with children and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Clouds10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, lobby and restuarants very nice. Rooms however not worth a 5 star price

Reviews.Title: “top notch for location & price”
Reviews.Author: foodies1
Reviews.Content: WOW. We spent a long time researching wotif, TA etc for somewhere to have a long weekend in Sydney and I think Amora ticked almost all the boxes. It was a good price, high quality hotel with an exceptional location. The staff were all very professional and friendly and the breakfast was good. For the price and location I don't think you could fault it. We did have a small problem with the water one morning however that was a burst main and not the hotel's fault. We did get a note slipped under our door warning us to have showers NOW. So they attempted to keep guests informed without being too intrusive. Also given its location and size it was amazingly quiet. We had a big night one night and managed to snooze away quite happily. Oh only gripe but a small one not sure about the entertainment unit being in the cupboard. We were unable to see the TV very well but we were not there to watch tv so as I said only a small gripe. Overall thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely winter get-away”
Reviews.Author: GrizzlyAdams78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jamison for our 3rd year wedding anniversary with a wot-if deal which included buffet breakfast and complimentary bottle of wine! We stayed for two nights (Saturday and Sunday night for $472). Room was clean and modern. Bed nice and comfy with a pillow menu included. Bathroom clad in black and white tiling for a great New York feel with large bath and shower. Great location near Circular Quay and walking distance to other City attractions (Belgium Beer Cafe - yum!). Parking a little costly ($38/day) but well worth it for the service, style and delicious buffet breakfast which included miso soup! LOVED IT, what a great little hide-away in the City.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but a great location”
Reviews.Author: email_iandsmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 1 night only so only a very limited experience. The staff were pleasant and friendly but the room felt a little dated and in need of a refurb. The hotel is very close to office buildings so the view from my room was pretty muck looking straight into an office. You are literally close enough to see what is on their computer. The bathroom was large in my twin single room and the room clean was tidy. The location is excellent with a 30 second walk to George St and a 10 minute walk to The Rocks and harbour. This means you are not far from restaurants and bars. Also only 3 minutes walk to Winyard Station for commuting purposes,. If you could get a room with a view I am sure this could be a great hotel for the money but I was left feling a little dissapointed with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Luke B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary via the Wot Mystery Deal, but was shocked to find that the room we were given was the disabled accessible room (that obviously no one else wanted). Furthermore the bathroom was designed poorly leading the whole bathroom to flood when the shower was used! Furthermore the carpet was stained and very dusty at the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location and value”
Reviews.Author: dratsz
Reviews.Content: Decent business class hotel. Rooms were slightly aged but the good sized bath and grohe shower makes up for it. Staff were polite and well-mannered. While you don't get scenic views, the location of the hotel is pretty good. There is a shopping mall next door with a food court and supermarket. The train station is nearby too. Circular Quay and Darling Harbour are within walkable reach. In a nutshell, forget the five star rating and expectations, the hotel while not perfect, does the job well given it's price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SilverGoddess47
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I have stayed here several times in the last couple years because it has a great location in the Sydney CBD. Easy walking distance to The Rocks, Circular Quay, the Opera House and Bridge, the Botanic Gardens and Cockle Bay. Also close to Pitt St and the main shopping precinct. The Staff we all very professional and the Spa was as awesome as last time! There is an indoor pool and spa pool. The Bar staff were also very amiable! We would definetly choose to stay here again. The bathroom is VERY nice and a good size. The room is pleasantly decorated and the king bed was lovely & soft! There is a supermarket next door now and Wynard railway station is next door too. The station is full of food court eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: fakem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night; needed a bed and wasn't too fussy so took advantage of the Wotif mystery hotel. To say I was wary after reading the reviews on here would be an understatement, however I think it's copped a pretty bad rap. The lobby is looking a little bit tired and the decor is a bit worn but the staff were friendly and courteous. My booking didn't exist when I checked in, however the receptionist was polite and upon presentation of my Wotif confirmation I was quickly checked in. The room was very nice though - everything seemed in decent condition, it was clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. The lounge had an obvious stain, but that was the only fault I found. All public areas seemed clean and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Christopher88
Reviews.Content: Whilst looking to have a romantic city getaway on a budget I booked this hotel through a booking site 'mystery deal'. Certainly wouldnt have been one of the first picks if I had to choose. But the price was cheap for what proposed to be a five star hotel. Arrived around 7pm on the Sat night to be greeted by the concierge with 'Welcome back Mr (insert)'. Fortunately my partner has a sense of humour as this not exacly the greeting you want when you come to a hotel for the first time on a romantic getaway. An eyebrow was raised though..... Then we were given a handicapped room with no bath. Part of the reason for the getaway was due to no bath in our apartment and this was a key reason for the night away (in the city we live in). I went back down to request a room with a bath and whilst a Sat night and the hotel was probably pretty full the concierge was absolutely fantastic, and professional (maybe they still thought I was a regular?!?) - and lets just say we were very happy with the next room (or should I say rooms....) - very nice. Then went down to the seafood buffet which included a free drink. The oceans have a little less life form in them after my efforts. Oysters, Balmain bugs, Prawns, Blue Swimmer Crab, BBQ Octopus - excellent. Whilst the actual restaurant lacks any vibe (its called Gallery Restaurant, would seat 300 and has only two lacklustre modern art paintings) the deal they have is pretty good if you like a good feed. All in all, a reasonable hotel and our experience which could have ended up leaving a sour taste was OK

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: ronnyk76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while going to a wedding in Sydney, The service was always excellent from every member of staff. The rooms were very clean and very well serviced and the Hotel is located well in the city not far from Circular Quay and The Rocks and just a short walk from Wynyard Station. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone as it has a nice atmosphere and is value for money. We slept very well and never had a complaint to make about noise from other rooms, the hallways etc.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: faith-cebu-sydney
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on lastminute saying it was a five star. Got a standard king room but was dissapointed. The lobby had stained worned out carpet and also in our room. The chairs had stains and the blinds were old and chappy on the sides. The cabinet was an old style (wooden) and not modern looking at all. It did not have the best bed covers and the pillows were hard as stones. We upgraded at the end and paid $40 on top. It did not feel comfortable or luxurious in there. And that is a five star, may I add. For a five star buffet breakfast, we were surprised that they did not have egg benedict included. Just simply OVER RATED! Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: CamD79
Reviews.Content: When a hotel has a pillow menu you know you've made the right choice! The Amora is the place I stay every time I am in Sydney for business. It has clean rooms and an excellent bathroom with a stand alone shower and bath. I have ordered room service on multiple occasions and each time I have been more than satisfied. They even give you a cold glass of lemon water and a little dish of m&m's. The only thing is the TV is of average quality, however I'm always too tired to watch it. PS - don't get a coffee out the front...it's less than average...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and staff overall a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: luxurylover112
Reviews.Content: Booked on Wotif - and like others a bit nervous to see what it would be like ..... it was not as immaculate as one would expect a five star hotel to be but we sure did have a lovely stay! The pool was great and the rooms spacious although a little tired I would say its a 4 star hotel but a great one. When I say tired I just mean carpet is due for a change and bathroom tiling could be redone otherwise very modern and well equipped! the lobby and foyers are beautiful and staff are gems:) Great stay on the whole and perfect location!:)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: I find it offensive to charge $25 a day for internet when it's as slow as dialup. Happy hour is good 5:30 - 6:30pm half price drinks in the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Understated hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: SkyHeron
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over the weekend in twin rooms. Booked through a mystery deal on Wotif, was definitely worth it. Overall was quite nice, with intelligent design - note the great use of slide-in cupboards/drawers, lighting facilities and spacious bathroom. Reception staff were helpful and room service was good - don't be afraid to dial 9 for guest services, which were very prompt. Also not sure how often during the day this happens but there were also a couple of smiling gentlemen who opened the front doors for us as well on a couple of occasions. Location is great, being a couple of minutes away from Wynyard Station and a short walking distance to the Rocks. Looks quiet and assuming from the outside but step in and it's got the aura of a grand hotel. From our room we could see the Centrepoint Tower and a high view of the street, although it probably wasn't the best possible view. Lift was a bit old, the screens could use an update but they felt secure enough and there was never a wait for the elevator - there were 5 of them. Room was pretty good, with smart use of the space available - one of the walls was a slide-in cupboard with multiple drawers/doors with everything you could need - drinks, fridge, safe, ironing board, wardrobe and TV on a swivel turntable with collapsible doors. The spacious bathroom had a full length bathtub, shower, sink, fold-out mirror and toilet with little hole-in-the-wall spaces for towels and shower gel/shampoo bottles. The beds were comfortable with multiple pillows for sitting up and for sleeping and bathrobes were convenient. Very nice lighting facilities, with a little slide-knob for brightness on the two bedside lamps and a master off switch. The bathroom also had a knob for TV loudness, although I didn't notice this being of use at all..? The climate control was useful but we found it was a bit slow to kick in. Only complaint was that we initially mistook the bedsheet for the sheet protector - it should have been put in a bit more firmly next time.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel perfect for a stopover or night in town”
Reviews.Author: Lasty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amora in June for one night before going overseas. The hotel is in a bit of a strange spot but the service was great. The rooms were large and appeared quite modern. There is not much of a view from the room other then another office building and part of the harbour bridge. We booked online on a discount website for a mystery hotel. I was happy paying around $170 a night but would probably stay somewhere else is it was the normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location for the CBD”
Reviews.Author: GaryJSydney
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the doormen, reception to housekeeping. Very comfortable room with access to a balcony. Walking distance to anywhere in the CBD. Great breakfast choices but didn't get a chance to sample the restaurant. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious and well-appointed with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bugglemum
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a Mystery Deal through Wotif, but had the most pleasant of surprises when we got there. First impressions in the foyer were fully consistent with the five star rating; attentive concierge and reception staff, everyone consistently friendly and willing to go to a little extra trouble to help. My 8yo daugter and I stayed there for one night in a twin standard room, and were overwhelmed by the spaciousness (both room and bathroom) the comfort (perfect climate control, lovely beds, separate deep bath and shower) and the great location right in the CBD, half-way between the GPO and Circular Quay. Guest amenities included an indoor swimming pool (too cold) a hot-tub spa (just right) and both wet and dry sauna rooms, right next door to a good little gym, and a salon offering a range of spa treatments (a little too pricey for our wallets). We only ate one meal there, room service at 1am after returning from the theatre, and whilst it was all perfectly cooked and enjoyable, for $58 it was very unimaginative - a piece of steak, half a cup of potato gratin, one skinned, cooked underripe tomato, plus some vege soup on the side. Otherwise, everything else was wonderful, and we'd definitely recommend the Amora Jamison to others, corporate or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Goldstars123
Reviews.Content: Bathroom shower had mould in tiles. Blinds were dusty and broken. Sheets were uncomfortable. Concierge had no idea about our limo pickup in the morning. Bar was tiny and only had roofers beer on tap despite advertising imported on tap.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable but missing the WOW”
Reviews.Author: Lickjimmy1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in an excellent location.. Close to George street , if Ur only going to be using the hotel to sleep and u can get it at a decent price then definitely consider this hotel. Paper in the morning always makes me happy as well ;)

Reviews.Title: “NOT 5 star, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: caramellokoala
Reviews.Content: We expected more from a 5 star rated hotel. We had a tiny view but nothing to get excited over. Our king size bed which consisted of two singles was way overdue for an upgrade. One side had no springs so consequently we had the worst sleep ever. ROOM 1812 just incase the hotel checks these reviews. We stayed two nights and the housekeeping service was disgraceful. The state they left our room in was as if two people were doing the work and only one of them did half the job. The TV was in the wardrobe which was useless yet there was a huge space on the wall in front of the bed where it would have fitted perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and views in central location. Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a few Sydney CBD hotels but never stayed nor heard of Amora Jamison until recently. I managed to score a great deal on wotif and thought it was worth a shot as it had a 5 star rating. Needless to say we were not disappointed on check in. It is very unassuming from the street, but when you enter into the hotel it packs quite a punch. We ended up on quite a high floor with absolutely stunning views over the harbour, city and anzac bridge. The views were great during the day and amazing with all the lights at night. The bathroom had a huge window, so you could enjoy the view from the bathtub - the bedroom had the same. The room itself (we were in a standard twin) was huge. It had a large foyer area with separate door which could be closed off at the bedroom. It was one of the quietest large hotels I had stayed in in a long time. This is hugely important as more often than not you are hearing the guests next door or above you and doors slamming/lifts etc. But once you were inside your room here, you didn't hear a peep. The beds were soft and the linen was crisp and clean. We had an issue with our tv (which turned out to be not plugged into the aerial at the back) and this was fixed quickly with no fuss. Check out was too easy also with a well managed and staffed line (which was short). We were served by a trainee who was super friendly and very efficient (making a nice change from when you generally tend to get trainees who take FOREVER...) Apparently theres a heated indoor pool and day spa which we didn't get to try. We did however try the gym which was great and well equipped. The hotel is well located right next to Wynyard Station/Met Centre so equally accessible to Circular Quay and Town Hall/QVB/Pitt St Mall (which are both around a 6-7 minute walk) We would definitely not hesitate in staying here again. The only downside I could note is the shower pressure was not very good at all and parking at $48 was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near the standard of a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Briano74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here December 2008. I have to say I found the hotel to be ageing and staff to be generally unhelpful. I had driven up from Melbourne with my 6 months preganant wife. On arrival, check-in was a rather prolonged and mechanical procedure. The room we got was like a box. I opened the door to look at the old-school TV - I would have expected a flat screen in a 5 star. The wooden door fell off the press and we had to get a workman up to fix it. The lift to the carpark was broken, so I had to go down a few flights to get my wife's and my own luggage and drag it up. No offer of assistance. When I asked about when the lift would be fixed, I repeatedly got the non-committal answer of "soon" or "not sure". My wife went to use the pool and when she asked staff there about towels, they were extremely unhelpful and when she turned away, started laughing at her. The location was excellent, but that is all this hotel has going for it. If it called itself a 3star, there would be no real complaint. However calling itself 5 star is exhibiting nothing more than delusions of grandeur. In case you are wondering, I would not stay here again. Sydney is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaJayne05
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel. Beautiful hotel. The sleeping/living area of the rooms was ok, however the bathrooms were gorgeous, littles extras in the room and very comfortable beds. Service was great, very friendly and lovely. Very close to circular quay. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from 5 star”
Reviews.Author: pertrea_s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to 2 nights it was a great location handy to everything staff were good but I was expecting somthing special because we normally star at 4 star properties but this place was no better than most of these.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: hunrous
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place - spacious rooms - really comfortable king bed - block out curtains ensuring a really good night sleep - Modern bathroom with big shower and bath - got a great deal on price - exaclty half way between the rocks circular quay OR go the other direction and you're on King Street Wharf - Darling Harbour - GREAT LOCATION - Quiet location - Attentive staff always opening doors for you etc GREAT STAY, will definately be back - only negative - their beds need an update (cover and frame) but in saying that, that'd just be for visual appeal, nothing else, the bed was extremely comfortable! Parking was $38 per night or $48 for valet per night THANKS :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good concierge staff, needs to do more to truely earn its 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Friendlytips1
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights through wotif and got bed only..no breakfast included and still cost over $225 per night. Room was ok, a few worn bits in carpets and walls and bathroom..my main grip was the noise at 2.30am - - as most bars are supposed to stop ouotside noise at 3am, was surpised to still hear music blaring and the night manager couldnt hear it...he probably had the ear plugs we were missing!. I know there is limited things he can do regarding outside bars but he could have called them maybe?? They did in fairness offer to move us but the hassle to do this at 2.30am wasnt worth it. Concierge staff were very helpful. Mini bar very expensive so shop outside ; crisps: $6, water $5; internet $9.99 per hour..took the airport transfer for $50...very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I loved this hotel, beautifullly furnished, fantastic deal with wotif including breakfast and seafood buffet.”
Reviews.Author: reduja
Reviews.Content: Well we had a wonderful time here. Wehad a spectacular, spacious room with great views and a wonderful deal via wotif to boot. I'm hoping the Raddison Hotel & suites can match the quality next weekend, I know we will book the Amora again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, very comfortable bed, slightly ageing hotel”
Reviews.Author: kewpielovesyou
Reviews.Content: I first visited the Amora prob 10 years ago. Back then it was a schmick hotel - new! fast forward many years later, it still is a very plush hotel, but the signs of an ageing building can be seen. The room: spacious room, with a very comfortable bed. no question! they also have a pillow menu that includes a chiropractic pillow, a butterfly pillow, a microfibre and a duck down and others to choose from. The TV was located adjacent to the bed. so if you wanted to watch TV, you needed to turn your head 90 degs (in my case, to the RIGHT). Not so cool. It gets very uncomfortable very quickly. Other highlights: a very spacious bathroom. Almost art deco in style with french doors and a clean black and white tile scheme. well lit too! What wasn't so good: the toilet cistern would hiss for a very long time after flushing. that hissing sound emanates thru the room. slightly annoying.... the blinds on the window also needs replacing. It's a 5 star hotel with very very very badly fraying blinds.... seriously, you can spend a few dollars to change it and make a difference. Bottle 'hotel water' wasn't free either. $6 a bottle from memory. The room was also quite dim. Bed side lights were adequate for spot lighting the area, but not very good overall lighting for the room. A word on the reception, check-in process - rather emotional less and lacking warmth. Don't get me wrong, am not after a hug, but for those that would have travelled long distances to get to Sydney, a smile and friendly disposition wouldn't hurt. Plus, smiling doesn't cost! The hotel itself is located in a very good location. So it's not right in the shopping precinct, but it's a short walk and close to circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “Cocooned in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Familyfun022
Reviews.Content: We live in regiponal NSW and we treated our family to the Mary Poppins show in Sydney so we thought we'd also enjoy the indulgence of a 5 star hotel that night in the big smoke as well . We booked the Amore Jamison online on ubid4rooms.com - a website where you tell the hotel how much you want to pay within reason as we heard you can get much lower deals on this site and we did, gettign a great deal on two adjoining rooms with city views - we a had a great time and we spent less than we had budgeted for so I can recommend Ubid4rooms if you want to get a better deal online. And the Amora Jamison is not as well iknown as other hotels but a real find. We had a memorable night in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great reception staff”
Reviews.Author: schultzemily03
Reviews.Content: Welcomed by friendly staff. We got in early and were so happy to find our room was ready for us at 10am. Went straight up to the room and saw there was a beautiful bath tub and comfortable bed, Later we enjoyed the spa, sauna and steam room. The spa water could have been a little hotter and getting a taxi from the hotel wasn't the easiest on a sat night. Otherwise we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed stay”
Reviews.Author: Liusha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights last weekend. We booked a non smoking standard room and upgraded to a club room upon check in. The first club room had a very strong smoking smell. We changed to another club room, later we found that water was dropping from the celling in the bathroom, we could not stay. We were given a suit for compensation. The room had a nice view. After having changed room three times, we stayed. We were very unhappy, the toilet trickled water, we could not sleep well because of its noise. When we checked in, we were told that we could get light refreshment all day at the Jamieson Club. We went there at 2ish in the afternoon, the coffee machine was not working, nothing else could be found. When we went there again at about 8pm, the room was locked. We were told by the staff that we could have breakfast at either 31st floor Jamieson Club or in 1st floor Gallery dining room. When we checked out we were charged extra for having had breakfast in the Gallery instead of the Jamieson Club. We objected and the charge was waived but the experience was still uncomfortable. This is a five star hotel but the rating and price are higher than the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: srigg1993
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one-night stay at the Amora Hotel Jamison... We were going to the theatre in the city and decided to avoid the hassle of getting home late and so booked in this hotel. It is in a great location, just near Wynyard station - close enough to all that you'd be wanting to do in the city but not right in the middle of the action, thus allowing a bit of peace and quiet. Should probably mention that given the short stay, we didn't really utilise the facilities or have a need to engage with the staff at all, so can't exactly comment on service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently appointed Hotel -that never disappoints-quality and service all the way”
Reviews.Author: hutchliz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on serveral ocassions and have never been disappointed it is quality all the way. All staff are well drilled in customer service and nothing is every too much trouble.All staff acknowledge you from the door to the housekeeping staff. I have no hestitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't sure because of other reviews... but it was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladybeetles
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which is close to all local tourist attractions. Wasn't sure about booking as I had read some negative reviews.... but so glad that I did. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded on arrival to a one bedroom suite which was lovely. The bed was more comfortable than home. Bathroom was great and had a bath as well. Dinner in the restaurant was superb.... loved the food. Buffet breakfast was relaxing and very satisfying. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Satisha63
Reviews.Content: Having read some poor reviews on this hotel, when we managed to get a room at $180 a night in a Mystery Hotel deal I was a little worried. I called the hotel to ensure we had a room at a higher level, and we spent 4 nights on the 20th floor. It turned out to be a great deal! Really comforatable, great staff, no problems at all. So close to transport - right near Wynard Station, we were out every night catching a quick train to Surry Hills to eat at the latest trendy restaurants. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5*”
Reviews.Author: jamesking
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a fantastic location, just off George Street in the heart of the CBD. The hotel lobby is large and quite spacious. After checking in, I went to my room, and found it to be on the small side. It did however feature everything that you needed for a business traveller (internet, plenty of power points etc) I upgraded my room to a club Jamison, and was quite disappointed with the small lounge, yes it featured a good breakfast and evening service, but not to an amazingly high standard. The hotel prides itself on being a 5* property, but it just lacks the feeling and the room that I had was way overdue for a refurb. The bathroom was quite unique and I feel that the bathrooms may have been upgraded, but the room itself left as it was when new. I ate in the dining room twice, and although quite expensive, did the job. The service in the hotel was of a good standard. I arrived on the second night a little late for dinner, and the dining room had closed. They were happy to serve me my meal in the bar, which was very accommodating of them. I have stayed at many 5* hotels, and I felt that this one wasn't maybe as good as it should have been. I can't really complain though, as I got the hotel through a website that offered a significant discount. There are many good hotels in Sydney, but this just doesn't make the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Korinne
Reviews.Content: I was impressed. The service was faultless and the hotel very stylish. I loved the location as it is convenient to everything you could possibly want to do. I can not wait to return. I didn't use the spa, pool or gym facilities so can not comment on those. The rooms and bathrooms were impeccably clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would return.”
Reviews.Author: jackster11
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through a Wotif mystery deal and was happy with the quality. The hotel itself is fitted out in 5 star quality with service to match. Though the room was slightly less quality than other places I have stayed at. Room was adequate, with a very good bathroom, but the bedroom space was a bit small and the tv was in the side wardrobe, so you need to lie on your side or across the bed to watch it. For the price I'd return as the location was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a conference venue....don't look here”
Reviews.Author: KI6871
Reviews.Content: Having made initial enquiries into using this hotel for a CEO-only event, I was provided pricing and follow up emails on how our event would be layed out, how conference rooms were available and that Amora would be pleased to host our event - Amora emailed me 23 May stating the above. Amora confirmed venue inspection on 30 May. Executive General Manager inspected on 1 June. I emailed Amora Friday 3 June requesting contract to proceed with event. Received response from Amora 6 June saying "my boss double booked so we can't host you". Whilst I understand no room was 'on hold' I was told by salesperson "I was away Friday and didn't get in til late Monday and my boss double booked just this morning". Does that mean that either a) there was a lack of communication amongst the BDM / Sales team or b) our event did not generate as much revenue (a mere $15k minimum for a one day event) as the 'double booking'. Well done Amora on some of the worst BDM skills known in the competitive Sydney market. I will ensure my executive team no longer stay at Amora and I will also advise my extensive EA network to do the same. You never know, you may book accommodation, a dinner or an event and suddenly, it's no longer possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: turcich
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff were very polite and responsive, great amenities, and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-Kala
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 5star Wotif Mystery Deal for one night. The location is superb. Short walk to The Rocks and Cirqular Quay and not that far in the other direction to Darling Harbour & The City either. Room was stylish and very clean. King bed was two singles put together with a thick overlay but could still feel the bump in the middle. Wouldn't pay full price for hotel but was everything to be expected from a 5star hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: kenkvin
Reviews.Content: We booked through wotif secret hotel deals thinking it's a 5 Star so it would definitely good. We stayed there for 4 nights and would definitely say that it's no where close to a 5 star. The rooms look shabby and don't even have a interior which would come close to what you expect in a 5 star.I think they close there Air Con at night as it stopped working and got on again after 2 hours. The carpet, blinds, bed sheets, pillows all looked like old and dirty. If you are looking for 5 star luxury than take my work you would not get it in this hotel. The only good thing was the bathrooms were decent looking but still not 5 star class. Simply not a 5 star..

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Deltacrot
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the hotel on friday and was disappointed. Was expecting a bit more from a hotel located in the heart of Sydney. Staff were indifferent and parking fees were not cheap. Also the room needed refurbishment. TV was located inside a closet which made it very uncomfortable to watch. Aircon was not working and I woke up cold in the middle of the night. If you looking for a 4-5 star hotel service look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: angelaford1
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Amora. The staff were welcoming, the room was great and so was the price. It's also in a good location, just off George St but close to Pitt St Mall, Circular Quay and a short walk to Sydney Theatre Co (we were in town to see Baal). Had been recommended to try the amazing seafood buffet that Amora does on Saturday night but unfortunately we weren't able to try it this time! The bed was super comfortable and I didn't think the decor was "dated"at all, in fact it was quite stylish - we may have had one of the better rooms. The hotel in general had a nice feel to it. Would definitely recommend this place - for the price it's one of the better hotels I have stayed at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Service OK but room poor”
Reviews.Author: petarok
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient position to the harbour. We found the staff most courteous friendly and informative, but were not as impressed by our room. The following is a list of observations. - The carpet in the room was badly in need of cleaning and at the end of its life. - The blind was tattered and dirty - There was rubbish under the bed in the form of an empty water bottle from a previous guest. - The mattress protector was a very thin double bed size on a king size bed. - The mattress itself was starting to fray and was stained. This may have been just in our room- others may have been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Well Pleased”
Reviews.Author: TrudiNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after booking through a website as mystery hotel, which I chose for price and location - then read reviews on tripadvisor. However need not have worried. Perfect location to walk to all attractions, wonderful staff & spacious bathrooms & rooms. Little touches like a bottle of water from Conceirge after morning run was nice. Only reason for 4 out of 5 for sleep quality was because pillows were too high for us and pillow menu had run out of our choice of pillow. Lovely king bed and crispy sheets. We had corner room on higher floor well worth the extra. Although did look in "normal" room when being cleaned and it looked just fine and would have been also happy with that. Sorry I did not try a treatment at the Spa - it looked lovely but ran out of time. This hotel is in the CBD so there are office buildings around it - therefore on the lower floors especially don't expect a view. Rooms seemed well insulated from noise both inside & out & privacy light filter blinds work well. We could not hear people in room next to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wotif - mystery booking”
Reviews.Author: NICnMARK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora on Friday night, for $175 it was good value. Our room was a corner suite with a bath and great views. Only complaints were the $48 parking which is ridiculous and the slow taps it took 25mins to fill the bath. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at The Amore Hotel. I have stayed there twice before but after reading some of the negative reviews was a little anxious as I thought the standard may have dropped off. However this was not the case at all. I was staying with my daughter, we upgraded to a corner room for a minimal extra charge, but this was still excellent value and worth it for four nights. The room was spacious and clean, sure the decor is dated but it was comfortable. When we got there one of the blinds was not working properly,but this was fixed by the time we returned from lunch. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is fabulous within walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the shops. All in all I think The Amore is good value for money and I would not hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kenic95
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip to the Amora hotel during the Easter weekend. We booked via Wotif - a mystery 5* hotel. We were really pleased with the central location and the fact that we were upgraded to a corner room on arrival. The room was large and modern and we could see the harbour from the window (and whilst sitting in the bath too!). We didn't use the restaurant but did have a couple of drinks in the bar. A free bowl of nibbles was provided with drinks - a nice touch. All the staff at the hotel were friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. We used the pool, spa, sauna, steamroom and gym. All well equiped and very clean. The only negative was the $38 a night car parking fee - but then what did we expect in central Sydney!! A really lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mystery deal on whotif is good price at 165 ... pity about the moldy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Nicole76oz
Reviews.Content: Great location, small room with a bathroom in need of a good clean. If you are on a budget look for a game console on the list of amenities on whotif mystery deals. This is by no means a five star hotel, more like a three. It is in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably priced Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pinktori71
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel more than adequate for a night's accomodation that I needed in Sydney. It is not cutting edge or overly luxurious/prestigous etc, but it is clean, well maintained, has all the ammenities you need, a good location and not ridiculously priced like some Sydney hotels are. At the end of the day I find all CBD hotels uninspiring, so why pay $500 a night for other places when you can get deals here for around $250 or so. I would stay here again if I needed good value accom in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, poor and careless service.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley080389
Reviews.Content: While the amora is in a good location the service here is extremely poor. Staff are unfriendly and unwilling to help. Level of service offered to room is poor, rooms not cleaned daily and supplies not replenished (ie towels). Far below what is expected from a 5 star hotel. I stay in Sydney every week for work and would not stay here again. Much better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to overseas cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: Toowoombatourist
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hotel. I had stayed four nights with my daughter in January 2010 when she was in Sydney for a job recruitment seminar held at the Hotel's conference rooms. This time my husband and I needed overnight accomodation before a New Zealand cruise leaving from Circular Quay. We decided on using the mystery Wotif Hotel mainly for price reasons, and were pleasantly surprised when we found that this hotel was our destination. The Hotel is well positioned.....walking distance back to the centre of Sydney for shopping or restaurants and very close to Sydney Harbour and all it has to offer. You could easily walk with luggage to the terminal if the weather is good ( not our luck that day so a quick cab ride was required!) The rooms aren't huge but are still very comfortable and nicely decorated and appointed. Neither of the rooms I stayed in had a view but this wasn't a deal breaker for me. The bathroom is quite spacious and had a bath as an added extra if time permitted. We didn't use any of the onsite food facilities as areas such as The Rocks are so close by with lots of choices available. The staff, on both occassions were friendly and helpful with directions and the holding of luggage after check-out time. Check-in & out were smooth and quick even though we arrived before normal check-in time. Without a discount of some sort, this Hotel is not the cheapest around but the position does make it an excellent choice when visiting Sydney for sightseeing especially.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: djrussell53
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed overnight in Sydney and had a difficult time finding a place to stay with all that Sydney had going on. We booked at the Amora using lastminute.com.au and am really glad we did. From the time we arrived our first time experience at Amora was excellent. The valets and desk clerks were very attentive, friendly, and helpful. We upgraded to a different room that cost under $40 to upgrade. I'm glad we did. The room had gorgeous views of the city and harbour area - even from the view in the bathroom! Which reminds me, the shower was huge and very nice. The pool is also nice, as is the steam sauna and hot tub. We decided to eat somewhere in Sydney instead of the Amora restaurant, so can't speak about it. But we would definitely stay again. It was very nice and definitely a steal with lastminute.com.au. All in all: excellent service, very clean and well maintained property; hotel is located near all the major sites; definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: VOLUNTEERGIRL_68
