Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on a tour of Australia and New Zealand. The rooms seemed small, and our view of the harbor was blocked by a large office building. We didn't notice any of the dirt issues others reviews have mentioned. The twin beds were somewhat hard, though the selection of pillows was nice. The beds were not well made, with bottom sheets untucked. The breakfast was standard Australian, with may choices. Sadly the bacon was underdone as were the scrambled eggs. Omelets made to order were very good. This is a very nice hotel, well located for all the the attractions in the Rocks and at the Harbor. I would not give it 5 stars, however, maybe 4.

Reviews.Title: “Overall....average.”
Reviews.Author: TrackFast
Reviews.Content: Booked a Jamison Club room from 07 March to 11 March. Room was fine but the Jamison Club on the 31st floor was a bit light weight compared to other Club-type facilities. Good location for me since my company's Sydney Office was about a block away. Convenient to The Rocks/Circular Quay. Overall...average.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: howsonh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Amora Jamison in february 2011 for 4 nights. We picked up the accommodation through a mystery deal on needitnow.com. The food is way over priced, a breakfast buffet in the morning is $40pp, the room service was about $70 for 2 people and the restaurants and bars were way overpriced. But dont let this deter you from staying here. There are plenty of breakfast cafes, pubs and restaurants within a 5min radius. The Hotel was beautiful, pool was great, rooms were a good size and comfortable. The Hotel is in a fantastic position, near darling habour, 5mins from circular quay, close to all public transport and in a nice area of sydney (pitty about the suncorp building blocking our view!)

Reviews.Title: “Poor. Definitely not as billed”
Reviews.Author: pkfrancis
Reviews.Content: I'm here now and I have to say I'm disappointed. From the mad scramble in the lift for everyone to put their card in the room unlock slot (why not have one on both sides of the lift), to the fact that the room is tired (dirty carpet, missing tiles in the bathroom), through to the $25 sloooowww internet and the saggy bed (oh, and the tiny old school TV that doesn't have the new Freeview channels on), this is definitely a 3-star hotel at best. Won't be here again - too many other options at this (supposed) end of the market in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good experiance”
Reviews.Author: MarinersTours
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night as it turns out over valentineâ€™s weekend. They were four of us in our party 2 couples. We were lucky and were upgraded to a suite each. The suite was really nice. With a view over the park. It had a small lounge but a wonderful bathroom, a huge double bath and separate walk in shower; it was decorated in black and white and was quite dramatic. The bed was really comfy with a good choice of pillows; our friends had stayed here before and really enjoyed it so thought we would like it. We went on a Saturday night to enjoy the sea food buffet which we booked as part of our package. It was really good with loads to choose from and unlimited amounts. The Breakfast Buffet was also of a very good standard. The hotel was really busy and for breakfast they were using over flow tabels in the adjacent bar, this was probably the only slight negative. We used the indoor pool and the steam room and sauna, all very good. We were on separate floors, you need to put your room key into the lift to get to your floor this was quite hard when meeting each other. One of our party tried to use the stairs but ended up getting locked in a stair well but was rescued by intercom. The car park was full when we arrived which was quite awkward trying to park the car else where. All in all a very good stay good experience and a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms are not”
Reviews.Author: kjayduck
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Sydney, we were advised to stay in the Circular Quay area as central for many attractions. This is a great location! However, this hotel disappointed. First the PROS besides location-- lovely lobby, friendly and helpful staff, large rooms with good daylight, quiet given its CBD location. CONS- VERY expensive services e.g. meals, business center so we did not use any hotel amenities. More importantly, furniture in room was beat up, throw pillows were soiled, sheets on two out of three days had ripholes in them (not the same sheets, even as the location of the rips changed). Supposedly this is a 5 star hotel, but in terms of room condition, it really is not. What I could see in terms of maintenance issues made me worry about what I couldn't see. Normally I only write reviews if I am very happy with a place, but in this case, the room was so expensive that it's worth giving others a heads up on the condition.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it for a deal rate”
Reviews.Author: ceesurf
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, very clean and well laid out. I got a deal rate for about $180 for a friday night and stayed there with a friend on a night out. The check in staff were good and efficient and the concierge was very helpful. Its in a fantastic location, about 10 minutes walk (in heels!) from circular quay and hundreds of restaurants and bars a very short walk away

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: avidtravellerNz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amora Hotel for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Check in was friendly and efficient, we actually planned on dropping off our bags as it was only 9am, and coming back later but they assured us our room was ready for us which was really appreciated. Our room was well fitted out and sparkling clean. The doormen were so very helpful and pleasant throughout the whole stay, they made us feel very welcome and well taken care of. I didn't have my laptop with me but reception gave me a code each day to log on to the internet from their business centre at no charge. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on that. The location was perfect for us as it is so central to everything, circular quay, the rocks, restaurants and shopping. We were able to walk everywhere that we wanted to go. My husband got me a lovely surprise of a spa treatment which was several hours, a body scrub, massage and facial. I believe the spa was run by Thai women and gosh, they really did a great job. I sometimes find spa treatments in hotels a bit hit and miss, they are usually alot more expensive and you can't be sure it will be worth it but this one certainly was. All in all, a great stay, would definitely recommend and will stay with them again next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: OlaLindell
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the executive floor and I simply love this hotel. Service is excellent. Room quality is top notch and the location is also very good. If you do stay on the executive floor make sure you get one of the rooms view a nice view from the bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Cassious15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was impecable. The staff were friendly and knowledgable, the facilities were excellent and the location was brilliant. Perfect for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great staff, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bull1976
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Concierge greeted us with a smile. Reception was friendly and professional. Room was clean and fresh (bad tv's the only letdown). Roomservice was fast, fresh and tasty. Complimentary iced water and m&m's on the roomservice tray was a great touch. Breakfast was busy but well run and well stocked. Every staff member was friendly. Mikar and the Chef n Bev manager were standouts for great warm professional service. In short we were "wowed" and that's not easy as I have worked in the hospitality industry for 15 years! Well done Amora for a fresh friendly hotel with exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Around”
Reviews.Author: DeanoNorthPerth
Reviews.Content: Just had my second stay at Amora on Jamison. I kind of understand the mixed reviews this place gets as it does need a bit of a facelift. But I have been in a King Corner Room both times and these rooms have excellent facilities. The location is brilliant and I have always found the service level to be top shelf. To my way of thinking, Sydney room rates are overpriced compared to most of the rest of Australia, but compared to other similar hotels in Sydney, the Amora offers value for money. It will continue to be my hotel of choice on those times I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: TA_from_Down_Under
Reviews.Content: We found the location of the Amora Jamison to be excellent. It is a pleasant 5 minute stroll to the Rocks and Circular Quay, and Wynard Station is almost underneath. This hotel was 'chosen' in a 'Secret Mystery Hotel' deal from one of those last minute hotel websites, for about $185 a night - which we thought was a good price. Upon receiving the name of the hotel we looked up the Amora Jamison on Trip Advisor, and were a little worried with the reviews. However our worries were unfounded. Door and check-in staff were very friendly throughout our three night stay. We were given a room on the 9th floor, which was very neat and tidy. However, there was not much of a view (which could be expected for being a 'cheaper' room). Only two negative comments: there was only one towel in the bathroom upon arrival. However a quick phone call to reception resolved this problem and brought an additional pillow from the pillow menu. Also we thought that the TV was poorly located, and I would have thought a 5 star would have flat panels. As we were out most of the day and half the night, we did not use many of the hotel amenities, but it seems to have everything. The room was quiet, very dark with the block-out blind drawn and the beds very comfortable. Bathroom facilities are excellent (taking up almost half the room). Overall, we had a very comfortable stay at the Amora Jamison and would not hesitate staying there again (if we received the same deal).

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR EXPERIENCE IN A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sundaysipper
Reviews.Content: Having read a few negative reviews we were slightly unsure of the experiance that lay ahead. Our concerns were layed to rest from the moment we pulled up. We were assisted with our luggage and directed to check-in by friendly staff who seemed genuinly pleased to see us. Check-in was extremely pleasant and professional. We received an upgrade to a Jamison Room on the 31st floor. Our room was terrific, with views towards Darling Harbour extending as far as the Blue Mountains. The bathroom was sensational with a deep bathtub and the same views through a large window. Our beds were very comfortable and everything was clean and fresh. We would have to agree with some of the nagative comments regarding worn furniture and location of the TV. 5 Star should mean 5 Star. All other aspects of our stay were exceptional including 2 Dinners at the CHARR Restaurant. Had the Rib-Eye and Wagyu Rump, both sensational, best steaks I have ever had, cooked perfectly. Wife had Twice cooked Duck and Eye-Fillet same result. Restaurant staff were super friendly and professional. Buffet breakfasts were also very good, able to order eggs any way you liked them, for some reason everywhere has trouble getting the bacon right. Departure was easy, fast and efficient. Overall we had a lovely weekend and would definately return. 5 Star service 4 Star decor.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: aussiewendylou
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from Wynyard Station (direct from the Domestic Airport station) - ideal for a weekend getaway. I was a bit apprehenisve as reviews I had read after booking were not very complimentary. However, a short walk to Circular Quay, the tourist hub of Sydney and the facilities of the Hotel were great. The beds were fantastic and the rooms comfortable. As this is in the "business district" the surrounding area is very quite during weekends. Would recommend if you want something under $200 per night (we paid $195 as a Mystery hotel deal through Wotif)

Reviews.Title: “AMORA, NOT FOR LOVE”
Reviews.Author: AxelPerth
Reviews.Content: Unusual name, lovely looking hotel but not for a couple in love like myself and my wife! On arrival disappointed by lazy Concierge not opening the doors and not smiling.Sydney is an amazing city and we assumed it would be on par with the 5 star Crown at Melbourne, how wrong we were.The rooms can only be described as completely drab and the tv is tucked away in the side of wardrobe that is very awkward to manaeovre with the sliding doors and as it's not a plasma it's very bulky and a cheap touch,.We liked the bath tub and the power shower. Overall the we were sightseeing so got back late evening but there was nothing remotely extragravant and not pleasant to get one's libido in the mood for passion! Get the rooms remodernised and refurbished.Housekeeping check the tray above the fridge as it was full of crumbs! The breakfast buffet was a good choice but rather like a canteen.Room service menu was ok but service slow.The bar was boring with terrible lighting, not glowing but almost dark.Overall would be fine for overnight transit but not for the young and in love or those unfortunatey who are infirm and elderly to walk up the steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: RedrosesNsw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my friend who just flew in from Europe. We really enjoyed our stay. Lovely pool, sauna and spa and the rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. I booked a mystery deal, but was treated equal in my opinion. The reception staff were very friendly, the concierges were helpful. The location is perfect, close to shops in the CBD and close to circular quai and trains. Would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Run down - not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: WhelansBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is in an ok location, it is run down and certainly not deserving a 5 star rating. Issues we had with our room were rips in the sofa, torn blockout blind, a tangle of cables and plugs near the desk, hard to read worn out light switches, threadbare towels and general fatigue of the fittings. The bathroom was ok. The pool is small and everything in the pool deck looks like it needs to be refurbished. Staff are not overly helpful, no-one offered to help with our bags. I would not stay here again, as there are better hotels in Sydney in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “5*....my ar$e!”
Reviews.Author: hillier_e
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked from the UK through Wotif.com and the review on its website would make you believe this was a truly wonderful hotel in Sydney. i could not have been more disappointed. Firstly, upon arrival not one member of staff was available to help with my luggage although they were happy to watch me struggle. My room was certainly not what you expect from a 5* hotel. Dated furnishings, extremely dated TV and no wireless Internet. The lighting was poor, worn switches meant not knowing what switch did what. Bathroom not great, electrical tape holding ripped blind together and plug sockets not working. Overpriced buffet breakfast at Â£20! Extremely disappointing, especially after such high hopes. Fault of both wotif.com and the Amora Jamison.

Reviews.Title: “Overated but good location”
Reviews.Author: ThoughtfulTraveler05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty basic as are the rooms. No frills and pretty pedestrian furnishings. But well located just off George St and 5 minutes from Circular Quay and 10 mins from the Rocks. Downtown Sydney is booming with great shopping (altho expensive by NA standards) and close to lots of restaurants. The hotel is close to a Winyard Station entrance where there is a Woolies grocery store to stock up on some food and drinks, and there is a decent grog shop near the Menzies hotel in the block behind so that one can avoid the ridiculous charges in the restaurant and bar. When we came back to Sydney we stayed at the Four Seasons for only $40 per nite more which was certainly worth the extra $.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Henderson_12
Reviews.Content: Booked room on Wotif and was given a 'special access' room. I was told our room had a king sized bed. Bed was actually two beds pushed together with one cover sheet. As the mattresses caved in towards the centre, I found myself falling between the beds several times. When pushing the beds back together in the morning (about a 10cm gap) a woman's sanitary item was exposed from under the edge of the bed. This is meant to be a five star hotel. On check-in we were told our room had complimentary broadband internet service. This apparently means the fact that they have internet is free, but you have to pay $9.95 per hour to use it. Porter staff was excellent and friendly, counter staff was rude. Never staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Sight Seeing - the "5 star" ends there”
Reviews.Author: bazingaLV
Reviews.Content: Pros: EXTREMELY centrally located to Circular Quay, Shopping area and Darling Harbor (all walking) and some great little pubs, etc. They got our bill right on check out Cons: Prior to arriving i had called the hotel 3 times to request NYE dinner at the Buffet (special they were running). Three different people said i needed to fill out of a form and fax it back with credit card information. None of the three ever emailed me the form - so we never were able to get a reservation for dinner (worked out better anyway - had heavy lunch on NYE and went to SeaRock for the party in Circular Quay with AMAZING fireworks views) Upon arrival at noon, our room was not ready (understandable). They said they would call us when ready - never got the call, but came back at 2:30 and room was ready. We had requested and booked a room with a balcony (entire hotel is non-smoking and we smoke). They of course had no balcony rooms left. The windows do not open in the rooms (we had a one bedroom suite). We had to go down 28 floors and outside in driveway to smoke (just a warning for potential smoker guests). I also enjoy a little fresh air in a stuffy hotel room - no go The rooms are showing their age (dirty grout in the tile in the bathroom, worn fixtures/outlets, older furniture, lumpy bed). Lucky for us our suite's bedroom looked directly into the office buildings main windows (about 20 feet away) and the curtains are completely see through. Living room window overlooked the city (nice). Couch in room 2807 had BIOLOGICAL STAIN (white stain) on it - nasty. There were no other rooms left that were suites so we could not move rooms (we arrived 12/29 and stayed till 1/2). There was an Ashes convention coming in, so all the rooms were tied up for them. Air Conditioning in 2807 would not go below 25 Celsius (77 degrees F) which was extremely uncomfortable. Sydney was having a heat wave and temps were in upper 80s - without fresh air in room, this became VERY stuffy and uncomfortable. 2807 is across from supply room for housekeeping - noisy all day long Cannot see writing on different switches to control lighting so it is a shot in the dark as to what lights will come on. Not enough extra outlets in the hotel room for laptop, charging cell phones, etc. had to unplug lamps, etc. to charge common items which is inconvenient. They give you an icebucket, but no where to get ice, have to order from room service which is not very quick. Pool area (3rd floor) is small but adequate - people were topless in hottub and looked a little "busy" when we went down to use it - so we went back up to the room Coffee maker in room is inadequate, had to go to corner coffee shop or McDonalds as we were not paying $6 a cup from room service (with extra charge just to GET room service) There is a woolworths in the mall under the hotel, go there to stock up on any snacks, soda, etc. They do not sell alcohol in supermarkets in Sydney, need to go to a bottle store. Beer and wine are expensive near the hotel - if you see something reasonably priced, grab it and bring it back. Beer and wine IN hotel are way over priced. Concierge (belldesk) would open doors for us to go outside and smoke, and completely forget that we had just walked by them 10 minutes ago and act like they had never seen us - sometimes they would only open doors for people arriving by car, not walk up. Concierge - not very handy for local recommendations, how to get somewhere, etc. Better to find out on your own. Overall - would only stay in this hotel again if it was only place available. Would rather have to pay a little more or walk a little farther. Definitely not a 4-5 star level hotel, and def not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: fattibumba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the standard room for 4 nights after Christmas. I ended up booking through lastminute.com as one of their 'secret' specials which mean that I didn't know which hotel I was booking. So when I got the hotel details I looked on Tripadvisor for some feedback and the mixed reviews had me worried. Overall, our experience was pleasant with the room being clean and comfortable and the bathroom exceeding my expectations with modern fittings, huge new bath and big shower with Grohe shower head. Bed was a king size bed and whilst it wasn't like the Sofitel beds, it was still comfortable enough. Lastminute.com adviertised the hotel as a 5 star hotel but from my experience, I think it's more like 4.5 stars. The hotel in itself didn't have the 5 star quality or finish. The concierge service was good when I got through and they made a dinner reservation for us at the Rockpool at short notice. We didn't use the indoor pool but I had a spa treatment at the hotel and the service was exceptional with beautiful rooms and surroundings. The hotel is a 3 min walking distance from the Rocks so it is convenient. We also walked to the Ferry stop to go over to Manly. For $165 per night, it was a great deal and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bath and view, great service too!”
Reviews.Author: amiski
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were upgraded to a club king room.. and it was fantastic!! The view is great (although a little too close to the building next door) and we found our rooms to be very clean. A staff did knock on our door to check our rooms for some reason, but he was very friendly. The bathroom is one of my favourites - the bathtub had great views! We also wanted to stay a bit longer so we requested a late check out with the front desk, which they gave us - very friendly staff! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem on a weekend.”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELEAST7
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was not far to walk to see the "Jersey Boys". Wotif had a great package with 2 course dinner/buffet breakfast and accommodation. The hotel seems to be a businessmans place to stay, but on a weekend I think it is a bit of a hidden gem. The weekend was also Rugby League grand final time Sydney. The hotel was extremely busy as well as having 3 wedding functions in 3 days. They coped very well. We had a lovely romantic weekend. The food was very good and our room on the 32nd floor had nice views across to The Heads. The room was fresh and functional - the bathroom huge. I want one of these at home!!. The bed was marvellous but my only complaint is that it was very noisy during the night - even being so high up. Must have been those rugby league revellers!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Dated room”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location but the room is dated - not quite 5-star IMO. No free Wi-Fi, no iPod dock (a ticking clock on the bed side table instead!), old style TV (eg not flat screen), old gym equipments.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly rude fronte desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: ThaiSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked with wotif, Rude front desk manager, all but accused me off lieing regarding our booking, Was tempted to leave . Will never stay here again, In Sydney we are spoilt for chioce...several 5 stay hotels stay at another one... I have stayed at this hotel befor will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “what if we had a decent room - wotif?”
Reviews.Author: mippy
Reviews.Content: Booked this mystery five star - not five star rooms. Given a disabled room on 4th floor. Air con. also disabled and room stifling. Given a wheelchair disabled room on 5th floor. Were made to feel like second class citizens because we booked through Wotif! Admirable to have rooms for the disabled -but we did not need this facility. Honeymoon stuff not! The rooms were three star and tired. I saw better tv sets on the verge collection. The location of the hotel is great, and there may be great rooms, however not what you get when you take a misery mystery booking through Wotif!!

Reviews.Title: “No where near 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: KamillahC
Reviews.Content: Got this deal on a Wotif mystery deal and it was advertised as a 5 star hotel. It is in a great location but the front office staff were very unfriendly and uninformative! The room was ok but the desk had a large stain on it and we had an already filled out breakfast menu in the room. Upon check out the front office staff were once again unfriendly and especially rude as front office was busy and she was rushing out check out. Our complaint card was filled in and they said a response would be sent out which it hasn't. Would not pay full price to stay at this hotel wasn't even worth the discounted rate! the Travelodge around the corner was better value with much friendlier staff!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: tootiredtotango
Reviews.Content: I have the misfortune to be staying at this hotel. It is dirty and hot. The only concession that they have offered to me is to give me a fan in my room, which does help, but in the heat of Sydney I would have expected the AC to work a little better than it does. This hotel tries to be a designer hotel but it isn't. The rooms are small and hot, it has very annoying touch switches for all the lights which are, well, annoying and very seventies. The internet is very slow, my room was cleaned today and all the dirty towels are still in my bath where they were left by the maid. I'm here because my company is paying, but you can do a lot better in Sydney for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from the internet”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Kiss_Army
Reviews.Content: Room comfortable, there is even a toaster, bathroom is very well appointed with a great bath. I enjoyed the room apart from the internet access. If you are here on business and are going to be spending your time in the room working rather than holidaying then the internet access is a serious problem. No wireless, ethernet cable connection only. I carry a travel router so that I can setup my own wireless for my laptop and smartphone t connect to. Its described as high speed broadband but it tests out as 256kb down / 56kb up with a ping of over 400milliseconds. Skype voice calls are poor and forget video conferencing. Rates of $9.95 per hour - better off going to Starbucks and getting a free coffee and faster service! Even the rate of $49.95 seems steep for this level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Melissap333
Reviews.Content: Booked room on a wotif 5 star mystery deal. We were upgraded to a corner room on arrival. Checkin & checkout was very efficient. Room had views of the city and distant harbour views. Bed was very comfortable and room was exceptionally quiet. Location central and an easy walk to shopping, QVB, Circular Quay & The Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: cboping
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amora recently due to its very high rating (almost too high) on Tripadvisor. I honestly believe my stay at the old converted Sheraton could have been a lot better. For a five star hotel, the rooms seemed cramped and were very dated. The furnishings didn't match and there were holes in some of the curtains. The bathroom was very small with old thick towel rails which did nothing to the space. The marble was pink and seemed very dated, though clean. I had read in other reviews that newspapers were charged so I was too afraid to ask for one. Overall, I have stayed at both Crown Towers and Promenade (round the corner from the Amora) and Park Hyatt and they are definately superior. Do not be swayed by the #1 rating!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury and great service”
Reviews.Author: nicktaz
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights via wotif.com with their mystery hotel deals and lucked out with the Jamison. The room was clean and comfy with all the amenities we could need and a huge comfy bed. The staff we're very friendly and attentive which considering we were paying below rack rate and booked on the net is a great sign of a quality hotel. The location in great for access to the Rocks and Circular Quay and the Sydney CBD plus it's a stones throw from Wynyard station for people wanting to use public transport. What a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard type CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: emstar3
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Jamison as a "mystery hotel" deal on wotif.com which meant I paid a little less - about $70.00 less - than the standard rates. I'm glad I didn't pay the full rate (but I don't usually stay at corporate style hotels anyway and a hotel room over $250 has to offer something very special). The hotel is very well located in the Sydney CBD, near Wynyard station, Circular Quay and shops. Staff were friendly and very helpful. I didn't use the restaurant or the public areas such as the bar or swimming pool so can only comment on the room. My room had a glimpse of the harbour, the bed was supremely comfortable, nice deco style bathroom. The decor of the room was a little odd, perhaps a slight nod to the deco era (1930s), it had a curious cupboard arrangement with lots of different compartments, not a bad idea but the exterior was clunky and awkward looking. The grey/green walls gave the room a rather cool institutional feel - I'm not sure but there was something not quite right with the interior design elements of the room. Other rooms are decorated differently by the looks of the hotel website. I may be a little fussy about this sort of thing, but it does make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but difficult for wheelchair users being at the top of a hill”
Reviews.Author: Neeeeeeeena
Reviews.Content: The Amora was a lovely hotel which offered valet parking for $48/night or self parking for $38/night. Worked out expensive when staying for a few nights. The carpark not the easist to access either. If they did a parking/accomm package it would be better value. The room was wheelchair accessible with not much room to move. The door was hard to open especially if in a manual wheelchair. Trying to keep it open whilst getting through it, proved to be quite a challenge for my fiance, as it was very heavy. The toilet also needed to be lower to be user friendly when in a shower chair. The bed was a comfy king size and there was a pillow menu for you to order your desired pillows. Had a great sleep whilst there. The only thing was the location. At the top of a hill so hard work for manual wheelchair users!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoodenSpoon1
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel my company uses for Sydney and it is a great hotel for both work and holiday. Food is great. Rooms are great. Service is excelent. If i was to be picky, the angle of the old tube television from the bed is not great. A nice new LCD mounted to the wall in front of the bed would be much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: DKSyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend with my wife on a package deal that included 2 course dinner for 2 and full buffet breakfast. The value was excellent, room was clean and comfortable. The service of the reception staff, door men (there were heaps), and the wait person at the Charr restaurant was superb. Location was perfect, and we walked to shopping, to the Rocks, as well as to a concert at the opera house. Travelled to/from the hotel via train with the underground station literally next door. I would definitely stay here again, and next time try the pakage deal with seafood buffet dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: Beader88
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Amora Hotel in Sydney was comfortable and very nice. It is located in the Central Business District, and it was very convenient to dining and train travel. We were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: justadvice
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after a flight from the USA. We were tired and the bed was comfortable but the mattress protector didn't fit the bed nor did the doona cover. They added another mattress protector to cover the top of the mattress at 11 oclock at night when we complained. The grout in the shower and around the bath looked stained and the frame around the air conditioner was dirty. The carpet was also a bit grubby. Wouldn't call this room 5 star at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location - pity about the food”
Reviews.Author: MrYellowDuck
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Amora for business a few times. The location is great and easy to access from the airport by taking the train. I always get a nice room with a great bed and a nice bathroom. My experience has always been 5 star. However, several of my colleagues have had different experiences and they comment that the lower floor rooms are not always great. The dinner food here is not good. The steak off of the room-service menu is expensive and very poor quality - I've tried it twice six months apart and the experience was the same both times. The menu itself is uninspiring and old fashioned contemporary Australian. There are lots of options to eat out nearby and that's the best thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful room, staff friendly, courteous and helpful”
Reviews.Author: OL1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend and had an absolutely wonderful time. The hotel's interior and exterior is absolutely breathtakingly beautiful. Staff were professional, friendly, courteous and helpful to a fault and their interest in you and making your stay a pleasant one seemed to be much more than a professional interest. The concierge service at this hotel is second to none. Hotel location very convenient and rooms were very comfortable, well-decorated and beautiful with all the modern amenities you could need and a great view of the city. I could not have been more pleased with the room that I was allocated. The only downside was that room service was too overpriced but that didn't detract from my stay. A pleasant environment and wonderful staff. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Bris-Vegas
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Excellent location. Stay at the property often for work. Bed and breakfast deal is really good value. Wood based beds... excellent if you have a sore back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff ......... but getting tired!”
Reviews.Author: RJRAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now 10 yrs old (Sydney Olympics) and it does show. There are many price points for this hotel from different internet sites (including the Hotel direct) and really, this will determine if you feel that you got value for money. Room sizes are OK but the furnishings are tired (old & small CRT TV's, and poorly located) and in parts 'frayed' (blinds / curtains etc). Bedding propped up by the 'piece of plywood'. Bathroom was large and had a full size bath and separate shower. On the other hand things were very clean. So if it is a really special event maybe you look elsewhere, but if it is a bed in a good location at a good price, then it is value. All staff we encountered were very friendly and genuinely helpful. The seafood buffet dinner on Sat night was also pretty good value. They kept replenishing the seafood and it was very fresh. Breakfast was also good with all of the normal offerings. Location is great with just a 5 - 10 minute walk down to the Rocks / Circular Quay Ferries / Opera House. Plenty of shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location- friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: freshstartgetaway99
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and friendly. Room was a corner room with views of the harbour from two aspects. We had a problem with the cleanliness of the room. Unfortunalty someone had made a mess and housekeeping had missed it. We brought it to the attention of the duty manager Amanda and she dealt with it promptly. I would not hesitate to stay here again as the staff were all so friendly and efficient and the hotel is in such a great location. We really love the rocks markets and they are just a short stay away, as is circular quay. We also strolled down to the QVB for some shopping. Everything is within walking distance. We are due for another trip to Sydney in January and the Amora will be top of my list for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Service and facilities 5 star but room not”
Reviews.Author: golfspeed
Reviews.Content: Pool, day spa, bar, lobby and service all 5 star but rooms are definitely not. Bathrooms are large and nice however. Location is great, 10 min walk from the harbour bridge A pleasant 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Rajivkj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, very friendly staff, excellent facitilies and good location in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Fernuch01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room on the 26th floor, the room was spacious and clean does need a renovation in the future as both blinds were ripped and broken, all staff were very friendly and helpful. I would class this hotel as a 4.5 star not 5 as stated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Fabbo8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Amora Jamison which we enjoyed thoroughly. We booked a last minute rate over the internet which gave us a deluxe room on the 14th floor. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade for an additional $60 per night to have the Canapes and drinks as per the club room and also full breakfast for two. I thought this was good value but declined as neither of us eat full breakfasts and we knew we would not be at the hotel for the hours that the drinks and canapes are served. The deluxe room was lovely. The view was out of the buildings but the skyline at night was lovely. Kingsize bed was super comfy - they have a pillow menu and the first night I requested two feather pillows only to be told they didnt have any left. Phoned next morning at about 11am to be told that there were still no feather pillows but did get two Duck down ones - not as nice as the feather pillows but ok. Previous reviews have commented on the TV and its placement. The cupboard it is in does allow the doors to be pushed back and the tv extended out and swivelled. Its not a flat screen TV but dont think that effects the outcome at all. Only limited foxtel channels together with local channels available as well as in house movies. We did not use any of the other hotel amenities but the staff and concierge were always friendly and helpful. The location was great - two minutes walk from the train station and just off George St which leads you straight down to the Rocks area and Circular Quay - about a 5 minute walk. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star, not impressed”
Reviews.Author: smweine
Reviews.Content: We were really hoping for a 5 star experience but this hotel did not deliver. All the expenses of a 5 Star hotel, but things such as stains on the carpet, grubby rooms and views of office buildings that are right on top of you. We were in shock that a "5 Star" hotel still had a VCR! No flat screen TVs. This hotel just didn't have the finishing touches of a 5 Star hotel. Wouldn't stay here again not value for money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SCITTER
Reviews.Content: Have to say this is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Okay it doesnt have the best views and its city central but we didnt worry about that as the room was so nice. From the moment we arrived this was a dream weekend. Ideal for a couple, we had a really romantic time. Room was fabulous, and the bathroom was very spacious and luxerious. It was that good, I'm going to stay there the next time I go to sydney. And not to mention the seafood buffet, OMG it was fantastic. I was really happy with our stay there and i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night arrived to find car park was full due to something on in city so we had to take the valet parking option which was an extra $60 on top of hotel!! We booked the hotel thru wotif it was a mystery deal so we got it for a good price. Room was nice had a nice big bath & separate shower. There wasnt really a view from our room. Walking distance to circular quay. We went to the seafood buffet for dinner. Wasnt the best i had been to wasnt very many non sea food choices but still enjoyed it. Pool wasnt very big but didnt get crowded while we were there. It was around the same size as a normal house pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 Star.”
Reviews.Author: AdaraStar
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to staying in a 5 star hotel, I've only done it once before and it was the most amazing hotel. (Sheraton in Frankfurt, Germany!) Amora looked good to start with but on closer inspection not up to a 5 star rating. Staff were friendly and helpful - I loved that they opened the door for us each time. The room itself was cramped though. We had 3 adults staying in the room and the 3rd single bed was wheeled in and placed in the little entrance hallway into the main part of the room. This meant we had to walk sideways to get to the bathroom, sidling past the bed. There wasn't enough room in the bathroom to put our things down and the door didn't close properly unless you slammed it shut. The blinds were impossible to open and close.But when shut they really blocked the light - a great nights sleep because of it. Although when you go into the bathroom, it's like looking into the sun. Otherwise the room was clean and tidy, with all the usual things. And the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds and in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi1963
Reviews.Content: The Amora Hotel is located between The Quay and Darling Harbour. It was a very quick walk down to the Rocks. About 10 min walk to Darling Harbour. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay and don't mind a bit of a stroll, this is great. We were on the 12th Floor with a tiny glimpse of the Opera House and ocean. There was an office block beside us and we did hope that our windows were one way glass as it was good to enjoy the view. It did feel a bit like being in a glass bowl but as it was Sunday, it didn't appear that anyone was in the office building anyway. Hope not! We thought it odd that so many people commented on the bathroom but YES, it is worth mentioning! With a floor to ceiling window behind the bath, once again, it was great to enjoy the vista. With regards to the oddly positioned t.v., we wondered if guests realised that the cupboard doors pushed back in to the cabinet which allowed you to see the t.v. quite well. The gym was great and opened earlier at 6am not 6.30am as advertised in our room info. The pool and spa pool were nice and we were able to sunbathe inside by the pool on a lounge chair. That was most relaxing. We did not use the restaurants but walked down to China Town for dinner. It was a good 20min walk. Most enjoyable if you aren't in a hurry! The beds were very comfortable and linen was great, not something we would normally comment on but it is nice to sleep in clean, good quality linen. Staff were most professional and the Doormen were so friendly. Definitely would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegent and an Amazing Hotel 5 Star All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: ivestar
Reviews.Content: We will certainly be back to the Amora Hotel in Sydney. Celebrating a special occastion the hotel went all out to meet our needs. There was always at least 2 staff members on the front door plus a valet for the cars, plenty of staff behind the receptinon desk and a very friendly concierge. All staff members were very friendly and helpful and you were really made to feel special. The rooms were very confortable and if you can afford a little bit extra the Breakfasts at the Jamison Club were a real treat (so was the afternoon nibbles provided) Overall cannot say anything bad about the Hotel or the Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Amora”
Reviews.Author: AusTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amora for one night on business. Ended up in a twin room which wasn't great but also wasn't the fault of the hotel. Hade a nice meal from room service and slept well on the comfortable bed. As others have suggested there are some items in the room that could do with updating. Particularly I thnk the rooms need better televisions. The bathroom though was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted from a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Mighty_Blade
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora for a long weekend in July 2010 and weâ€™d definitely stay there again. Itâ€™s in a really good location, about 5 minutesâ€™ walk to Circular Quay and 10-15 minutes to Darling Harbour. We were on the 27th floor and had a great view over the city. The room was a standard 4/5* hotel room, nothing spectacular but clean and functional with all amenities youâ€™d expect. I agree with the earlier poster who said the TV is a bit old and in a strange spot in a side cupboard, but it was never going to be a deal-breaker. The bathroom was nice with a good deep bath and separate shower (although the water pressure was a bit weak). All the staff we encountered were excellent â€“ efficient and friendly without being overbearing. We had breakfast included and it was fabulous! The breakfast hall was perhaps a bit reminiscent of a canteen, but the quality and choice of food was very good. Overall, it was exactly what we wanted from a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dingoh
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find somewhere to stay close to Circular Quay and the Opera house. I booked the hotel as a "mystery" hotel that listed itself as being walking distance to the quay. It is a lovely property in a good location. It only takes about 15 minutes to walk to the rocks, the quay and a few more to the opera house. The hotel is only a couple of minutes to walk from Wynyard Station so access to the airport via the airport is very easy. The foyer was very nicely appointed with a piano bar off to one side. The room - My room wasn't huge. But it was very well appointed. King size bed. The room had tasteful furniture, and a very nice bathroom with a lovely big bath that I didn't get to use. One thing about the room that I was impressed with that the Television was not the focus of the room - it was there, but in a cabinet to the side of the bed. I have to give the bed a special mention for comfort. It was fantastic! I highly recommend this hotel as a Sydney Hotel near the Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Porb the best value sydney cbd hotel”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Well managed clean and relatively modern Rates around 200 aud incl bfast and broadband from wotif

Reviews.Title: “Adore Amora”
Reviews.Author: Jas O
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my birthday my wife booked a night at the Amora Hotel Jamison. I work in the city but sometimes like to stay in town and play tourist in my own back yard. I've stayed at many of the cbd hotels and have to admit that the Amora has never really been on the radar. Having said this, however, the Amora turned out to be a real surprise. Tucked away in Jamison Street (in the downtown business district), its away from the noise and bustle of the shopping and entertainment precincts but only a short walk to them if you need that buzz. Its also located within walking distance of the Rocks (my fave haunt when doing my home town). The room, whilst small, was elegant and clean. The bathroom one of the best I've encountered. I was also impressed by the heavy duty blackout blinds which almost completely blocked out the morning sun. The real standout, however, was the service from front desk, Concierge (Troy?) and room service. The breakfast (which we chose to have in the room) was THE best hotel breakfast I've ever had in twenty years of corporate and leisure hotel stays - hot, perfectly cooked eggs, Bircher muesli, yoghurt, juice, bakery preserves - the whole deal. It arrived bang on time, service was friendly and discreet. The breakfast, along with most in-room dining options, were reasonably priced. Breakfast in bed is important to me. With two kids, a lie in is usually impossible, let alone breakfast in bed. I loved this experience. I loved the Amora. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will definately be going back. Thank you for an awesome birthday night.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be Better”
Reviews.Author: rugbypopsie
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights at the Amora which is well located just off George Street. The staff were friendly and efficient and despite the hotel being 8 years old everything was absolutely sparkling. Parking is $38 per night park yourself or valet parking at $48. The Hotel is in easy walking distance to Circular Quay and the Rocks and is virtually next door to Wynyard Railway and the underground, shopping arcade. I needed to put in a roll away bed at the last moment to accommodate son who managed a 24 hour pass, this request was politely and efficiently handled and they even transferred us to a slightly bigger room! Fantastic king size bed and pillow menu. Meal in the Gallery was very pleasant also. Very pleased and would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps not quite 5 star but not too awful either”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 2 night stay at the Amora Jamison hotel in Sydney. Perhaps a little out of the way compared to some others but still very easy to get around. The hotel is a little tired in places (eg tables & chairs in the bar looked a little threadbare and worn, and the tv in the room was an older style and buzzed constantly when on, and as previous reviewers have said, is in a strange location) but the rooms were neat and tidy. Very comfortable bed along with block out blinds in the room made a sleep in very pleasant, and waking up to a view of the harbour was nice, although the rooms do look in on other apartments (including the bathroom - but simply close the blind!). I would definitely stay again as for the price we paid booking direct with the hotel, it certainly met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dope-noir
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel twice over the last 4 months. Both times have been a very enjoyable experience. The staff have been wonderful. The rooms are lovely and very clean, the bathrooms are spectacular. We stayed on the 23rd floor so we had a great view. Comfy beds, nice fluffy pillows. Nicely decorated. Room service was pricey but delicious! Only bad thing is the TV, you'd think a 5 star hotel would've gotten LCDs by now, doesn't really matter to me though. We didn't even turn it on. I'll definitely return to the Amora.

Reviews.Title: “No Personality”
Reviews.Author: Dash-sin
Reviews.Content: The Amora Hotel Sydney is well located, a 10 minute walk from Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House and also a 10 minute walk from Martin Place in the central business district. Rooms are of a comfortable size, clean and the best part is the bathroom. On the service front they have a long way to go though - the front desk staff are semi-efficient and helpful and the staff on the first floor restaurant are downright rude, tardy and left to their own devices. Overall one can't say this hotel leaves any memorable impression - it's ok, it has no personality of it's own but the location is convenient and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality Hotel over many years”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller201033
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm surprised that the Jamison Hotel gets mixed reviews. I used to stay in the Jamison hotel back in 2003-2005, stayed there about 6 or 7 times back then for business. It was one of the best value for money luxury hotels in Sydney CBD back then so I thought it still had to be good today. Having not stayed in the hotel for 5 years, I read the comments on TripAdvisor when I booked in March 2010 and became extremely nervous that maybe the quality had slipped. I need not have been worried. The hotel (in my partner and my experience) was top quality. We flew in from the UK (Where we live) at 6am and the staff were extremely flexible and friendly helping us check in early, use all the facilities in the hotel and help settle us in after a 30hour journey from London. When I first walked into reception and spoke to the staff, I have to say that the hotel has lost NOTHING in the way of service, its still very lovely as you walk in. The room itself again I was VERY nervous it wouldn't be clean or maybe those amazing luxury bathrooms 7 years ago hadn't been maintained. I shouldn't have been worried, it still looked pretty much brand new including the carpets, walls, bedding, furniture, bathroom etc. It was all high quality, all clean and spacious just as I remembered it. The pool/health spa was also very nice, we stayed mid week so it was fairly quiet during the day and although not staffed very well it suited us just fine as we want to chill out in peace. Food in our opinion (We had breakfast and one dinner there) again was just as good as I remember it. Good quality and nice service. I once again feel bad for everyone on TripAdvisor who had a less than perfect experience at Jamison Hotel. OK - Its not a 5 star hotel.... but its very high quality, I like the taste of the decor - Its modern and the service and cleanliness is always top rate and in my opinion you pay alot more for a similar standard in other hotels in Sydney. And before you may think that our standards perhaps aren't very high and we are easy to please..... Think not ..... My partner and I often stay in "Leading hotels of the world" affiliated hotels all over the world....... Places that cost 2-3 times per night than the Jamison charges and fundamentally it is a GREAT hotel. I have to say that apart from small details on service that a 5 star hotel offers, its just as good as a base in Sydney. We've stayed in places that cost $800/ night where we've still had to complain about sheets not being clean, bathrooms having mould, service being poor and rude, food having to be sent back, reservations being messed up etc........ So whilst I also feel bad for guests who've had a less than perfect stay, I also would question and take with a grain of salt what their expectations were to begin with. Mistakes happen in hotels, we travel often and just about every hotel in every city in every continent things happen. Overall would always in the past and continue in the future to recommend Jamison Hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Four star CBD accomodation”
Reviews.Author: solotrvllr
Reviews.Content: Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, although it was tarred by the checkout experience. Location: Excellent. Centrally placed in CBD, two minutes from the Wynyard station, and 5-10 minutes from everywhere else in the CBD area. Check-In: Efficient and quick, service with a smile. Room: Reasonably well equipped, very clean, elegantly furnished although the TV was dated and placed in a position where it was not very easy to see if you were lying on the bed. The bed itself was extremely comfortable and I slept soundly on all the nights of my stay. The view from my room (7th floor) was reasonable with some view of the city and not much obstruction from the opposite office building. Bathroom: Superb; one of the cleanest and largest that I've seen so far; a full tub, clean shower with generous water pressure and hot water. A large window that provided natural light - however the window shade could not be kept open as it would give the people in the opposite office buildings a very clear view in. One downside of the hotel was no complimentary internet access - at AUD 9.95 per hour or AUD 25 per day for internet access this was nothing short of extortion. Checkout experience: Altogether rude. The hotel manager - Pawan Kumar - behaved in a thoroughly unprofessional way, refusing to honor the hotel policy stated on the reservation. The reservation did not explicitly mention at 1.5% surcharge if settling the bill with a credit card. When reminded of this, the impression given was that it was the customer's problem and not the hotel's. Furthermore, when inquired why the surcharge was imposed, the response implied that it was at the hotel's whim.

Reviews.Title: “The people make the difference.”
Reviews.Author: 12rocklily
Reviews.Content: Whilst the rooms were simple they were comfortable and more than adequate. The location is wonderful- close to the Rocks and Circular Key, but also to the CBD and main shopping drags. We used taxis for longer drives but mainly walked. Felt safe- even on a busy Saturday night walking back from the Capital Theatre was completed in less than 20 mins (in heels). Having said that it is the staff that make the difference. Troy, is exceptional and leads a staff at the front door that any hotel should be proud off. Most staff members are not in your face, but certainly step up when they are needed. Our group, from two families, would stay there again, and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate incident (not hotel's fault) marred my stay”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Overall I would give this hotel 7 to 7.5 out of 10 if the TA rating system so allowed, as it is a classic '3.5 stars': since it does not, I have had to decide between 3 out of 4 (a tad harsh) and 4 out of 5 (a tad generous). Upon checking out, the male staff member said that I had hired an adult video. I had a discussion with me, made all the more embarrassing because others heard what he maintained I had purchased. Eventually I left without paying the $16 or so charge for the alleged adult movie viewing. Some eight hours later I received a most apologetic call from the manager, who explained that the hotel had no control over the movie supply as these were beamed into the hotel's entertainment system by a specialist company. The manager explained that there had been a 'tachnical hitch' and profusely apologised. So while I do not blame the hotel for this error, it could have been handled better by the initial staff member I encountered particularly since I had to stare into his eyes and inform him that I most certainly did not hire the said video. I concede that it was my word against the hotel records but the forcefulness of my repeated denials ought to have alerted him to how I believed what I was saying. The room was large; the bathroom especially so; both were properly cleaned. There was no noise transmission. My first night's stay was on a public holiday evening: hotel occupancy was low, confirmed by a spartan attendance at breakfast which was pleasant if unexceptional for a hotel of this standard. I obtained a rate for one night of A$180 and the other A$170 through www.wotif.com: I overheard a desk clerk offering a right for the next night of A$220 to an enquirer and then a comment from the clerk that she lacked the power to offer a corporate rate. On balance the wotif rate was reasonable. The hotel is well situated: despite the false adult movie hire allegation, I would stay here again but just wish that TA had the option of a rating out of 10 by 0.5 graduations not just out of 5 by increments of 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for nice hotel in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: Numbateer
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a Saturday night the day before on their web site and got a good rate. We found the hotel to be clean, quite and comfortable. We were on the 4th floor so no veiws (but we did pay for harbor views either). The room was a good size, bathroom was great with a deep bath and bedding was very big clean and comfortable. I noticed that the top of the side table in the entry passage to the room could have used a sanding and a coat of varnish but that was the only thing I could fault about the room. The TV wasn't a flat panel but again we didn't watch a lot of TV. We tried the buffet breakfast (included in the room tariff) I though it was execellent with a good selection of fresh fruit and hot food. We also went to the bar downstairs which was small but nice and friendly and has happy hour most days. It's got a smallish indoor pool and spa which looked good for a swim. The staff were very helpful (I initally booked the wrong type of room but they sorted it out without any problems) and checkout was quick and painless. The weekend rate including the seafood meal looks like good value so we'll try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by accident and it is a luxury hotel and is worth trying out. Rooms/bathrooms are spotlessly clean, bathrooms are generously sized with large bathtubs and roomy showers. The room I had only had views of the buildings around it but the windows let in plenty of light during the day and the blockout curtains work great. Very quiet room. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, had one of the best nights sleep ever. Well equipped mini bar and bathroom accessories. Internet is available. Room service was quick with a good menu though a little on the pricey side (they all are though! lol). The service from the staff was amazing, cannot fault them at all. Every single person I encountered was professional, tidy, friendly and willing to do just about anything to help out. Great location of the hotel as it it only 5-10 minutes easy walk to circular quay and the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Well located in downtown Sydney excellent base for business”
Reviews.Author: agrill
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 14 days in February (summer) in Sydney while on a work trip. Having lived in Sydney for 11 years, and now living in London, I have only stayed in a few Sydney hotels. The hotel is well situated in the downtown area, and almost underneath the Wynyard railway station. It is also within easy walking distance to the main shopping areas as well as Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Opera House. The hotel has a decent sized indoor pool which was invaluable during the hot and humid summer weather. The only downside was the â€œbroadbandâ€� in the hotel (which at $50/week is quite reasonable) was very slow. www.speedtest.org showed speed of just 90kb/s (0.09mb/s!). The hotel did not charge me for this and I used a Telstra pre-paid mobile broadband SIMM card instead. The team in the Business Centre could not have been moore helpful scanning my receipts for my expense report. Make sure you ask for a high floor and face Wynyard â€“ you then get a decent view of the city. Good for business and personal stays

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Executive Suite with a fantastic corner view of Sydney Harbour and Darling Harbour. Very comfortable, good facilities. It was nice to be able to cool off in the pool after work and sit on the sun deck (bit of an exaggeration, more like a balcony!). Excellent location for business district and all major tourist spots. Could walk to Circular Quay, The Rocks, Darling Harbour and main shopping area. Visit Sydney regularly on business, will stay here again. No wifi internet was a hassle. If you use a mac book air you need a ethernet connection adapter which i had to go and buy as i hadn't brought one with me. Connection rates expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, disgusting, shameless”
Reviews.Author: FDanvers
Reviews.Content: Booked into the hotel late on Friday, only to step into one of the filthiest rooms I had been in ever. The photographs illustrate my experience: nail clippings, hair from different guests, other unidentifiable object but dirt nevertheless. The corners of the carpet were covered in dust more than an inch thick. Cupboard doors did not close which meant that the lights stayed on. The bedding and mattress reeked of body odour, with a strong musty smell throughout the room. The blackout blind was badly torn and outside the rails. Woodwork was in a bad state with paint peeling off in long strips. Security latches had been removed. Underneath the bed I found much larger amounts of filth which could be scraped away by the handful. The duvet cover had a tear of at least 60 cm. The waste baskets were dirty inside with smelly stains. I was given another room the next morning after insisting that the duty manager inspected my room (I refused housekeeping's offer to inspect as that may not necessarily lead to a report to management). The new room - though having a great view and a windowed bathroom with an equally great view - was cleaner but far, far from the standards one would expect for a AU$350 room. As with the other room I could only view about 4-5 channels that gave a clear image, and only when standing right in front of the tv. Staff upon checkin and checkout were indifferent and almost unfriendly, although the concierge and bellhops were with exception courteous and helpful. I complained before about bad service (but generally very good rooms) at the Westin in Sydney but longed back oh-so-badly for that hotel. The comment that I made about the rooms in the Westin Sydney - "the illusion that I was the first and only person ever to use the room was helped greatly through perfect maintenance and cleaning" - simply cannot be made for this dirty hotel. Sure, it must be very tough to keep every aspect of a large hotel at the same level. But such a flagrant disregard for basic rules of hygiene while charging $350 a night is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “shocking management”
Reviews.Author: ecilop01
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel I did not have a reservation. I assumed that I would be able to pick up a room, at a reasonable price. Upon speaking to a lovely blonde girl at the desk we were about to complete the check in, until I saw a girl txting on her mobile phone at the front desk. I looked at her, and she continued to complete her txt. I immediately knew that this was not the place for me to stay because I wanted 5 star service, and with 5 star service comes professionalism. It would seem that the 'Duty Manager' would rather txt her friends than be concerned with anyone who is staying in the hotel. She then walked off leaving an obviously untrained girl to complete the check in...I was disappointed with the service and the obvious lack of attention (via mobile phone) from the duty manager... needless to say, I stay in a lot of 5 star hotels and I left to stay at the Sheraton on the Park!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but NOT 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: peach6
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Amora Jamison. Stayed for 3 nights in King Room with Buffet Breakfast included. The location is great just a short walk to rocks & circular quay. The hotel room was comfortable, bathroom was spacious. Price was fairly good value & most staff seemed to be friendly enough. The things that make this hotel NOT five stars - hotel pool was cold, does not seem to be heated!! - the tv and unit in hotel very outdated, a FIVE star hotel should have a least have a LCD, not a 7+ year old TV which doesnt even face the bed, is on the side and difficult to watch tv comfortably. - Buffet breakfast was average, some of the food was cold (sausages, hash browns) - Room Service VERY average, i got a club sandwich which i could have gotten at a food court and it would have been better! - Hotel Bar closes early 8pm some nights AND one incident we experienced we were VERY dissapointed with. The supervisor at breakfast went to a nearby table to ours where a staff was clearing the table, and told him that he wasn't fast enough and needed to pick up his act. This was very unprofessional! We did write this on feedback form and received a letter saying they have passed out comments along to appropratie manager etc. Would not stay here again, would stay somewhere more expensive for better service/decor/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGuruUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in January. Room was spacious, fantastic bathroom with shower and wonderful bath (great for a long soak after sightseeing). Great location; a short walk from Circular Quay and a 5 minute taxi ride to Darling Harbour. Would recommend the Bridge Climb (didn't do this on our first trip to Australia), but was so pleased we did it this time. If you have time, would suggest your take one of the ferries to Cremorne Point, this has fantastic views of the Opera House and Harbour. Fish and chips on the beach at Manly is also a must. Lots of artists from 'The Big Day out' stay here; so if it's good enough for Dizzee Rascal, then it should be good enough most people!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: trjn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora Jamison for one night on a mystery hotel deal. We've stayed there once in the past and I really liked it, and was glad to see if was just as lovely as I remembered. However when we enquired about extending our stay an extra night we found it would cost us $450 - I would never pay that. It is nice, but not that nice! I like this hotel because it doesn't try too hard to be "modern" in decor. It is contemporary while still being classically comfortable. And the bathrooms are large with a huge separate bath (though the grout could use some Ajax). The room was clean but a few little signs of wear-and-tear - chipped paint and dirty mark on the front door. But nothing major. The phone service was a bit disappointing. Their into is too long, they directed me to the wrong person, and then there was some modem-like high pitched sounds so I had to hang up and call back. Parking is expensive but not exceptionally so for Sydney. Overall, very nice hotel in great location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Rosieg30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and highly reccommend it. The CBD, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour are all within walking distance so it is a great location to be in. Staff were all very friendly and couldn't be more helpful. Our room was not huge but had a very comfortable king bed and a nice bathroom with deep bath. Not much of a view but we were surrounded by much taller buildings so that couldn' be helped. Buffet Breakfast was OK but on the day we were there they had a bus load of dutch(?) tourists and they liked to eat so most things we had to wait for. I agree with other post that I am not sure whether it is quite a 5 star but we had a very enjoyable stay and would definately stay at the Amora Jamison again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: hetrogenius
Reviews.Content: Great view from the rooms overlooking the city. really beautiful decore

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nov973
Reviews.Content: Not sure that this is truly a 5 star hotel, but loved the location and didn't have any problems at all....Check-in staff were friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Bed was a little soft for my liking. Buffet breakfast was a pleasant surprise as I'm not usually a fan but this was well stocked with a wide range of food....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MIKEKGoldCoastQLD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were en-route to Shanghai and decided to break our journey (Bris/Syd/Shanghai) in Sydney to experience first class dining at the Rocks and make the trip memorable. We purchased a 5 star mystery hotel by booking through lastminute.com, the Amora came back as confirmed, we looked at the Hotel web site which looked quite adequate to say the least. Upon arrival we checked in and went directly to the Room, in a nutshell the Room was "Absolutely Disgusting" Dirty, Curtains Rotting, Bed with no under sheet, Desk falling apart, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here just for a relaxing weekend. It really is 5 star worthy hotel. Staff are fantastic nothing is too much trouble, there is always someone to open the door for you no matter what time of night. When we went their was a pianist playing which was very enjoyable. Rooms are spacious and comfortable with very modern features, big bathroom, great buffet breakfast. As I live in sydney and have stayed at many hotels in the area of the same calibre, this is one of the best. The location is ideal quick walk to the station, quick stroll to circular quay, it is in the heart of stdney CBD. I strongly reccomend this hotel to any travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the reputation”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTravelmad
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a mystery booking. Was given several comments from people about "ooh, good hotel" "5 star, equal to more well known others in same area". Its not, on either count. A flashy foyer and smiling staff do not a 5 star hotel make. We were given a handicapped equipped room, not surprising really, it being a mystery booking at low rate. However, just because a room, particularly the bathroom, is built to suit the handicapped, does not mean it will suit the able bodied - and it didnt. Room was stuffy even with the aircon on high fan. Pillows were dreadful. They do offer a pillow service, but why, just put decent ones in the room to start with. Bathroom was dirty, mould on the grout, the floor was superficially swept, so was dirty, and a used glass was not replaced with a clean one. Ate at the Gallery restaurant. Food was good, service was pathetic. Had to ask 3 times to get the water glass refilled. The attitiude of the "maitre d" at breakfast was just this side of rude. Location is good for the harbour and environs, but there is not much in the way of close by eating places on weekends. Front staff are good but they are trying hard for little reason as all their efforts are being negated by shoddy efforts elsewhere. 5 Star hotel - no its not. I have stayed at better hotels with less supposed "pedigree", and lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location... clean rooms...”
Reviews.Author: maverickmelbourne
Reviews.Content: i've stayed in this restaurant twice and quite simply i loved it.. Pro's: - the location.. its only a 10 mins walk to the darling harbour and also to sydney harbour bridge.. - very clean rooms and very nice pool side (with spa and sauna facilitesi).. Con's: - some staff weren't that gr8... - and the bar is nothing to write home about... - but i paid roughly 150dollars for a night and for that money, the stay was first class...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: girltalk
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't classify this hotel 5 star but it's clean and well situated. It's within walking distance to all the major attractions, including the Rocks (~ 5 minutes), Circular Quay (~10 minutes) and Darling Harbour (~ 20 minutes). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amora”
Reviews.Author: Onward64
Reviews.Content: The Amora is typical of the 5-star 'brass and marble' hotels that are around Sydney. It is very conveniently located about 10 minutes walk north to reach the Opera House and Gardens and 20 minutes walk south-west to reach Darling Harbour (the two main tourist areas). The hotel is in the middle of the CBD and surrounded by tall buildings. Unless you ask for a room above the 20th floor, the only view will be looking into office buildings. Towards the top (it's 33 levels) the views improve. However, don't expect sweeping views of the harbour. At best you'll get water glimpses through other buildings. If the view is the most important feature, hotels like the ANA will serve you better but at a much higher price. We asked for a King Corner upgrade. This gives a much lighter room and was worth the $25 cost. Staff were very helpful. Due to some minor miscommunication we were not given the room we asked. However, the problem was fixed quickly with a smile. The rooms are a good size and quite light (especially the corner rooms with an extra window). The bathrooms were modern and well-appointed. From the bathtub, you can relax and look out on the city (which means that if you don't drop the blind the office workers can also relax and look in on you . . . but a small price to pay). It was lovely at night to enjoy the city lights. The breakfast was top-notch. It was the usual buffet spread with everything presented beautifully. There were plenty of staff on duty so coffee was quick and hot. Food was excellent and a great variety. Make sure that you have breakfast included in your tarrif. Despite it being fantastic, I noticed that they were charging $38 extra, which is very high for Sydney. Parking is $35 extra for self-parking but as the car park attendant said they were full and to come back after 5pm, we were forced to use valet parking for $45. I think this is a bit of a scam on the part of the privately owned car park to ensure they collect the most from city commuters which they charge by the hour (compared to hotel guests who get charged a flat rate). I would gladly return to the hotel. In a city that charges $300 upwards for similar standard rooms in the area, the Amora represents excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Robocopms
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night to attend a concert at the Opera House and had a thoroughly great time. Excellent hotel. Modern tasteful decore with all the amenities that one could want. Fast friendly staff - we had a minor problem with the TV late at night and someone came up and fixed it straight away. Walking distance to Circular Quay and Opera House or Darling Harbour and attractions. I can't write anymore as everything was fabulous and it made for a wonderful and memorable weekend. I would highly recommend staying at the Amora Hotel Jamison Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JasonHik
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Sydney City Centre, spitting distance to the Rocks, got it cheap through lastminute.com. Great rooms, good service. Loved it. I didn't eat at the restaurant so can't rate it - there's plenty of eating houses around - including a ramen noodle cafe that I ate at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: johannespuhl
