Reviews.Content: Everything, except the annoying key-card lift and room entry system (we needed a replacement card almost every day) was fine - it's a typical big hotel in a large city - not five-star, but pleasant enough. The rooms and staff were o.k. but not special. It's a reasonable choice for $180 given its location, but have breakfast in the adjacent Metro Centre to avoid paying $25 each in the hotel. Its best selling point is its location, very close to Wynyard bus and train station (with connections to the airport, North Shore, etc.) and within easy walking distance of the main tourist attractions (the Harbour and Opera House (Circular Quay), Darling Harbour, The Rocks, the Royal Botanic Garden and Woolloomooloo, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a bit average for a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BFD
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight when attending a function in the city. Room was OK, but a bit dated and worn. Service was OK as well, but not to the standard that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Came back from the function and dinner and we were going to have a drink at the bar before going up to the room for the night, but the bar was closed at 8pm which is really not acceptable for a hotel claiming this standard. We walked down to the Four Seasons and were welcomed with open arms into their bar, with excellent service to match. For the price there are other options in the city that are far more impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - unlucky with Blackout and check into parking first”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora for two nights, arriving from a night at another 5 star hotel. A very convenient location. The Amora has a lovely lobby / reception area. We had difficulty with parking - when we drove in and checked about parking - we were told by a staff member we could park our car ourselves for $35 per night or valet parking $45 per night. As the parking station was just next door, my husband decided this would be an easy option. However 30 minutes later he was back at the hotel advising there was no where in the station to park at 12noon Friday. He was then advised that the parking was full for self park. After all this time of messing around he then ended up going with the valet parking. The complications of getting in and out of a parking area, one way streets a week before Christmas was quite stressful. Apart from this waste of time all was very good. All other staff of the hotel were very well informed and attentive. We enjoyed the Bar for drinks during the Happy Hour on Friday afternoon and had a wonderful day. We had a rude awakening Saturday morning at about 7.15am to the loud speaker above our bed with an announement that there had been a blackout and that it could be for some time and to use the firestairs. After this scarey jolt from my slumber, I decided I might as well go back to sleep. Only to be jolted awake again approximately 10 minutes later to the same message (I am guessing) in Japanese. A short time after this another update on the black out in English. I know this is beyond management's control however I am not sure if there is a less intrusive way of getting the message across - perhaps not. After several flights of stairs to the lobby, and finding out as much as we could it appeared that it was going to be power out for some time. We took ourselves off for the day (we had planned on spending the day by the pool on level 3 but were not about to do the stair flight climb a few times). We caught up on a movie, did lots of shopping and got back about 3.30pm to the hotel to get ready for our function out that evening. However, on returning, the power was still out. After sitting around for about 30 minutes deliberating on climbing the flights of stairs, the lights were back on! The staff seemed to handle the contingency plan quite well - I was then informed that this was not the first time they had such a situation. As we headed out for the evening, housekeeping were arriving to make up our room. All staff were excellent in such a difficult situation. We decided, along with quite a few others, to head to the lower floor bar for the Happy Hour only to find it was closed - I guess the black out caused a few complications. We had a good evening out and another restful night - this time no intercom waking us. The Hotel was lovely and staff excellent and I understand this situation was beyond anyone's control, however I do think Management could have acknowledge either a note about the situation under the door or an email to follow up or even a free night's parking as it was an even more expensive weekend than we had planned!!. It was only 12 days ago so maybe the note is coming in the mail!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed and hardly a 5 star hotel............”
Reviews.Author: Mssunshine12
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner decided to treat ourselves to a special Christmas break at this so-called '5 star' hotel. Unfortunately, our experience was less than '5 star' and we didn't even make it through one night before we checked out. The room itself was fairly sizeable but felt tired and lacked any real 'wow factor'. However, the bathroom was decent enough with an impressively deep bath. As we explored the rest of the room, we discovered a small, dated tv hidden inside a bulky wardrobe unit to the side of the bed. This meant if we wanted to watch it, we'd have to crook our necks to the side. As we were there for the whole weekend, it wasn't something we wanted to put up with. For a 5 star hotel, we expected a modern tv to be sensibly positioned toward the front of the bed! Not too much to ask really? We went to reception and raised the issue with one of the staff who informed us that all of the rooms were set up this way and the only alternative was a disabled room. We checked this out but it was hardly an improvement plus it felt too clinical and very cold. Subsequently the staff offered us a 1 bed suite but were told that we could only have it if we paid an upgrade fee of an extra $70 per night - on top of what we were paying already! An extra $70 just to have a decent tv in front of a bed????? We didn't think we were asking too much but they would not waive the upgrade fee and only offered to decrease the fee to $50 per night. We certainly didn't think it was worth the hassle and the extra fee. That was the best they can do apparently......... As this was a special weekend for us both and we had high expectations for this '5-star- hotel we decided to check out and check into the Hilton which was down the road. If you can, do go to the Hilton as the service was amazing there! We got a free upgrade to a deluxe room as soon as we walked in and not to mention they have an LCD tv positioned in front of the bed. Result!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star? that's a stretch!”
Reviews.Author: TW_Yachtgal
Reviews.Content: While this hotel had some commendable facilities I would never classify it as five star. The television inside a cupboard (with one door broken) is an old Box Style Television straight from the nineties. The bed was rickety and very soft.....NOT recommended for honeymooners! A large bath located in a very nice upgraded bathroom was the redeeming feature. Overall the hotel was good for the price we paid from an online booking facility but many travellers would be disappointed if they booked expecting their rooms to be the standard of a true five star hotel. The lobby is lovely, the corridors quite nice and the location is fine, between Circular Quay/TheRocks/major shopping precinct. If we'd paid the Ã¤dvertised "Rack rate" we would have been demanding our money back but if you can secure a room sub $200 AUD it's probably a fair price for the standard of their basic rooms

Reviews.Title: “AVOID- DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveNTraveling0601
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed on the 29th floor, December 18th and the entire building lost power. That's right- we had to climb 29 flights of stairs to get to our room/belongings/passports/etc. In addition, they don't have a back of generator, so after 4 hours with out any power there were NO LIGHTS IN THE EMERGENCY STAIRWELL. What on earth would they have done if there was a fire???!?! They placed glow sticks in the stairwells for lighting... We helped this poor elderly couple in their 70's trying to catch a plane carry their 4 bags down 15 flights of stairs.... To top it all off- they offered us NOTHING for compensation. Their response was "it's not our fault, other buildings lost power too". We had planned to stay 4 other nights there but quickly canceled our reservations and stayed at the Intercontinental (a lovely hotel with awesome customer service AND electricity). p.s. They also screwed up our cancelation and charged us for the nights we had previously booked even though we checked out- we are now working with Amex to correct that... There is nothing good about this place- room views are blocked by other buildings, the rooms need to be updated, and the WORST customer serivce I have ever experienced. I can't tell you enough what a horrible experience it was. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: HarrieRW
Reviews.Content: The service at the Jamison in Sydney was amazing. When we arrived, there was a blackout, but the staff were very accommodating and gave out free juice and water. We were given access to our room pretty much as soon as the system had rebooted. I asked for a VCR and guest services arranged for one to be set up in our hotel room free of charge. We were very impressed. However, for some reason we couldn't adjust the volume of our video. The hotel organised for some technicians to try and fix it, and when they couldn't, gave us a complimentary upgrade. Although the televisions are a little old (not flatscreen), my partner and I thought the service and cleanliness more than made up for it. We also tried out the pool and spa. It was lovely! The Jamison is also located in a very convenient location, it's pretty much right next to Wynyard station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: nimen_hao
Reviews.Content: The rooms were certainly 5-star quality with beautiful beds, a soaker tub, and the coolest closet/drawer system I've ever seen (there were tons of drawers that hid things you didn't expect, like the mini-bar, plates/glasses, the ironing board, and finally the closet that lit up when you opened it - very clever design!). There was even a "choose your own pillow" system where you could call the front desk and have a pillow delivered to your room that matched your preferred firmness. The lights in the bathroom were are little weird because they were slow to turn on/off, so I kept having to press them numerous times to get the desired outcome. The staff was awesome, particularly the concierge and doormen. Very helpful and very friendly. Fantastic location to all the sights, but off the typical tourist track of hotels. Very close to the Rocks and Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: UKVisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights on returning from a cruise, the room was spacious, we had a corner room on the 24th floor. We arrived at 9 am from the ship and the room was ready. The room was very clean with all amenties , tea, coffee, kettle, toaster not sure what they expected us to do with that as they was no knife or plates anyway we did not use the toaster. The breakfast was not included in our rate so we went to the food court below and had a full monty for 8 Aus dollars. This was not open at the weekend but there are plent of cafes round circular Quay which is 5 minutes walk away. Excellent location 10 minutes to opera House, 5 minutes to the Rocks( lots of places to eat and drink here) and 10 minutes walk to the main shopping areas of George street. We used the buses and trains and the Concierge was very helpful on numerous occasions. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms and some of the best baths in the business”
Reviews.Author: NZdad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times for work and have always found the Amora a good business travelers hotel. The best thing about this hotel is that each room seems bigger than a normal hotel room -which makes for a nice airy feel. The bathroom is also big with a nice, big deep bath - which is one of the deepest I've seen in a hotel. Unless it comes included in your rate, don't eat breakfast there - its OK, but like a lot of hotel food, its completely overpriced at A$40. There is a nice cafe on the other side of the road, slightly further up the hill and you will get great personal service and excellent, freshly cooked food. So... don't go for the breakfast, do go for the big rooms and bath!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & top rate service”
Reviews.Author: SharkAustralia
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel as a secret hotel on Lastminute.com, so we got a great price for a 5* hotel in a great location. Service all along was fantastic, everyone seemed to go the extra mile. We experienced problems with our aircon and were very quickly moved into another room, with an upgrade for our inconvenience, but even without this perk I have to rate the hotel excellent. We would definitely recommend the hotel and return ouselves.

Reviews.Title: “make sure to bring a sleeping bag”
Reviews.Author: nlim21
Reviews.Content: I think the staff at this hotel are bipolar - it's either they're very nice or very rude. My bed and pillow were full of hair. At first, I was going to sleep in my normal clothes, but my roomie's bed was clean, so we just share. The strange thing is that for a room of 2 beds, they will only change 1 of the sheets. The new sheet on the 3rd day had something that looked like bird poop :( But the location was really good - it's on the same block as one of the wynward station openings. And you can have a nice walk to the Opera house in 30 minutes(including a lot of stops for photos) And there are a lot of places to eat if you don't want to eat at the hotel. There's also a mcdonalds and a bank to change money at nearby. Everything else, except the beds, were clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchdude
Reviews.Content: First impression is that the doormen were very polite and helpful. Reception service was brisk and efficient, but not exceptionally friendly. We checked in but the room still had some housekeeping to be done (ironing board out, used soap in the shower, slippers on the floor). We rang reception and were upgraded to a Deluxe Corner King room which was excellent. Brilliant bathroom, excellent storage, well stocked minibar and excellent view. Room was spotless and the whole hotel has a lovely ambience. Reception, bars and spa is very cool and funky, the pool area including spa, sauna and steam room was small bit nice. Had a drink at the bar, it was pretty dark witht he low lighting. Excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Certaintly not a five-star hotel as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: lucidlilies
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work and have stayed in many hotels worldwide. I have stayed at other hotels in Sydney and thought about trying something new and different for this trip. I've heard some good things about the Amora so I decided to book there. The location of the Amora is fantastic. Very centrally located and a short walk to QVB and George Street shopping. It is also close to the Wynyard train station which makes it easy to get around. Also an easy walk to the Rocks if you are looking for something touristy. The room itself is spacious with the bathroom being nearly the size of the bedroom. The bathroom is lovely with a separate large tub and shower. The tub is great to soak in after a long day at work. However, one does not sleep in the bathroom! The bedroom is showing major signs of wear and tear. The carpet is pretty dirty and stained, the coffee/tea waredrobe too big for the room and it was dirty with sugar split from the previous guest (and whatever else was on there), and the duvet was so smelly and stained I had to leave a note for the maid to change it immediately (something I've never done before but couldn't think of sleeping another night with that sorry excuse for a duvet). The staff however have been incredibly nice about making the changes in bedding, etc so I didn't rate this lower than 3 stars but I do hope the hotel does undergo some sort of renovation to get rid of that big bulky waredrobe and put in a flat screen TV, rip out of the carpets, and change all the bedding. I suggest to have the general manager stay at the Interncontinental San Francisco and sleep on that bed - that will show you 5-star comfort at it's finest.

Reviews.Title: “J.A.N's not Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Marcothepolopony
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Sydney for the weekend from the country. A warm greeting from the doormen. Check in was smooth and quick - and I was soon to find out why. Upon dragging my large case up to my allocated room, ready for a drink, I put my card in the door and heard loud voices, protesting my entry to my room. Turns out it was NOT my room after all apparently. Much embarrassment all round, especially for me back at Reception, no apology, hardly any acknowledgment of my plight. Eventually, I had my room - knocking prior to putting card in door. Extensive view of the office block next door, shabby furniture, holes in the wall where furniture has been, dirty tea making area and cups, frayed carpets and no way of double locking my door, an essential when females travel alone. So I called to ask about the security and mentioned the embarrassment of the wrong key card, spoke to Duty Manager - Natalie who had plenty of excuses (NSW Government legislation blah blah) and I asked for a bottle of wine to compensate - she dismissed that instantly. Nothing but excuses. Poor attitude Natalie. I happily booked out at 10am, keeping my place in a very long queue, never to return to this tired, over rated, expensive establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: friedmande
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Amora Hotel in Sydney. We had read several reviews about complimentary upgrades so our hopes were high, as we had notified the hotel we were celebrating our anniversary with a trip to Australia. Sadly, no complimentary upgrades, but they did heavily discount access to the Concierge lounge, which we very much enjoyed. The lounge had a very nice breakfast, great selection of evening hors d'Å“uvres, and complimentary cocktails. All of the staff that we encountered from the front desk to the bellhops to the lounge attendants were pleasant, friendly, and professional. One evening we easily spent 20 minutes chatting with the concierge lounge attendant who had just returned from 6 months in the U.S. The rooms were very clean and nice, though a little smaller than I was expecting, partially due to the bathroom being HUGE. It had both a shower stall and a soaking tub, on opposite sides of the room. But the bed was comfortable and housekeeping did a good job. You CANNOT beat the Amora's location. It took us 7 minutes to walk to Circular Quay, 10 to the Opera House, and 15 or so to Darling Harbour. The hotel is right on top of a major CityRail Station (Wynyard) which can get you around the city and also connect to trains to outer areas like the Blue Mountains. Overall we absolutely loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jshubbub
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel located a short walk from Sydney Harbour. Great views all around. Local pubs within blocks. Sydney Opera House easily accessible. Restaurant is supreme.

Reviews.Title: “5 star in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl2525
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amora for one week in October. I was pleasantly surprised by the five star accomodation especially for the price I paid. The Amora was perfectly located within a one minute walk to the Wynyard train station, 5 minutes to Circular Quay, less than 10 minutes to the Rocks, and about 10 minutes to the Opera House. There are great restaurants and bars within two blocks of the restaurant and more shopping than you can imagine, but I don't know much about the shopping as I don't do that on vacation. As for breakfast, there is a cafe right next door, and there is an entire food court with coffee, lunches, and an ATM right next door. In the hotel, I only ate and had a drink at the Gallery lounge, it was very nice and reasonably priced. The other spots looked great, but I didn't have time to go. The amenities at the hotel were great, beautiful atmosphere, and I can't say enough about the service. The concierge, porters, and reception were fantastic, always opening doors, offering assistance, and helping people to find their way around the city. The room was outstanding! I did not pay top dollar for a top room and feel that I got one anyway. I had a corner room with views of Darling Harbour and a little of the Harbour Bridge. The room was well lit and very spacious. The bathroom was beautiful, it included a large jacuzzi tub. The hot water was ready in seconds. The air conditioner also cooled the room within a couple of minutes of use. The in room service was fantastic. My room was spotlessly clean every day, and any request I had was immediately answered. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for the location, services, looks, and accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Value for Money, Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NamasteBlueMountains
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights & were impressed with every aspect of the Service & Amenities which the Amora Hotel provided. Over the years we have stayed at many of Sydneys Hotels which advertised and boast a 5 Star Rating & have left greatly disappointed, BUT not so with the Amora Hotel. Comfortable bed, great food, quiet room (despite being near the elevator), good gym facilities & above all Friendly, Courteous & Friendly Staff. Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one-night stop off in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: megpickard
Reviews.Content: Transitioning through Sydney for one night on my way back to the UK, I decided to book myself into a decent hotel so I could get a proper sleep before 24 hours on a plane. I chose the Amora Jamison based on Tripadvisor reviews and wasn't disappointed in the slightest. Located an easy 10 minute walk from Circular Quay, just off George Street (one of the main thoroughfares through the city centre), the Amora Jamison is a high-rise hotel with great views across the city (though not quite any of the classic Sydney vistas). When I arrived, it was clear that the hotel is used as a stop off for cruise ship passengers before or after a trip - there were piles of suitcases near reception and an itinerary board detailed a schedule of mealtimes and departure shuttles to the airport/quayside. But the door was opened by a smart doorman, and check-in was swift and there were no queues for the lift at any time, so the hotel is obviously well able to handle big tour groups. I had asked for a quiet room and was assigned a lovely, spacious corner room on one of the top floors, with breathtaking views, even from the bathtub (see photo) - though I expect you'd give some of the people in neighbouring highrises a bit of a view if you kept the blinds open! The room was comfortably furnished, with plenty of natural light and a perfect ambient temperature (which was handy, because Sydney was otherwise incredibly hot and humid, gearing up for one of those amazing thunderstorms). The bathroom was big and had a separate tub and shower cubicle. After a night out with friends in Manly, I walked back to the hotel and then slept like a baby - no noise at all from other guests or rooms or traffic (and I'm quite sensitive to noise, so this is important to me). I'd paid for late checkout, which is completely worth it if, like me, you have a late afternoon flight to catch. So I went out for breakfast in the city (my room rate didn't include breakfast, so can't comment on the food there), then had a last wander around before checking out and asking the doorman to hail a cab. In summary: a great, no hassle experience at a well-located hotel. If I ever make it back to Sydney, I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very plush...but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: dr_rob80
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in a 5 star hotel, so I've not got much to compare it with. By all standards, it seemed to be of 5 star quality. Massive, comfortable bed, huge room, big bathroom, and all the bits and pieces that come with such a place. I got a good rate as a mystery hotel, so I had no real expectations. Generally, I was happy with my stay. That said, they put my colleague and I on vastly different floors (he was floor 3, I was floor 14 or thereabouts), even though it was made as one booking. Negatives: very expensive extras. Room service, internet and breakfast were well above my price range. Location: seemingly good, though one forgets that the northern end of the Sydney CBD is D-E-A-D on weekends. I struggled to find breakfast saturday morning, as all the cafe's and food courts were shut. Ended up at McDonalds of all places. Also, a short but steep climb up from George Street to the hotel might be too much for a guest with limited mobility. Overall, it was nice, but not really my style.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first time visitor to Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Seattlefan
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than the check-in time but were allowed to check into a room for a while. When we went to move to our room they had misplaced our luggage. They had tagged it with a different name. For our entire stay they offered us access to the club room where we could go to breakfast and happy hour. It was a very generous offer and the happy hour was excellent. The coffee was great too. The concierge was always very helpful in helping me find my way around. I was within walking distance of most places that I would want to go for the night life or dinner etc. It was a good find and cheaper than our previous reservations. The rooms were very nice. We even managed to go to the pool and sauna and they were also very cool places to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, affordable and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Ellce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first night away from our daughter recently and stayed at the Amora Jameson (thanks to the reviews on tripadvisor). For $202 on a Saturday night we stayed in a Deluxe Corner room which was quite spacious (much bigger than the Hilton rooms) with a generous bathroom, great location and friendly, helpful staff. Given that it was such a big deal for us to be in a hotel I had high expectations and they were met! I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast is $35 but you get a discount which makes it about $20 - it's a simple buffet style so I'd recommend going out. We found ourselves at a French Patisserie in the rocks and spent less for a delicious brekkie. Can't wait to go back for another night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice room, pool/jacuzzi/sauna were great!”
Reviews.Author: RD130
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite good, with a location close to The Rocks/Sydney Harbour/Opera House - only a 5-10 minute walk. Hotel was very clean, professional staff, all you'd expect from a 4 star hotel in the downtown of a world class city like Sydney. Highly recommended. Oh, and the prices are very reasonable for a hotel of this class!

Reviews.Title: “wanderful honey moon”
Reviews.Author: Delfina76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to all the attractives place in Sydney. We where in honey moon and it was a wanderful and relaxing place to stay near down town. The swimming pool was nice, but the sauna too small. The breakfast was plenty of choices and the services very smart. All the staff very pretty in particular the concierger, but I don't remember the name

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: newbury2003
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in the heart of the CBD, within walking distance of the Rocks (5 mins), Circular Quay (10 mins) and shopping arcades on George Street (15 mins). The hotel came as a pleasant surprise with attentive and efficient staff, very clean with a cozy spa facility and filling breakfast buffet. Highly recommended ...plus, check out the Japanese restaurant 1 block from the hotel on Jamison Street. Good value plus they also offer take aways

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: tcmorse6570
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room and arrived early. They let us crash in a king room until ours was ready. They apparently spelled my name wrong on the luggage and couldn't seem to find it when our room was ready. It didn't take that long to find, but the manager said he felt so bad he'd give us access to the club lounge for the five nights. The lounge was great with a decent breakfast, evening selections and drinks. That gesture saved us a ton of money in restaurant costs. The room was fairly large with large windows at the end of a hallway on the 18th floor. It was very quiet all the time. Didn't notice traffic noise at all. Nice large bathroom. Comfortable beds. I thought housekeeping was great. Never seemed intrusive and always efficient. We used the pool and hot tub several times in the evenings after walking a lot during the day. Never anyone else there and the pool area is very nice, near the spa. I really can't think of anything about the hotel to complain about. It's location is great. Very close to Wynyard Station. We'd like to especially thank Goy for being so helpful and friendly in the lounge every day. She would ask us how our day had gone and if there was anything at all she could get for us. Nothing could have beat how nice this hotel was especially knowing we had only paid $136 US / day through Expedia. I'm thinking my luck with hotels lately has a lot to do with the research I've done using TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the little things matter too”
Reviews.Author: NXF1
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night for a 4 night stay, as our flight into Sydney had been delayed. We had booked a corner king room, but were only given a standard room. The staff in general were good, but at checkout, the hotel tried to charge us for minibar usage - which was incorrect. Our room was on the 14th Floor and had partial views of the harbour. Even on this floor, we found that the traffic noise was still noticeable. The room itself was excellent, and the bed was very comfortable. Despite the minor issues, we enjoyed the time we spent in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lucy7316
Reviews.Content: Just got back from sydney stayed at Amora for 4 nights. quick and easy check in and check out. Reception staff were friendly but nothing special. Door people were very friendly always opening doors and asking if we needed a cab or anything while leaving the hotel each time. Great location! Circular quay, darling harbour and CBD all within walking distance which was awesome. Room service was excellent, with good menu options. Gym facilites and pool and spa pool were excellent. Also had a facial at the spa there which was superb. Think we stayed in a king Room this was great as well as the bathroom being huge! Bit disappointed with the tv in the room, quite small and in an awkward position. It was on the right side on the end of the bed but up high. You could change the angle but would of been nice if it was a flat screen hanging on the wall in fromt of the bed which we had at out previous 4 star hotel. Nothing to complain about though, had a great stay and would defintaley go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “A booking stuff up spoilt the stay!”
Reviews.Author: FussyNSW
Reviews.Content: The Amora is in a fabulous location - if you want to explore Sydney. We were told the car park was full and we would have to pay for valet parking if we wanted to park there - given we were in the middle of Sydney we had little choice. Reception staff were excellent and friendly. We were offered breakfast vouchers at 20% off which we took. Went to the room, it looked great, unfortunately it smelt very badly of cigarettes. Having had a similar experience recently we couldn't be bothered to complain - we were pushed for time anyway, so we decided to put up with it. Although the room was very nice, the smell wrecked it. After we'd been in there for a while we didn't notice the smell too much, but everytime we went back in it hit us. The following day when we woke up we realised the damage - the bedding and everything else smelt so badly I was physically sick! So much for the cheap breakfast vouchers.My husband assured me the breakfast was great. I filled in the complaints card with my comments and received a phone call telling me that I had been booked into a smoking room at my request. NO WAY! Somebody somewhere along the lines had stuffed up, I would rather sleep under a bridge than knowingly book a smoking room!!! I felt I had been fobbed off with the phone call - basically it was " tough, it's your fault" So, much as I liked the hotel, I'm not sure I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a nice place”
Reviews.Author: kingzac
Reviews.Content: The room at the Amora was ncie without being fantastic. Though our bed was a little squeeky the rest of the room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel itself was nice and was aesthetically pleasing as we wandered around and checked out the facilities. Probably the most impressive part of our stay was early in our night there. While the stay had been friendly and helpful from the start one particular staff member raised the bar on his peers. It was raining when we left to find a place to eat nearby, not proving to be an easy option when everything nearby seemed closed on a Sunday night. So we did a quick runner down the street from cover to cover trying to find somewhere open. A staff member from the hotel was walking in the opposite direction and ran up to us and said "You're staying at the hotel right?" and then handed us his umbrella and told us to just leave it at the front when we got back and continued on his way in the rain. I thought this very selfless act was amazing from a worker at a hotel, especially as we'd only been there a matter of hours and neither of us remembered seeing this staff member. If only we'd got his name we would have left a more detailed report of this on our appraisal of the room. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time here to properly use all the facilities which was a shame considering how much we enjoyed the time we did spend in the hotel. All in all our stay was good, breakfast was very good and staff all around were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great and simple”
Reviews.Author: Lazy_Suzan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, and both of our stays have been enjoyable. Check in and check out were extremely fast, and the room while simple, was nice. The only complaint with the room is that the doona was just too hot, and we couldn't match the air con with it. Also that at $40 to park the car, i could've got a taxi to and from my destination. The buffet breakfast was delicious, with all of the staff very nice and helpful. The guest services staff were very nice and ordered us taxis, held our luggage for us and reccomended restaurants with a smile, even when we had a restless 2 year old in tow. I would absoolutly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kalei_lau
Reviews.Content: We found out about Amora Jamison through a well known deal website, which offers surprise deals. We didn't mind where we stayed, as long as it was 5* and in the city,. boy were we glad when we got there. Airport shuttle took us to the door, where we were greeted by friendly, polite and accommodating staff. I can't remember what kind of room we had booked into when we originally booked, but we upgraded at the check-in for not very much money (maybe $50-80 per night extra?) to the executive club suite/deal. best decision ever!!! We had free breakfast in the exclusive club lounge, free refreshments all day, access to lots of other exclusive stuff and the room! Beautiful marble bathroom, stunningly appointed, pristine and clean. Bed was super comfy with the usual assorted pillow menu. was opulent - all class. Only problem with the room was that the TV was in a poor position and had bad reception - BUT - with views of the Sydney skyline, who wants to watch tv anyway? The hotel was near the rocks in sydney, and circular quay but it pretty far away from most other things. we took the monorail a few times and cabs to chinatown and stuff at the other end of the city. Lots of little back alley secrety type places to explore at night, with great food and cool bars scattered everywhere. The absolute BEST parts of the stay n- we were treated like royalty bc we had upgraded (exclusive after hours access to the spa and pool, which just quietly is fantastic - big balcony with views!) and the pre-dinner drinks and canapes, which are included. To be honest, we got quite drunk at the pre-dinner drinks, which again had amazing views and good company. It was unlimited booze and canapes like sushi, antipasto type things, delicious little treats. we ate and drank for a few hours and then chilled out in the bar downstairs, where we taught the bartenders how to make some of our favourite cocktails. a great experience, will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LouAndDave
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel separately from the rest of our honeymoon package as I wasn't happy with the hotels offered in Sydney. The problem is, staying here just served to show how mediocre a couple of the other hotels we stayed at on our trip were! Our corner room (28th floor I think) was fabulous, views of the bright city lights and a large beautiful bathroom. Staff on the door were very welcoming although it was disappointing not to get an early check-in having previously asked for it. Room service left the fridge door slightly ajar one day causing it to overheat and be very noisy, that was our only complaint really. Location was superb as the trendy George Street is just down the hill and easy walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour etc. Breakfast is overpriced ($35) but there are a couple of nearby bistros where you can eat for less than half that. There is a bar and restaurant but we didn't eat there, seemed quite trendy and fairly popular with locals though. We would definitely stay here again if we ever return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: uniquem03
Reviews.Content: I have never had any experience like this before in my life and I've traveled extensively to multiple countries. I've even had much better hotel experiences in multiple Third World countries! When I first checked in, I was given 2 cards that needed to be used to activate the elevators (and to get into the hotel room). The woman at the front desk gave me the cards without activating them, so I spent about 5 minutes in the elevator, unable to get it working and thinking I was doing something wrong before going back to the front desk. I went back to the desk and told her I was having problems getting the card to work in the elevator. She then activated the cards, didn't even apologize for her error (not activating the cards so we could use the elevator and get into our room), then sent us on our way. By that time, the bellhop already brought the luggage from the lobby and was waiting for us at our door wondering what happened to us! The room had an extra foldout bed in it that we didn't request (in the way). The room was freezing cold when we arrived. I turned the heater on, which after 2 hours of waiting still did not heat up the room. Housekeeping barged into the room (the security bolts had been removed from the doors.... the front desk staff claimed that the Australian government 2 years ago made it a law to remove all bolts from hotel doors... not sure if that is true or not) looking for the foldout bed that was removed by the bellhop hours before. The staff didn't know what other staff members were doing because housekeeping staff was asking ME where the foldout bed was. I told him to ask the bellhop where to find it. How crazy is that? Someone from engineering came to "fix" the heater, but the whole time we were there (12 days), we continued to have problems with it. Every day we would be missing either washcloths (never in my life have I been to any hotel where I've had problems with this.... and supposedly this is a 5 star hotel!), or they'd throw away our soap and not replace it, or they'd take a towel and not replace it, or they'd move our towels around, provide dirty tea/coffee cups. The service was absolutely disgusting. There were way too many mistakes/things wrong for this to be considered a good hotel. There were so many problems.... every day there was an issue. I was just so sick of having to call down to the front desk for things that were missing! We started hiding soap (so that we would have soap to use and wouldn't have to call the front desk, isn't that ridiculous?) I've never had to do anything like that in my whole life! When they didn't bring washcloths we just went without them. I would have been better off somewhere else! I can say without a doubt that I would never go back there ever again! I've spent a lot less money going to other hotels in the past and had a lot better service than I got at this hotel. Even the heater in the pool was not working (I wonder how long that was broken for. They had a note in the pool area saying that they were getting it fixed. I wonder if that was really true). The only good thing about this hotel was that it was close to the Rocks, Circular Quay, the subway, ferry, bus route... basically in a good, central location and easy to walk to a variety of places.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice rooms, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: indigoberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the Amora and found it to be a lovely hotel, the staff were helpful the room was pleasant if a tiny bit small and the bathroom was lovely. We had room service breakfast for 2 mornings and it was delicious and HUGE. We shared one between us. Overall a very pleasant stay. We booked our hotel through lastminute.com and the rates were very very reasonable for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service, great location, would go back”
Reviews.Author: annabellet
Reviews.Content: train from sydney airport direct to wynyard station for $15 AUD took 25 minutes - very easy. great location up the hill from circular quay/rocks/darling harbour, walking to pitt st mall QVB very close too. nice room with balcony but no view (i didnt care), great bathroom, only thing was TV was small old school box tv, but werent there to watch tv! service was impeccable, from the desk, to the porters, to the concierge very helpful with directions and tips of where to go. plus they let me store my luggage for a day when i returned 2 days after i had left the hotel with nowhere else to put it, great value on a wotif mystery deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but let down by staff”
Reviews.Author: TamarTiger
Reviews.Content: The Amora is beautiful and beautifully placed for seeing Sydney. Unfortunately we arrived there after staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore and the differences were all too obvious. The staff seemed off hand and unhelpful, as if guests were perhaps a little bit of a nuisance. Everything got done but just not willingly. I was extremely irritated by the credit card charge added to our bill. Paying their prices for a room for 10 nights I didn't expect to pay a further 1.5% for using a credit card. Unfortunately their system wouldn't accept either of our debit cards so eventually a manager used some common sense and agreed to waive the charge. I really do not think it is appropriate for a 5 star hotel to be making additional money in such an underhand way. I accept they might have to pay the credit card companies but their prices reflect that. Sadly, as this was the last transaction with the hotel it left a poor memory.

Reviews.Title: “very nicely surprised”
Reviews.Author: bennyboy1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amora after discovering that the hotel I normally stayed in was booked. I did very little research, paid a low price compared to my normal hotel, and was not expecting much. But when i arrived I was very pleasantly surprised. There is always someone to open the door for you, the front counter staff were very helpful and I received a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite on the top floor of the hotel. It doesn't have great views, being surrounded by buildings, but in my room on the 41st floor I could see glimpses of the harbour. The room was nice, not huge, but a nice bathroom, some of the features were slightly outdated, but not a enough to make it unpleasant. Room service was quick, slightly expensive but what room service isn't? The location is great, right in the middle of everything, practically in between Circular Quay, Pitt Street mall, and Hyde Park. My best compliment for this hotel is that I stayed at it another 3 times in 2 months. This was because my normal hotel, the Sheraton, was booked as I was always booking at very short notice, however its a great backup, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: WelltravelledNSW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a secret hotel deal.Upon arrival,staff were indifferent & had a don't care attitude.Upon check-in when we finally got to our room,noticed housekeeping had missed a few things but we were too tired to mention it.The breakfast is a total ripoff & staff in general couldn't care less,& on the verge of rude. How this place can be rated 5 stars astounds me.At best its a good 3 star.Will never stay there again & will make sure none of my friends have the misfortune of staying there either.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: WPF2009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel through lastminute as a "Secret" deal. I was a little dubious about the idea of a "secret" hotel as I figured that a good hotel would have high enough occupancy not to need to sell their rooms at such reduced rates. All I can say is that I jumped to the wrong assumption! Ok, we were located on the 4th floor with a view overlooking the admin offices of the building next door- but for what we paid, we could not have expected harbour views. The downside of being on the 4th floor was that we did seem to do a great deal of lift riding that we didn't need to. You see, if someone staying on the 27th floor got to the control for the lift before you, then you had already missed the 4th floor stop. It became the joking point for our visit.... We were told by other guests that the views from higher floors were delightful. As far as service went, we found all of the staff exceptionally helpful. Having stayed at other 5 Star Sydney hotels before including the Hilton, I could not fault the staff at the Amora when it came to service. If anything, the service at the Amora was more welcoming than at other hotels!!! The room was well appointed, with a large king bed and a huge bathroom with seperate bath and shower. For those who are particular about their bedding, the Amora offered a "Pillow Menu" to ensure that a good nights sleep is provided. Being a Sydney resident myself I was REALLY shocked that I had not heard about the Amora earlier. It is in a great location, with nightclubs close by for those who are looking to party for the weekend, George Street is only a minutes walk away, really the location is very central. As such we have booked ourselves in to the Amora again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: NellyC76
Reviews.Content: It's impossible to pick a fault with the Amora hotel. From the minute we arrived till our departure the service was A+! The staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were very comfortable, although the small hidden tv was a surprise for such a classy hotel room, one might expect to find a flash flat screen instead. But we weren't there to watch tv, we wanted to get out and explore Sydney. The location was convenient, a short walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay. We had dinner in Darling Harbour and that wasn't a bad walk either. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but not true 5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: sunderland67
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I got a great deal through a Lastminute.com "Secret Hotel" promotion - $154, for a relaxing 1 night stay to recharge before our second child is born in a month. When I realised we'd got the Amora I was intrigued as I'd been here for conferences and business meetings previously. Check in was smooth and quick. However on getting to our room we realised on seeing the bathroom that they'd put us in a room equipped for a disabled customer i.e no bath, large open shower with a bench in it and a specially adapted toilet. I knew my wife was particularly keen on enjoying a relaxing bath before dinner and with this in mind I called down to see if it was possible to change to a room with a bath. I spoke to Natalie (don't know what her position is at the hotel, but assume she was a manager of some description) - she was brusque to say the least. When I enquired if it was standard practice to put people who had not requested a specially adapted room in one, her response was " well you booked on a Secret Hotel deal" as if to say because you got a good deal you have to take whatever we dish out! After a bit of umming and Ahhing on her part she said she'd see what she could do - when I asked what that meant she said roughly "I'm looking, I'm looking!" She made it seem as if this was a big chore, anyway she found us an alternative room "It'll be on the 4th Floor though" she said, obviously expecting us to object, but we're from Sydney and work in the city so the fact that we had no view didn't really bother us - If we'd been from out of town or overseas it may have been a different matter though as the room she found for us (401) was pretty dark as most natural light was shut out by the building opposite. But it was only 1 night and we got the bath we wanted. The Room was nice and spacious but as I say in the title, to be truly 5 star you have to take care of the little details, so the fact that there was only 1 bathrobe in a room for 2 was odd and the bath towels were neither large nor fluffy enough to be called luxurious, plus the position of the tv is weird for viewing. We had a dinner reservation outside the hotel - but had room service breakfast the next morning which again missed the 5 star mark. Bad coffee - I've stayed in plenty of Hotels where they've mastered the art of getting coffee to you hot and fresh. Why not just give you a cafetiere with ground coffee so you can make it yourself - there's a kettle in every room? Also $72 for a very average continental breakfast for two is way too expensive, if we were staying for longer we'd eat at one of the nearby cafe's - but we wanted a treat of breakfast in bed so were happy to wear the cost. I'm not sure if I'd be in a hurry to stay here again, when I book 5 star I expect a bit more even if I've got a good deal on the price. I've always been the sort of person who believes you get what you pay for and this experience hasn't changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff but approach from York rather than George st”
Reviews.Author: taninaus
Reviews.Content: Got a great room via a mystery room deal - ended up on the 10th floor facing Margaret/George Street. Room was clean and roomy, bathroom was fabulous and staff provided an exemplary service. The reason I say York st is the best approach is Jamison via George st is at a 45 degree angle and if you aren't fit and are dragging bags it is a real workout!! If you like chocolate there is a Lindt cafe nearby. If you are there on a weekend because it is the business district the food options become more limited than during the week. The fridge has enough room to put basic supplies in without affecting mini-bar (and the mini-bar isn't sensor driven). Nice selection of teas and hot chocolate. Level 1 smells great because of the spa there. I agree with comments about the bed but don't bother with the chiro pillow unless you like really low ones.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-star, centrally located, felt business oriented”
Reviews.Author: phoyo
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 4 star hotel, but not over the top luxury. This felt like more of a good business hotel than a vacation hotel and was located in the heart of the central business district, accordingly. However we felt comfortable there, it was in a good location for us as first time Sydney visitors, and we got a good deal on it through a credit card points program. We were high up, on the 34th floor, looking directly across the street at some office building. At a 45 degree angle we could then see the harbor in both directions, so theoretically we had a harbor view and could see sunrise and sundown but it was tempered by the fact that it also seemed like the people at the office building late could also look into our room so we really had to close our blind rather than leaving it open to view the city at night. If a view over Sydney is important, then take care which direction you'll be facing (not sure if the other directions didn't look into office buildings) or try a different hotel. The room wasn't overly spacious so if you bring lots of luggage you might have to step over it more than you'd prefer. The room has all the needed amenities including real coffee and a French press coffee pot rather than instant coffee. The bed was quite comfortable, and they had a "pillow menu" and we got some great down pillows which was nice. We paid extra to have the higher floor and get membership in the club on the 31st floor which included drinks and hors doeurves each evening and breakfast each morning. The breakfast was standard continental fare and not great - we ate it only once and went out the other days. We partook of drinks 3 evenings so we got some value out of it, but I wouldn't buy it again from this hotel. Location was outstanding for people like us willing to walk just a bit - very central in relation to the Quay, Rocks, Botanical Gardens, Central Business District. There was also a subway station directly below the hotel, but be aware the the entry just there isn't always open so you'll have to figure out the main entrance about a block away for entry during evening and morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: san05
Reviews.Content: Me and my mate stayed here for five nights. The title says it all. You can get some great deals on room rates if you search around. Tip: forget the hotel breakfast and head down to Bistroteque a few steps away from the hotel towards George Street. We went there every morning - great food and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality Service And Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: aussiefamilySydney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Amora several times including a recent stay for a Business trip.Our last stay was a spur of the moment decision for a Saturday night,so we booked directly with the hotel, our rate including the Seafood buffet for 2. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a Park View Suite with separate living area and we were really impressed. The standout features of this hotel are the friendly service from all staff and its ideal location,oh and the food at the Seafood Buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bhops
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the location, and it is indeed in a great spot, right near the Rocks and other points of interest. The hotel was clean, nice and not that expensive given the location. It was not remarkable in any other way, however. I would recommend it if you are just looking for accommodations, and not looking for a special experience at the hotel itself. But otherwise, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amora hotel...........great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Perthgaz
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay there...........the rooms and all the amenities were great. Service was top class. After a long day of sightseeing we would go back to the hotel have a swim and a spa get changed and head to the hotel lounge bar. The hotel had everything we needed for our stay in Sydney and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: lucyethel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amora for 3 nights and we loved the hotel. The room was very nice, clean, and quiet. Comfy bed and large bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning and since our room was not ready yet, they held our luggage until it was available. We were then able to not waste valuable time waiting and were able to go out and start sightseeing Sydney. When we got back to the hotel, our luggage was already in our room waiting for us. On the day we left, we had a very early flight and needed to leave the hotel at 5 am. We told the front desk the night before and the next morning the cab was there waiting for us. We've stayed at other hotels in the past where the staff from the night before would forget and not call a cab for us causing us to have to wait. The staff at the Amora was very helpful. The hotel is truly a good value and would not hesitate to stay there again. It's w/in 10-30 min walking distance of major sites such as the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Aquarium, Darling Harbour, etc. The subway is only a 5 min walk away. The only thing we could find fault with (and this is digging pretty deep) is that b/c it is in a business area it was hard to find a supermarket nearby where we could purchase water, etc. There are 7-11's nearby, however you will pay a premium for water there. Also, there was no free wi-fi, but we found this to be the norm in Australia. Still would have been nice to be able to check our email now and then. Next time we are in Sydney, we will definitely stay at the Amora.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a return trip”
Reviews.Author: Indeed
Reviews.Content: Pure luxury! Although we have stayed in a number of 5* hotels on our travels we would be hard pressed to fault the friendliness shown to us by the staff here. You are in the very centre of Sydney, 5 minute walk to circular quay, Buster the conceirge was excellent, he gave us a number of ideas about getting the most out of exploring the city on a limited timeframe. The room was cosy, always clean, comfortable bed, no complaints there. We received a complimentry upgrade to the Jamison Club which we used on a few occassions, relaxing in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Four and a Half Stars at a Three Star Price”
Reviews.Author: AcapulcoBound
Reviews.Content: First, what everybody in America wants to know: Which way do the toilets swirl? Well, they are direct flushing toilets and donâ€™t swirl in either direction. Now on to the review. I had a long stay (12 nights) for business. I got to the hotel room at 10:00 a.m. from the airport. They get me a room even though check-in time is not until 1:00 p.m. My bags, which were taken for me from my cab by the bellhop, arrive five minutes later. Everybody is very nice. My room has a wired internet connection, but the Ethernet cable is missing. I call to get one and somebody was there within five minutes. Other reviews mentioned problems with getting their bags and timely service. I did not have this problem at all during my stay. After my long flight from America, I wanted to clean up, so I went into the shower. A few minutes later, while Iâ€™m still in the shower, the power goes off. An announcement over the emergency intercom system indicates the power is off in the entire building (aparently they have a back up power system for this). I finished getting ready and walk down 13 flights of stairs. Everybody was very nice about it and they handed out free bottles of water at the bottom of the stairs. While this was not much of an inconvenience for me, I hope it wasnâ€™t too much of a problem for a couple walking up the staircase as I walked down who were carrying bags and wedding flowers. Once I got to the street, I saw the power is out everywhere (no traffic signals are working and stores have no power), so you can't really blame the hotel. By the time I got back to the hotel a few hours later the power is back on. Interestingly, one of the reviews I read before I booked this hotel indicated they had the same problem. Some reviews mention the hill on the street the hotel is located. Unless you are in a wheelchair or have severe mobility problems, the hill is not that long and does not pose a problem. The hotel is a short walk (5-10 minutes) from the Opera House area. However, considering how much less expensive this hotel is compared to those closer to the Opera House, it is well worth it. The hotel service continued to be above par throughout my stay. The Concierge takes a lot of time helping me get Sydney Swans (Australian Rules Football) tickets. He is extremely helpful and courteous. The front doors were almost always held open when entering and exiting. Overall, I had no problems with service. This is a VERY nice hotel. I would definitely recommend. However, I think rating it a five star hotel is a bit of a stretch. The rooms are nice but a little bit dated with some wear. The TVâ€™s are not high definition and are small (not that I spend much time watching TV). While I would still recommend this hotel because I rather enjoyed my stay, I would think this is more a four and a half star hotel and not a full five stars. The price I paid for the room, however, was equivalent to paying for a three star hotel. Thus, the value is definitely there. I did not try the restaurants. Iâ€™m not that much into fancy food, and the reviews from others of the restaurants were not that outstanding. Still, there are plenty of other places to eat in this town. Small drawbacks: only wired internet in my room (although I believe the executive suites had wireless internet); while there are a lot of cabinets, they are very small. I could not find places to store all my clothes. Also, HDTV would be a nice extra, making this closer to a five star hotel. I saw one review complain of the small pool. It was plenty large enough for my enjoyment and I saw plenty of people having a wonderful time. My biggest disappointment was the workout facility. It has two treadmills, an eliptical and a bike machine. It also had a four-way Universal type machine. I know it is not a priority for many travelers, but I think they need to find a way to expand the workout facility to get a five star rating from me. Hint for American travelers using cardio machines: there are 2.2 pounds to a kilogram. You have to input your weight into the cardio machines in kilos. :) Some prior reviews complained about the noise from nightclubs/bars/street. Maybe it was that I was on the 13th floor or did not face the main street, but I did not have any problems with outside/street noise in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could ask for”
Reviews.Author: DnG_2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a deluxe twin room which was very spacious as was the bathroom. The room was very clean and had modern decor. The location was very central on the george street end only a stone throw away from circular quay and many other attractions. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient, they would treat you like royalty by ensuring the door was held open for you as you entered/exited! Overall, the best 5* hotel we've stayed in Sydney by far!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdes
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we were told we had been upgraded to the park suite which was a nice suprise considering we had booked a mystery hotel and we were expecting to get the most basic room, this hotel was in a great location for us as we were going on a dinner cruise in circular quay that night which was only a ten minute walk. The only part about our night away that dissapointed me was when we arived there was no parking and we were sent to a car park a block away and uon check out they charged us $6 for use of tv which we never even turned on i thought the use of tv was generally included in the price of accomodation but as we had a free upgrade i didnt complain

Reviews.Title: “very nice.....but”
Reviews.Author: cageyoneSydney
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay on a Saturday for a very reasonable price of $160 ( a mystery deal). Good points were, bathroom excellent, clean spacious and great view, hotel appointments and decor excellent, staff very friendly and professional Bad points, bedroom was small, sheets were frayed along top edges and tv was at a strange place for viewing , parking expensive ( $35 overnight ), lift broke down on way to room, stuck between floors for a few minutes, seafood buffet dinner nice but overpriced at $65 per head and they ran out of prawns as we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kate013
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Amora a fair bit, with both my partner and my girlfriends when we come into Sydney for the night or over the weekend! The hotel is very nicely set out, great, friendly staff and it has the most comfortable beds i have ever slept on! I would definatley reccommend going for the club room as the benefits aren't much more in cost and are endless! The buffet breakfast is also amazing! The hotel is in a great location just off Gerge street making it close to shopping,nightlife & restaurants! Only about a 10 minute walk to both Circular Quay & Darling Harbour! Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: Musrag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for work and this place reminds me of hotels in Asia where the staff are happy to help you with everything. The rooms were clean, modern and large. The breakfast was great and the staff in the foyer from the desk to the doors were great. The only down side is the overpriced room service which is a thing I do a lot when travelling. * They charge you $6 to bring it to your room. * $5.50 for a 300ml Coke * Very overpriced. Other then that a great stay and look forward to staying here again with work. Plus it is close to some great places to party on in Sydney.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SmartTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Wotif.com mystery deal for $160 per night. I had never stayed here before. What a lovely hotel! The rooms are stylish & nicely appointed, the bed outrageously comfortable, the bathroom cavernous with a great deep bath. All the usual amenities expected in a 5* hotel were there - big towels, bathrobes, safe, hairdryer, desk, internet access. I had a room service dinner - extremely nice and well presented. Very prompt service. The location was great - for both tourists and business people alike. In a quieter street between George and York right next to Wynyard station. Easy walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. However the thing that shone out was the service and friendly, helpful staff. Any reuest was handled courteously and promptly. The bell desk offered a car to the airport for $50 - clean comfortable & airconditioned. As there had been an accident on the freeway, a dirty, hot cab would have been that...and more. I've found my new place to stay in Sydney...The wotif deal made this a stunning bargain...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and roomy in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Richlo
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a rare rainy night in Sydney (the loaner umbrellas from the concierge came in very handy). Front desk service was friendly and efficient and were given a spacious corner room. Everything about the room was comfortable and we had a choice of either a great shower or a spacious bathtub. We used a very nice and uncrowded fitness center and swimming pool. The location was very good - it's close to Circular Quay (an essential in my opinion) and near to the Rocks and adjacent to Wynyard Station. Accessing the airport via train makes so much economic and efficient sense that it's very important to be near a rail station such as Wynyard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Choice”
Reviews.Author: srussell300
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel tired from a long flight and, despite the early hour, our room was ready. The receptionist was welcoming and courteous and made our day by telling us we had been upgraded. All the staff, from bellboy to waiters to housekeeping to reception and concierge, treated us with utmost consideration and care. The room was on 21st floor and a good size, with great bathroom with bath and separate shower. Everything we needed was in the room, including an adaptor plug when we found we had lost ours. The location was perfect, a few blocks from the Harbour and all Sydney's attractions. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It may appear to be a business hotel, but it is perfect for the business and leisure traveller alike. If we ever return to Sydney we will have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Impecabble!”
Reviews.Author: Marwa_M
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Amora Hotel during our honeymoon trip to Australia in Dec '06. The hotel is one of the coziest boutique hotels we have ever been to. It's afive star hotel by all standards. The hotel is relatively small but extremley cute. The breakfast was amazing, their staff was friendly and extremley attentive. The concierge gave us endless tips on tourists destinations and arranged for us all the tours. During our trip, my husband had a dental mishap on New Year's day, and the concierge was kind enough to guide us to approriate dental services available on that day. The rooms are very cozy and cute and spacious. Cleanliness is very good. Most important, the location is superb. The hotel is ideally located between the Harbour and the Wharf. We stayed there during New Year's, and i was particularly impressed to know that the hotel security checked each individual coming in to the hotel and matching it against their guest list. I would highly recommend this place and we would definetley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuck29
Reviews.Content: Very clean, and modern hotel, with a fantastic location. Easy walk to all areas of the CBD, Circular Quay, and the Rocks. Great spot for a first time visitor to Sydney. Nice rooms with large bathrooms. Water and towel provided by concierge after returning from a run is a nice touch. I think some of the previous reviews have focused on the food, not the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel, so I can't comment. The pool and exercise areas are small, and underwhelming. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Palmjet
Reviews.Content: We planned a 10 vacation in Sydney and were looking for a hotel close to The Rocks and Circular Quay. After considering the Four Seasons and the Intercontinental we choose the Amora Jamison because of the good reviews and the more interesting price. We were not disappointed. We arrived at 9 in the morning and asked because of our long stay for a room with a view. We were happy to wait for an available room for about 45 min and were treated with a drink in the lounge bar in the meantime. The reception manager offered us a upgrade to the executive level with a breakfast for two in the lounge and free drinks/snacks in the afternoon plus internet access in the room for a very reasonable price. This turned out to be a great deal and it was really a delight to be there as the guest ladies were extremely friendly and caring. The room had a great bay view and was very comfortable, clean and up to date including a flat screen television. As professional traveler with about 180 hotel nights a year I seldom see a hotel with such nice and friendly staff. This hotel is great for business as well as personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravel081
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel on 12th December with a large group of people on disembarking from a three week cruise on the Diamond Princess. At check in credit card was taken with Passports as check in busy told it was hotel policy to do this all to be kept in Hotel safe. Card was compromised during our stay and has been seveal times since in spite of original card being cancelled and new one issued Bank fraud squad are on case. On retuning to Sydney on the 1st February 2009 reported all to female Manager, she assured us this would be looked into and we would be contacted. nothing has happened. Staff very polite but beware all is not as it seems. Visit Australia frequently but never again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Maddelena
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 16 February 2009 Long wait at reception No secure area for cases Unhelpful staff Coffee cold Breakfast 32 dollars per person was far too expensive Packed breakfast was terrible: 2 stale rolls 1 butter and 1 margarine No Marmalade or jam Unsealed yogurt carton of not so fresh fruit bottle of water Worst hotel I have stayed in for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: fivestarplease
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora on the 17th of Feb, we received the hotel through a mystery deal, I must confess that I had never heard of it and we have stayed in a few other places in the city. The hotel was not what we expected, it was not romantic at all and can be best described as a comfortable modern stay, I am struggling to classify this hotel as 5 star. If you are after a clean, modern, central hotel then its good, but if you are after a luxury, romantic getaway then keep looking. Just one really bad thing about the place, the breaky was not worth $35 each and the service in the breakfast area was awful. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amora Hotel â€“ Oh the comfy Bed!”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora Hotel for the weekend instead of going out to dinner for Valentines Day as we usually do. The hotel was very very nice. It is very elegant and has been furnished in timeless dÃ©cor. All the staff we dealt with were extremely helpful and professional. The hotel represents great value for money if you purchase one of their deals. The bed is so comfortable that you do not want to leave it. It is so soft and it feels like you are lying in a giant marshmallow. The doona encases you to complete the feeling. I could have stayed in it the whole weekend. Breakfast and dinner were included in the package and we could not fault either meal. Staff were extremely attentive so that you did not have to wait to ask for anything. We would definitely stay there again but I do agree with one of the other reviews that perhaps they should upgrade their televisions to flat screens as they are the only thing lacking in their rooms. The bathrooms are spacious and very nicely decorated with a separate bath from the shower. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Haroldl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Amora. Compared to most central Sydney hotels, the price was very reasonable. The room was large and comfortable, with a huge bathroom. Service was excellent. The one drawback of the hotel is that it is situated near the top of a fairly steep hill. While walking down to Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Opera House is easy and convenient, getting back is a bit of a climb. After a performance at the Opera House, we couldn't find a taxi to take us back. However, we took the train for one station from Circular Quay to Wynyard, from which it is easy to reach the hotel. I see that one reviewer complained about the lack of a flat screen TV. Since we are not avid TV watchers, this did not trouble us. We would have liked AM as well as FM radio, but this is not a huge problem. The Galleria restaurant in the hotel, at which we had one meal, was nothing special. Prices for breakfast looked high there, so we had this meal each day at the coffee bar and foodcourt next door.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Weekendtraveller021
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here on a night away from the kids... The reception staff were good as were the door men. Our room was apparently a delux king cornor room, when we entered I was VERY disappointed... the viewless room was small, dark, dingey and most discustingly dirty. The carpet had stains all over it, the one and only chair in the room had stains on it. The walls were dirty and all in all the decor is looking very tired. Im sorry but for my money when you stay in a five star establishment you do expect a certain quality. I found the Television very outdated and in a poor position. Surely in a five star hotel you would expect at least a modern flat screen and a DVD player! We were left only TWO towels between us and the bed linen has obviously seen better days.... not very luxurious at all. The pool and spa both look in need of an update and a good scrub.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Hobartgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Australia Day long weekend. I arrived early and the room was not available. Came back an hour later and it was ready - pleased with the speed. The room was spacious and all fittings were new. Room was very clean. Had a corner room on the 20th floor. A little surrounded by office blocks as would be expected. Did have a small view of the harbour. It is at the top of a short but steepish hill and in 40 degree temperatures it did become hard work! It is central to most areas without being close to any. Opera House was 15 minutes, Circular Quay was 10 minutes as was the Pitt Street mall area. Breakfast was an average buffet. Everything was fine but was the usual, if a little expensive. Room service is okay but the $6 delivery is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but with a room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: brindisiSydney
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by one of the 'mystery accommodation' deals. It was only us when we checked in so there was no waiting. The receptionist could have been a little bit more friendly, a bit of smiling will do! We were told we've been upgraded - without any reasons - but well, we didn't argue! The room was very spacious. The separation of the bedroom and the lounge area was good. However, our room had a divider door to join two different rooms and we could hear a baby crying next door. The view was nice. We were right next to an office and we could see them working while we're having a holiday (ha ha!) The location is very central to everything. We walked to the Opera House, art gallery and Darling Harbour. We went to the bar hoping to get a drink but nobody came to serve us (although they've seen us) so we walked to another hotel instead.
