The housekeeping was not perfect. They didn't give us any tissues which were missing and we also didn't get a new carton of milk for the second day. Be prepared to pay $35 per day for parking. Only one lift goes directly to the parking area so watch out. You can use the Net for approx $10 per hour in your room. Overall, we are quite happy but I think it is the way staff talk to you and treat you which make hotels 5 stars, not what facilities they have. The attitude of the staff was definitely not rude but perhaps a little too casual to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-wouldn't hesitate to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: CK1Adelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and booked under lastminute.com.au PLUS Staff-I travel every month and this is the first hotel where the staff actually potray the hotel standard.I think it was supposed to be friendly,relaxed,warmth etc etc along the line.They were not effusive but it's been a long awhile since I have been greeted by a smile by every staff including the concierge and reception staff.I get greeted in other hotels with either a cool,disinterested expression,professional but won't step out the way for you atititude.It was a bit of a shock to see staff actually behaving you want hotel staff to be like.It was refreshing. Room-more spacious than some of the other CBD 5 star hotels.I think the hotel had a recent refurbishment.The carpeting from the foyer,passageways and room looks new-ish.Good design,alcoves or niches to put things in.Nice sofa chair.I didn't see the Playstation as advertised in their website. Noise-stayed 11th floor.Quiet.Double glazed windows. Bed-extremely good and with a pillow menu Bathroom- separate bath and shower. View-had some corner view of Millers Point. Gym-looks good equipment was new looking.Small and compact.Pool and spa bath was good. Angsana Spa-didn't have time to use it but it sure smelled nice. Location-close to Wynyard Station and attached to Met Centre for food etc etc. MINUS Toiletries-don't understand with all the attention to details in the hotel why their range is ho -hum.A lot of the hotels seem to be into either the organic or herbal range but the Amora's is brightly coloured and smelled artificial.Funny tubes and diffiicult to get the liquid out. TV-old style bulky TV inside a cupboard.The doors do slide in and it is maybe 24' not sure.It was a bit awkward to watch on the sofa chair.

Reviews.Title: “New Years get-away”
Reviews.Author: kitertom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent New Years week at the Amora and had a wonderful time. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is perfectly located, the room was beyond expectation, and the food was perfect. Upon arriving at the Amora we made the wise decision to upgrade to their Club Level. This afforded us a nice lounge to enjoy a cocktail each evening or coffee in the morning, sitting alongside a wonderful view. The only downside during our visit was that the parking garage's elevator did not work and we had to hike our luggage up and down a couple flights of stairs. I wish the hotel had offered to make valet parking free to compensate for this. I am sure the elevator will be fixed soon so this should not be a concern for other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “On the dissapointing side of the scale”
Reviews.Author: mishpish
Reviews.Content: Went there on a mystery deal with my husband for a night off from the kids. We both have worked in the city near the Jamison so we were happy with the location and the price of $170. However, it touts itself as a five star and I don't think it is close... more like a 3.5 to 4 star. After winding our way through a tight parking lot we found ourselves hefting up 5 flights of stairs with our bags as the elevator didn't seem to work (no lights came on to indicate it was, anyway). Checked in and we 'upgraded' (i.e... paid more money) to get a room upgrade, breakfast included and drinks in the 'exec lounge'. Got a nice room on the 32nd floor... great views heading south/west over the city, and nice window over the bath. But the tv didn't work so they moved us up to the 33rd floor, obstructed north views... but sadly no lovely romantic bath views. Oh well. Room is nice, tasteful and ok size for the cbd. Breakfast was very dissapointing.. it was on the 31st floor ... great views and all that but CONTINENTAL.... except for some mini quiches (the frozen sara lee kind). We were keen for some eggs and bacon so that was a bummer. Considering we paid close to $250 (post 'upgrade') for a saturday night in a prime spot, it was OK... but it fell way short of our expectations and didn't meet the "5 star" quality we were anticipating. Next time we will just pay the extra money and get quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, even with a power outage”
Reviews.Author: Chiropink
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Amora Jamison and it was fantastic! This was my first visit to Sydney and this hotel was a pleasant surprise! The hotel is only 2.5 blocks to the Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay, which is a major hub for getting to all points of interest in Sydney. The final night of my stay, the entire block experienced a power outage from 7 p.m. to 4 a.m. The hotel staff was extremely professional in handling accommodations for everyone...and in dealing with irate customers. I CHOSE to stay in the lobby (my room was on the 14th floor and my flight was leaving early), so I witnessed every customer exchange...which was pleasant and reassuring. They even offered to comp us for that last night, although the power outage was in no way the fault of the hotel. I would DEFINITELY recommend the Amora Jamison to anyone and I intend to stay there every time I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the thoughtful little touches”
Reviews.Author: lynds_b259
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora Jamison for 10 nights in December and loved every minute of it. We were upgraded upon arrival to a junior suite, with a separate living area and huge bathroom. Also we had a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates waiting for us in our room. All of the staff were friendly, helpful, and couldn't do enough for us. The location is brilliant, only a short walk to Cirular Quay, the Rocks, and about a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. I would also agree with the recommendation of the Barramundi Cafe across the road for breakfast, excellent value and lovely staff. On our first night we were shattered from our trip so just ordered room service rather than head down the restaurant, but the food delivered to us was delicious, and we also had a complimentary bowl of M&Ms! We were staying at the hotel over Christmas and woke up on Christmas morning to find a box of festive cookies waiting for us outside our room, another lovely little touch. We cannot wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and a well-kept secret”
Reviews.Author: ghanno
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is located just off the north end of George St. It is closer to The Rocks and Circular Quay as well as the new Ivy complex and the nearest train station is Wynyard. ROOM: Upon arrival, we were informed that we had been automatically upgraded to a more superior corner room on the 25th floor. We were impressed with this, as we hadnâ€™t even requested an upgrade. There was a wonderful view of the city from our room and it was well-appointed with a very comfortable king size bed, armchair, ottoman, work desk, lamp, TV (with various cable channels) and wardrobe, etc. There was also a mini bar and ironing board and iron. The design of the room and the whole feel was clean and quite modern. The only downside of the room was that the blinds were quite thin and therefore didnâ€™t really keep the sun out the next morning. The windows are probably double-glazed but even that high up, it still didnâ€™t stop some of the noise from the street below from being heard. The bathroom was very spacious and there was a bathtub and separate shower area. The hotel provided toiletries i.e. shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser, bath gel, hand soap. SERVICE: Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly, willing to help and efficient. AMENITIES: The hotel has a small gym with relatively modern equipment as well as a pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. There is also an Angsana spa (wonderful service) with various treatments and massages â€“ we were able to book at a momentâ€™s notice and were very happy with the service there. DINING: There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel. We didnâ€™t get a chance to eat at Charr but at the other restaurant where the buffet breakfast is held) on the same floor, just opposite Charr). Both the dinner and the breakfast were delicious and quite good value and the service was fantastic both times. This is one of the few hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at that offers soy milk during breakfast â€“ impressive and rare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for everything”
Reviews.Author: Jinty Campbell
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Amora from 27 November 08. We were offered an upgrade at a discounted price so had a lovely junior suite on 8th floor. The accommodation was really nice - a comfortable sitting area, big bedroom with a huge bed and a really nice bathroom with an amazing walk in shower. The hotel is located about 500 metres from Circular Quay in one direction and a 10 - 15 minute walk to Darling harbour in the other - so a good jumping off point for most things. There is a great wee resaurant right opposite the hotel for breakfast or lunch - The Barramundi. Also, try Jordans on George (on the way to circular Quay). They do a great bacon and egg sandwich with coffee and juice for $5.50 AUD - bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: mayomayo123
Reviews.Content: The house keeping was very bad. The staff in this hotel were not responsible at all. They missed the booking of shuttle bus, and there were gabage of the previous guest in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery Hotel FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: bekky-boo
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a mystery hotel online and got this place! I had never heard of it but am glad I have now! not only was it in walking distance to the train station, rocks and circular key but the staff are lovely and they put us on the 28th floor in a corner room with veiws over the city! it was spectacular! We could see the harbour from our bathtub! Definately not what i was expecting for the price! What is also great about this hotel is that they spread their patrons around the hotel, in other words there was no lines at check in and we only saw one other person on our floor our entire stay and they were at the other end of the hall. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: I managed to book this hotel as a mystery deal on a popular hotel booking website. This hotel is located in a great spot next to Wynyard train station which makes it easy to get around and a short walk to Circular Quay and the rocks. I was impressed from the very beginning with small touches such as the concierge opening the doors upon arrival to the prompt friendly front desk check in staff. No issue was too hard for them - they brought up shaving cream (albeit in a small tube) when my partner forgot his and even found a European travel adaptor for the wall plug. The room was clean and modern, the shower HUGE and the king size bed was amazing. The only slight issue is that Jamison street is on a hill so you'll be huffing by the time you get to the door after a day of shopping or sightseeing. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay- Yet again”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I just had to once again write about my stay at this hotel. I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and on my last stay I was even more impressed. I had emailed the hotel requesting a nice room because it was a birthday/anniversary. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was advised that we were upgraded to a deluxe king room! Was so happy. The room was in a corner and so quiet. The view was spectacular on our 29th floor room! They even gave us complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates! Service is still amazing! Service is always polite, helpful and with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Whales
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Amora Jamison is perfect, great location, the rooms are comfortable and well fitted out. (they even have a pillow menu) Staff are always very attentive Their restaurant is just as good, I had breakfast there and it was expensive but worth it. Freshly squeezed juice topped it all off.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JABUK
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay via Expedia from the Uk based on much research and previous traveller reviews. We were not disappointed. From check in to check out we had a wonderful stay. Our rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean, well equipped and had fantastic views. Slippers and robes were a nice touch.Taking the club rooms and club lounge option was certainly worth the extra. A delightful haven to begin the day with breakfast or start the evening with drinks and canapes. Attentive and well informed staff. Parking was an issue but a valet dealt with that for us even though the rates were a little steep. I suppose it is right in the city centre after all! The location is perfect. Central for all the sights, rail and ferries. We will be visiting Sydney again next year and there is no doubt about which hotel we would use. J & A B UK

Reviews.Title: “Good location/ Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: jarox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Amora over the October Long Weekend. Very easy to find, took the sky train- Off at Wynyard and about a 3 minute walk.. We checked in, were given our key card, went to our room- only to find it was occupied!! How embarassing, staff didn't seem at all surprised. Just gave us another room, however I was a bit nervous all weekend, that some one would appear in our room. The bed was really soft, sheets wouldnt tuck in properly so every morning we had odd lines from the loose sheets!! The bathroom is beautiful, may have been upgraded, but the rest of furnishings were a bit old and scratched. We mainly ate at Baramundi cafe across the road- as 39.50 per person for breakfast is a bit steep. HIghly recomend Baramundi- we had 2 Breakfast and 1 dinner there. As this was a last minute deal I think it was OK, all the staff are really lovely, just some of their procedures need updating. Great easy walk to The Rocks, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the Sydney Marathon and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stampy587
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice!!! From the check in where the receptionist was lovely - they didn't have our room ready so placed us on the 32nd floor - - -amazing room. You can even hear the TV with a seperate speaker in the toilet!!! (Small things I know) Great views, perfect service - made a really good coffee for us and they had amazing service aswell... Much better than when it was a Rydges!!!

Reviews.Title: “attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller154
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are polite and attentive. Room was above average. One of the few 5-star hotels in Sydney CBD that provides self-parking on the premises. This is a bonus if you do not trust strangers to park your car. One warning is that there is a beggar in the vicinity of the hotel. He was abusive and threatening as I walked alone to the hotel. When I mentioned it to the door-men they didn't seem to care, they just smiled at me... During my stay at the hotel, I saw this beggar hanging around and whenever I was leaving and arriving at the hotel I was constantly concerned for my own safety.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough For Us!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayhappy_8
Reviews.Content: I was booked to this hotel through a secret deal on a certain website.After reading a few reviews I was a little worried what to expect! I believe it comes down to what you expect in a hotel,and previous experiences in 5 star. I rarely travel,so the thought of a 5star hotel in sydney sounded good.My daughter (7) and I stayed overnight in a deluxe king room.We traveled by train to wynyard station and is only a street away walking.On arrival,the door was opened with a "welcome to the amora" the girls at front desk were polite and showed us how to use the cards for the elevator and rooms.Our room was on floor 17.I found the rooms spacious enough,HUGE king size comfortable bed,well stocked bar fridge,tv,robes,slippers,guides to sydney,very nice bathroom with deep tub,seperate shower,shower gel\shampoo\cond\hand lotion. Our room looked into the other buildings with glimpses of the water,but if you stay in the CBD you just expect that and being from the country it was fine with us to check out the city. We had a light dinner at the Gallery and was nice.Breakfast for a buffet is $33,but there is a food court practically underneath,with every kind of eatery you could wish for.Also a cafe next door advertising full breakfast and coffee for $12.50.Location - Perfect! A short walk to circular quay\botanic gardens\ferries\trains etc was excellent.We explored the hotel pool which we thought was nice with a sauna\steam room\spa as well,and the beauty room.Did not use these but seemed very relaxing.Other reviews say about times with this hotel.Yes the pool\restaurants etc are open certain times, so if this is important to you doesnt it make sense to find this stuff out before you go?Anyway we loved it,and the service,I think if you have a smile,they will too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Poppageorgio
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from the internet and everything looked fine on the web site. Unfortunately apon arrivial found that this hotel is in a real need of a wake up call i found all staff rude and unwilling to help with offering assistance, i always had to ask. I also ate in the Hotels Signature restaurant and found the food over priced and lacked any taste or style at all. I would recommend for anyone who does stay there to eat outside of the hotel. My last complaint of the hotel is that i wouldnt ask the door man for a taxi its quicker to get one your self.

Reviews.Title: “Everthing was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MJosie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a package on a Saturday, which included a quality 2 course dinner and breakfast and it was a wonderful weekend, could not have asked for more from this hotel or the staff. The Amora Jamison has reasonable rates and is great quality, not to mention within a very short walk of the Pitt Street Mall, and 15 minutes to Darling Harbour. Rooms have large windows and modern fittings, the lovely bathroom had a large deep free-standing bath, and there were robes and slippers in the wardrobes. There is also a sleek, long pool, spa, steam room and sauna, and day spa and complimentary newspapers provided each morning. Staff were EXTREMELY helpful at every step, from front desk, and concierge through to waiters and reservation staff. We were in Sydney to see Phantom of the Opera and the attentive staff were more than happy to work an early dinner in for us before the show. All up, the whole stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Huge beds!”
Reviews.Author: JonathonP
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Amora 4-5 times a year as my company's Sydney office is just around the corner. The rooms are very attractively furnished, although not huge. The bathrooms are also very nice. But my favourite aspect is the bed - I'm very tall and the Amora's beds are so big I can almost sleep sideways in them. Some rooms have fairly decent harbour vierws, although far from unobstructed. The TVs could do with being updated - 4:3 CRTs really aren't good enough these days. I usually pay approx $210-230, but it's booked through my company's travel agent, so rates are outside my control. In summary, for a place where I usually check in at about 9pm and check out at 7am the next morning, it's perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - think I scored an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at the Amora when on Business. I got a great rate booked through my office and I think I scored an upgrade in the deal - although nothing was said to me at check in. I had a room on Lv 32 on the western side of the building. Very comfortable King Bed with a large picture window. A big comfy lounge chair and a work desk were in the room. a big wall unit contained everything you could want - fully stocked mini bar and tea/coffee making, TV with internet and games, robes, slippers, etc the funny part was the big old boxy TV - still it had perfect reception. the bathroom was large with a big soaking tub up against a picture window - I enjoyed a great soak although you can't see out the window once in the tub. the best part was that there was a TV Volume / speaker in the bathroom. So I soaked away whilst listening to a program. The range of toiletries was great - soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, toothbrush and paste, vanity set with cotton balls, pads, shower cap, sewing kit etc etc Had good lighting for doing my makeup including a magnified "shaving mirror" on a retractable arm. I used the gym - which was pretty good - good quality machines in perfect order. the room was a bit small and there were no hand weights or fitballs. I had breakfast at the buffet the next morning and that was very good. a bit expensive but they did cook me 2 poached eggs and there was a chef making fresh omlettes to order. check out was very easy I wish I could have stayed longer - very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chief1tas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amora Jamison for 3 nights. We arrived later than expected due to our flight being delayed and upon arrrival at the hotel (which was after 2pm) we found our room not ready. The check in staff apologised and asked if we would like another room to which we replied 'yes'. They then couldn't get the swipe keys to the room to work so gave us a couple of complimentary drink cards to go and sit in the bar whilst they sorted our room. We went to our room not long after and found a nice letter on the bed welcoming back another geust to the hotel, which we recieved phone calls throughout the entire stay (very annoying). We had booked the 'sweethearts package' and this package included sparkling wine and chocolates on arrival in the room. The wine was in the room but no chocolates, phone call was made to reception to ask for the chocolates. We received at the door a bowl of fruit, didn't ask for this but took it anyway. Another phone call was made to enquire about the chocolates, recieved another bottle of wine, another phone call and we had the chocolates. There didn't seem to be any communication between the 4 staff members we spoke to but all the extras was free of charge!! The package also included in room dining for breakfast which arrived on time each morning but the staff just pushed the trolley into the room and said the toaster is in the cupboard and left. We left our room the following morning at 9.30 to go shopping and returned to our room around 2pm. Our room had not been made up in this time so we phoned housekeeping to complain, floor manager explained they had 400 rooms to get through etc...This is not our problem and when check in is 2pm you would expect adequat staff to complete this task. Our room was cleaned and within half hour of the cleaner leaving we had another knock at the door to clean our room!! When we checked out they tried to charge us for the mini bar items that had been used (not by us). We had previously stayed here when it went by the name of Rydges Jamison and I think when the name changed all the excellent staff went with them. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Treat”
Reviews.Author: sin2me
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at this hotel for one night after a tough week at work.. We both live in Sydney suburbia & decided to spend a Friday night in the city as a treat.. We actually booked this hotel on the wotif website, which is a lottery selection of sorts. We got a complimentary upgrade upon arrival to a larger room with a HUGE bed. There is a lovely view over the city lights which I always love to see. The bathroom was gorgeous with a fabulous big bath tub. The staff couldn't have been more friendly. The location is great, very central. The best part for me was the pillows though! (sad i know) I have never slept on a nicer, softer, more comfortable pillow in my life! So much so that I keep promising myself that I am going to ring the hotel to see if I can buy them!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stillwaiting48
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent three wonderful nights at the Amora Jamison and we could not fault any aspect of our stay.The room was spotless, the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom very modern. We would highly recommend this accomodation to all our friends and family. The staff were Excellent, Friendly and the doorman was very well mannered and polite.Room service was five star. We have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and this one rated the best all round for us. In future we will only stay at Amora..Thankyou to all staff!!!!!! keep doing such a great job. We will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Madgey
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be excellent. I booked it as a Wot Hotel on wotif so I got a great rate. I arrived late at night and found check in easy and the staff were friendly for that time of night. The room was a good size but not huge. Great bathroom with bath and quality products. Has everything other 5 star hotels has but doesn't quite seem 5 star. Location is fantastic, close to shops and the Harbour. I didn't have room service, but had the buffet breakfast which I found be excellent. Friendly staff that continually walked around topping up tea and coffee which was appreciated. My stay was great but I was glad I got it at a reduced price, a little pricey at its recommended price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mve111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amora Jamison for 3 nights as the start of our honeymoon. We had a club level room on one of the top floors. The rooms were modern, clean and well appointed with pretty good views of the city. No views of the bridge or opera house though. We had access to the club room where we got drinks and nibbles every afternoon, complimentary tea and coffee anytime and also had breakfast there. We also had the choice of breakfast in the main restaurant which in our opinion is better as there is much more choice. We dont have any complaints with the Amora Jamison. The hotel is very nice, the service is of a high standard and the location is very close to shopping, circular quay and transport. The only tiny annoyance is the Tv, as it is positioned side on to the bed and not all that comfortable to watch while in bed. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a cheaper price”
Reviews.Author: sportygalaus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and conducted some meetings in this hotel. I wouldn't say it is up to five star standard, some of the staff seem to have trouble grasping english and the design of the rooms is a little weird. I had a room on the 14th floor with a balcony. The bed was huge and comfy and the bathroom was immaculate but for some silly reason the TV is at the side of the bed so you can't lay in bed and watch it without getting a sore neck or laying sideways across the bed. In terms of meeting facilities, they are good and the restaurant for lunch is fantastic but when there is a large conference on in the ballroom, it gets very cramped in the area outside the meeting rooms and noisy. Location wise it is an easy walk down to Circular Quay and the Opera House. There is a maccas across the road if you don't want to pay $33 for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a brilliant room on the 14th floor - it was large, well decorated, clean, very comfy bed, and unbelievably, a balcony!! It was great. So why wasn't it quite 5 star (as advertised on wotif.com)? Limited channel choice, in room breakfast was a bit on the stingy side, there was an out of date Vogue magazine to read, no map in the top drawer (as stated in the compendium) and my morning newspaper was nowhere to be seen. So, all in all, this is a lovely hotel in a handy location, but the attention to detail (those things that mark a great hotel from the rest) wasn't evident. I would stay here if you can can get a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Service is something that other hotels do!”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Poor check-in, unfriendly staff, didn't clean room well, 3 days without replenishing the mini-bar, complained and nothing improved. Poor location for getting a taxi, especially on a Friday night and don't expect much from the concierge or front desk staff who are too important and busy to concern themselves with their "guests' welfare. Not worth the room rate. Starting to look a bit shabby in certain areas including the rooms. Room service food quality was quite poor. Breakfast elsewhere would have been a better option. I can't think of anything particularly positive to say about the hotel other than writing an awful review of it gives me some pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice amenties”
Reviews.Author: GaijinKim
Reviews.Content: The Amora was a beautiful hotel - tastefully decorated, comfortable, with views of the city. They had lovely amenities - like a complimentary bottle of champagne on arrival (which I didn't know about) and a lovely breakfast and food/drink credit for the hotel restaurants - also, a nice gym/pool. The only drawback was some of the service in the restaurant was a little slow or confused, but I credit this with the Christmas week, skeleton staff. I thought the location and the value for money were outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatieP78
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location.... only 5-10 mins from Opera House and the Bridge - only 15 mins walk from Darling Harbour! Got given free upgrade - very friendly staff - would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: live2dream88
Reviews.Content: 1) Great Location: This is a great place to stay if you want to be right where all the action and transportation is! About 2 blocks from the train station, you can hop on and ride to many locations around town(and to and from the airport! Much cheaper than a taxi). Or just walk to Circular Quay and hop on a trolley to go to the zoo and other attractions across the Harbour. So convenient and we didn't have to rent a car. 2) Friendly & Professional Employees: First of all, they let us check into our room at 10:30 AM. Plus we got upgraded for free to a King size room with a great view. They are always willing to help with any questions or info you need- I wanted to use the internet for 15 minutes only and they didn't have cards for that short of time, so instead of making me pay extra for time I didn't need, he gave me a code for complimentary internet time. The concierge is right in the lobby and can book you to practically any tour in Sydney! 3) Decent room: Not exactly a US standard 5 star but.. Room was decent sized with big windows, no balcony. Bed was comfy and the bathroom had a great glass shower with plenty of hot water. There was also a deep old-fashioned tub that we didn't use. TV is old and in a strange location- behind doors next to the bed- but who needs TV when you're in SYDNEY! Also had mini-fridge and coffee/tea. 4)Pool- didn't use so can't comment on that * One other tip- I would recommend avoiding GrayLine Tours. First they charged me 3 times for the tour because their website sucks- it took 3 emails and a phone call to get it taken care of. Plus they are very impersonal and the tour guides don't give much information- they're more like drivers. It was a vast contrast to our next tour with Activity Tours to the Blue Mtns. The tour guide was super friendly, gave us a TON of information (and jokes) we even learned some Aussie phrases. Check them out at activitytours.com.au

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzML
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in December 2007 while hosting some overseas clients. In the past we typically take such clients to the Intercontinental or Marriot, both near Circular Quay, and on this occasion decided to try the Amora, being a 5 star rated hotel in a similar vicinity. Arriving at the hotel in our car, the Valet service was prompt, friendly and efficient. Check in was also quick, as we had to check in both for our room and for a conference room (Jamieson Club Boardroom) that we had booked for the afternoon, which was on the 31st floor. Room: The room was very comfortable, the bathroom including both a bath and a shower. The room was very clean, no signs of dust. As mentioned in previous reviews, the television was in a very strange location (in a cupboard at 90 degrees to the bed), and was and old CRT style unit. Conference Room: The conference room for 8 people (AU$550 for 6 hours) was a letdown. On the 31st floor, it had views of the adjacent buildings and a few glimpses of the water. The decor was dated, as was the furniture, which was looking tired. During the afternoon a number of flies were buzzing around the room, and I called reception to get them to send up some fly spray. I was advised that an engineer would be sent up immediately. 3 hours later when we left the boardroom for the day, nothing had been sent up. I complained to the reception staff who apoligised, I know this is not their fault however it represented a poor system for dealing with small issues at the hotel. Location: The location is good, but not 'prime' like many of the other hotels in the area. Several of the taxi drivers we used during the stay did not know where it was located, and we had to give directions. The walk to Circular Quay is short, but the hotel does not stand out as a 'landmark' like several of the others in the area. Dining: We dined out both nights, at Doyles at Circular Quay on Sat night and at Sydney Tower on Sunday night. We ordered lunch through room service to the board room during our meeting and it was prompt and delicious. Concierge: The booking at Doyles and a booking for a harbour cruise were handled efficiently through the concierge. On the last day I left my luggage with the concierge and it was also managed efficiently. Price: We paid AU$230 for the Saturday night and AU$205 for the Sunday night, so both nights represented a saving of between AU$60 and AU$100 compared to several nearby 5 star hotels. Valet parking at AU$45 per night was steep compared to others we have stayed at. Lobby / Lifts etc: The lobby was beautifully presented. To use the lifts, each person has to use their key to activate their floor. When the lifts are busy this is an unwanted imposition, as there is only one card reader in each lift, and they did not operate repeatably (with 10 people in the lift all trying 2-3 times to swipe their cards, this is a long process). We stayed in room 911, and when the lifts were busy often I had passed this floor before being able to access the reader and get it to work, which was an inconvenience. I have stayed in other hotels with similar systems but there have always been multiple readers and they have worked flawlessly. Overall impression: The hotel tries hard to be 5 star but seemed a bit rough around the edges compared to the Intercontinental and the Marriot, but then again comes at a lower price. For important overseas clients, I would book them in at these other hotels in future before the Amora. I felt it was good value, and if it was just my wife and I travelling, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTorro
Reviews.Content: The Jamison is in a wonderful location and we were able to easily walk to shops, Rocks and Darling Harbour including at night to dinner! The room was lovely (corner suite) although we only had one wall of windows, whilst our other 2 friends that had corner suits had 2 walls with windows (not a major just unexpected). The bed.....Like other reviews it would have to be the most comfortable sleep we have had in a hotel without exception! Some hotel beds are SO hard, but this was just divine - no bad backs either! The bathroom is exceptional - large and roomy with a fabulous view from the large freestanding bath. We didnt have a great room service breakfast experience - things were cold, drinks and cutlery missing and having to eat one meal with a spoon as it didnt arrive in time! Seemed like communication was a bit of an issue although everything did arrive eventually! The concierge and desk staff were really friendly and helpful face to face but it didnt seem to matter what request we had i.e pre-ordering taxi's etc nothing was right! Not one taxi we pre-ordered arrived and our taxi order was given to other patrons and vice versa! A shame as it tainted an otherwise perfect stay. We would still however stay at the hotel as overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas 2006”
Reviews.Author: tompsmith
Reviews.Content: After reading through the various reviews on this website, we chose the Amora due to its location. 15min walk from Darling Harbour, less than 5mins to the Coathanger (bridge) and about 10mins to the Opera House. I wish I hadn't taken as many clothes, as the shopping around this area is also great. You're in the business district area, but the transport is excellent and the buses will take you directly to Bondi beach or to the suburbs. Back to the hotel, the views from the 30-somethingth floor were great, and you've got a huge window seal to sit on and admire the view. The bathroom is excellent, wetroom style shower and the bed was very comfortable and big! Staff polite, helpful and knowledgable, booked the Blue Mountain tour from within the hotel which is a must. We stayed for a week over xmas and were delighted with our choice of hotel. Tom & Natalie

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Croft24
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband arrived 26th November to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday, we stayed on the 33rd floor and had a wonderful room fantastic bathroom with lovely views of Farm Cove. We were upgraded and had the opportunity of having breakfast and drinks in the Jamison Club Lounge which was wonderful, the staff in the club lounge were excellant especially Summer, she could not be more helpful. Equally the staff on the front desk, porters and cleaning staff always had a smile, the hospitality was excellant. The hotel was in a good position for the Rocks area and Circular Quays and about a 15 minute walk to Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour, we would most positively return to this hotel it was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AussieChicGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a deluxe room for 5 nights. Luckily, we received a free upgrade to a Club Jamison room. Staying in this room entitled us to a complimentary breakfast at the Club room and free wine and canapes in the evening. The hotel is in a great area - 5 minutes walk to Ciruclar Quay, The Rocks and Darling Harbour just a bit further. The food in the main restuarant, the Charr, was excellent - we had a wonderful sirloin steak for around $30 and top service from all the staff. The concierge staff have a nice touch of opening the main hotel doors for you arriving and leaving. The hotel has an indoor pool, jacuzzi and spa - heavenly after a day of walking around town and again lovely views over the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be near the shops and main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tenith
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oct 2007. We chose a weekend package which was excellent value- room with water views, seafood buffet and club breakfast. The food at dinner and breakfast was really amazing. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay. Just as pleasant as the first.”
Reviews.Author: hellwolf
Reviews.Content: I think we first stayed at this hotel in December 2005 when it was still under Rydges management. Not much has changed since then, still received friendly service from the staff and a clean and comfortable room. The room was comfortable, everything looked like it was in good condition. The bath was nice and big. We really liked the curtains/blinds in the room, unlike some hotels we've stayed in, this room had a really thick roller blind which went all the way to the sides and to the bottom and therefore blocked all the morning sun which allowed us to sleep-in. The only thing that was a little annoying was that one of the cleaning staff came and knocked on our door at 9AM thinking we had checked out already, that was not the best way to wake up. We booked our stay through the Hotelclub website. (You get pretty much the same pricing from Hotelclub,Lastminute and Wotif). I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for international beauty show”
Reviews.Author: beautygetaway
Reviews.Content: loved every minute room was beautiful (had corner room) very comfy bathroom stunning with bath and large window but needs tinted windows.view was average ,seafood dinner was AAA+ and the breakfast was 2. every one are very helpfull .will stay again .have stayed at many in sydney and this is one off the best so far .my husband wanted to stay again ,but i want to try new one so of f to saville this week end hopefully it will be just as good will let every one know .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tattitalk
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay, would stay again and happily recommend. Excellent value for money when compared to other properties of the same star rating. Good location. Great rooms, soft sheets, and lovely bathroom with separate deep bathtub. Easy access from the train station around the corner. Concierge was extremely helpful, sorting out some luggage issues we were having with the airline. He was more helpful than the airline staff were. We were very thankful. We sent some laundry to the hotel valet, and unfortunately the clothing was lost. The management of the hotel were extremely apologetic, offered a full explanation of what happened, and re-imbursed us for the full replacement cost of the items without arguement. While it was unfortunate that this happened, we could not fault their response to the problem. When you travel, sometimes things go wrong -- its the response to the problems that really counts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Young concierge in Town”
Reviews.Author: Sexy_GirlHongKong
Reviews.Content: Nathan is the best concierge in town, thanks for all your help thoughout our stay :). Will be back at this hotel for sure..

Reviews.Title: “Staff were well mannered”
Reviews.Author: tripper2007
Reviews.Content: Bad points: No view Not enough staff in the parking area-there were occasion where we parked our car and had to wait for the staff to turn up. Not a good location Good points Staff were polite-opens the door for you everytime you go out. Convenient valvet parking-can enter and exit a lot of time. Had a iron, iron board and a dryer in the room which means less packing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: spartac
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel sometime in the summer of 06, while it was changing ownership. I called them a few weeks before the start of my trip and was told that they didn't have my reservation. My travel agent was able to work it out but I suspect they just re-booked me again. I was lucky that a room was still available. So somehow they had lost my reservation. This is unusual, even when changing hands. One or two days before betting there I checked their website for directions and noticed that they had amazing special. So my agent re-booked me again. From about 270$ we were paying about 180-190$. PRO: - Convenient location - Good value at the discounted rate. Overpriced for the full rate - Very nice bathroom - I had a nice non obstructed view. But no waterfront views at this hotels. - Very quiet hotel. This was the main reason I didnâ€™t go for the establishment, located almost next door. - Lots of eating options around. Good breakfast place next door (to right of the hotel) - Comfortable beds CON: - I feel that the website does too much on the Marketing. Somehow the hotel and rooms don't looks as amazing in real life, I felt that the lobby and common area were on the small size, and fell very...empty. No life. - Decent inside pool. However they put so much chlorine that you can't really use it unless you wear swimming glasses. - Not reliable reservation experience. Above all: nothing is really exceptional about this hotel, especially if you get it at regular price. But good value if discounted. If I return to Sydney I might look into alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Bad Breakfast & Car Parking”
Reviews.Author: Always_on_holidays
Reviews.Content: Having first stayed at the Amora in June, we decided to stay again in August. While during our second stay we were welcomed back with a sensational room, however, this time around no carparking avaialbe in the hotel (had booked a package with car parking). We had to walk around the corner to the car park (in the rain!), staff weren't overally helpful regarding this. Also, the second car park took us over 20 minutes to get out, by time they find your car you then drive 1/2 way underway Sydney to exit the park. Again not fun early in the morning when you are tyring to get somewhere! Breakfast was great first time, but second stay not sure if we were up too early, but everything seemed to be cold and not fresh, which you think it would be at 7.00am. Room - great, excellent Beds - fantastic Carpark - pathetic - shoudn't offer as part of packages if they don't have them. Breakfast - average

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: jl877
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel earlier this year and if I were to spend another $200 for a hotel stay, it would not be here. Our welcome at reception.....well lets just say that we could have received a warmer response from a chicken sandwich. The bathroom was beautiful and clean. The view was lacking. We could see a small strip sydney harbour and the opera house, with our main view being a big office block next to us. The restaurant downstairs was good- nice food at a decent price. The breakfast was the same, however, I suggest if you want it, you should include it in your stay-it makes it much easier. The location is convienent- near the Rocks and the harbour. (A must go place to eat is Pancakes on the Rocks- yum!). Despite this, there are many other hotels located nearby that I would go to next time, such as the Shangri-La or Four Seasons, which are much closer to the main tourist attractions and there would be no troubles in finding your way back to the hotel (which we experienced).

Reviews.Title: “loved amora on jamieson”
Reviews.Author: getawayAustralia
Reviews.Content: amora on jamieson was a fantastic place to stay. very close to the rocks area,the harbour bridge',circular quary,and great places to eat.the beds were king size and very comfortable,i loved the bathrooms ,seperate large bath,and plenty of room,slippers and gowns were a nice surprise in our wardrobes,and a great mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what you are told”
Reviews.Author: Wodger1
Reviews.Content: About a month ago I booked two Jamison Club rooms so that my my wife would have somewhere pleasant to stay in Sydney to celebrate her 40th birthday with her sisters. I booked 2 x twin rooms (that is, two double beds in each room). Two days before the check-in date, a friendly member of the hotel staff called me to confirm my reservation of TWO JAMISON CLUB TWIN ROOMS. Also, having previously read some posts on tripadvisor regarding difficulties in obtaining parking at the hotel, I called the hotel the day before check-in to find out whether there would be any problem obtaining valet parking. I was told "It won't be a problem at all because the hotel will be just about empty". Upon arriving at the hotel, two of the sisters that drove to the hotel were advised that valet parking was not available and that they would have to drive a block away to get parking. In addition, upon check-in, my wife was told that only one twin room was available and that the other would have to be a Deluxe King room (1 x king bed). These two significant failings are unacceptable, particularly because this hotel claims to be 5-star. Apart from these problems, the rooms were fine and represent good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeJCartwright
Reviews.Content: Amora Jamison Hotel 9 to 13 March Excellent service which it would be hard to fault. A nice spacious room with great view over the city. Ideally situated in the small business area and within walking distance of the shops and QVB and the Rocks, harbour, bridge and Opera House. Nice cocktail bar and two good restaurants. Many fine restaurants close by; try 1 Albert Street and Doyles on the Quay both are five minutes walk away. Clean tidy and a staff of well trained and motivated smiling and helpful people. Everything worked and everything we wanted was there - ironing board to Movies on Demand. If visiting would I stay here again - a very certain, yes!

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: Danae70
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Staff were friendly and ok, although forgot to bring one of our bags up to the room, and the room was spacious and clean. The most fantastic plus was the scrumptious bed and pillows that gave us the best sleep ever. The breakfast in the Gallery restaurant was just ok, nothing to rave about and as breakfast was included in our package we felt we had to eat there. I would choose to stay here again but have breakfast elsewhere. Great location also but i agree with other reviews, the view is masked even on the tenth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: RAVCO
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find their carpark full and no valet service available and was told to park the car in a carpark under another hotel. This inconvenience was soon forgotten when we got to our Deluxe room we booked through [----]. The room was clean spacious and very large with a beautiful bathroom with a deep hot tub, we even had our own little balcony. As per other reviews, you are surrounded by buildings but at least we had glimpses of the approaches to the Harbour Bridge. The hot Buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff were very friendly. The pool was OK and the gym reasonably well appointed. I suppose the only letdown was when I had to pickup the car. Being from out of town and booked in for a knee op I had to walk for about 2kms in old railway tunnels which form the Wynyard Carpark to pick up my car then it took me half a our more to finally get back to my wife to pick her up in the Amora foyer. Not happy. I saw most people arrive at the hotel in cabs so how can their carpark be full?? Sadly we won't be going back and left quite stressed. Sad because its actually one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in in Sydney with exception of the Mecure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the reception”
Reviews.Author: Geoff A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Amora for 5 nights during our extended Australian vacation. The plus points were its location, being only 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay and the main shopping centres, being adjacent to Winyard Station, thereby providing easy access to the airport and that it was clean and well furnished. However it does not have any views of the Opera House or Harbour Bridge, being a few blocks back behind equally tall buildings. However if you are on the higher floors you do get other views of the waterfront. We stayed in a Club Room which was clean, tidy and well-furnished. We also had use of the Club Lounge, which included continental breakfast and complimentary canapÃ©s and drinks in the early evening. If you intend eating breakfast and being around for the early evening snacks, then in our view the additional cost is well worth it. We cannot agree about the comments from a previous contributor about the Club staff. All the staff we met in the Club Lounge were polite, helpful but discrete. They were happy to converse with the customers, but only if you wanted to talk with them. Otherwise in our view they just went about there business. However we did chat to them at some length, which proved to be invaluable through them providing help and advice which meant we got the maximum benefit out of our stay in Sydney. The major criticism I have with the hotel was the attitude of the receptionist on our arrival. We had travelled on the overnight train from Melbourne, arriving at the hotel at around 8:30 a.m. We did not expect our room to be ready so early, but did expect on the basis that we would be spending in excess of AS$1600 with the hotel, that we would be able to make use of the Club Room facilities, including breakfast, before hitting Sydney. However the receptionist was adamant that whilst we could go to the Club Room, we would have to pay extra for breakfast. He could offer no other alternative. Consequently we simply left our luggage with the Concierge and eat outside of the hotel. On the basis that initial impressions matter most, the hotel started off very poorly, particularly when compared with the attitude shown to us by our previous hotel. In our view, Club guests should have a separate check-in, either at reception or in the lounge itself and your use of the facilities should commence from the moment you arrive, irrespective of when during the day that actually occurs. In summary a perfectly adequate hotel, well situated to the local facilities, only let down for us by a discourteous receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Not used to such luxury”
Reviews.Author: jetheather
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I am easy to please, but I had an excellent stay at this hotel. We were a honeymoon couple, and so got to our room to find a bottle of champagne complete with choccies. I was in heaven. We sat on lovely chairs with foot rests and just looked out over sydney in bliss. The bathroom was huge and amazing, the bed was massive. The staff were polite and not at all snotty. We booked via expedia and got a really good deal which included access to the junior club lounge which meant free champers and nibbles all night. The only down side was having to converse with the club host who kept trying to tell us her problems/how great she was etc etc. The spa was good although the pool was a little cold. I really don't see how anyone could knock this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to review of 16 feb 07”
Reviews.Author: Trelor71
Reviews.Content: We have just read review by ricardohk on 16 feb 07. and could not have put it better ourselves. Stayed in Shangri la on our previous visit to Sydney, this hotel compares favourably for alot less money. You only really miss the view. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ricardoHK
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay here. We were on a 4 days first time visit to Sydney and chose the hotel for its location. This worked out very well for a number of different reasons. First, it's only 20mins from the airport in a taxi (make sure you ask to go through the toll tunnel) at a cost of A$40. Second, its less than a 5min walk to the circular quay piers from where you can take ferries to places like Manly beach. Also, its a 5min walk to the central shopping area of Pitt street and George street. Also, if you are on a business trip, its very close to the central business district. The hotel room itself is spacious and the bathroom is very large. No real view from our room, but this didn't bother us as we were out and about for most of our visit. Apparently, it is possible to pay for an upgrade which includes a great breakfast and a 2hr free drinks period in the early evening. Sounds a bit dangerous to me!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: kylie-ann
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about staying at the Amora because of a few reviews on this site, but the price was just so good, we went ahead anyway - and I'm so glad we did! We stayed fo 2 nights over the Australia Day long weekend, and found the location to be perfect. It's a quick walk down to The Rocks and also to Circular Quay. We did have to wait 1/2 and hour for our room because we checked in early. No worries there. Also when booking, I requested a room as far up as possible because I'm a light sleeper. We were on the 29th floor which was perfect! We even had a little bit of a view over to the harbour. Our room was spotlessly clean, and the bed was super soft. Just lovely to spend a long weekend in! The best bit about the room though was the bathroom. I wanted to take the big, deep bath home with me. It also had a huge separate shower too which was nice. Breakfast was your usual hotel fare with the exception of the orange juice. The have a big machine there that freshly squeezes juice as required - delicious! All in all, I think the Amora is where we will be staying from now on. The only thing that I didn't like about it as much as some other hotels we've staying in before in Sydney is that because it's down in the financial district, there isn't an abundance of great restaurants at your doorstep. That being said, they are still only a 5 minute walk or cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in the city after a function in December and, not having heard of it, decided to try the Amora out on an introductory package -- that made it much cheaper than many of the others. We thought it would be fine to stay there if you were on business -- the location is good and the beds very comfortable. Otherwise, it has no real view, nothing particularly interesting about it and the service was adequate rather than attentive.Like another reviewer we did find it strange that all of the restaurants and bars were closed except one, particularly when there was still something in the room saying how great they all were. (Although the food manager we met was excellent and very welcoming!). So, there was nothing wrong with the experience but if I was a tourist, or looking for a romantic weekend, I think that there are nearby hotels with more excitement. I guess it depends what you're looking for and what price comparisons you find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: lizzy309
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert, but I would like to think I know something about good service. On our way to the hotel, we were called by the hotel to check if we really wanted 2 rooms... We did book 2, for 4 adults. I don't know if it was because we booked them late notice on such a cheap rate, or if the duty manager was having a bad night. They tried saying that we had only booked for one night, our passes were locked and wouldn't let us up to the rooms. During the 2 nights we stayed there, we were told on more than one occasion that "You can't stay longer than what you've booked, we're fully booked". If we did extend out stay in Sydney, we definitely wouldn't stay there any longer!! They tried accusing us of taking food from the mini bar, when it wasn't refilled before we went in there... OK, so the room was nice, I would like to take the bed home!! We had a view of an office building & a "park"... Overall, the location is great, 5-10 minutes walk to Circular Quay & monorail station, great shopping on George Street. Facilities were pretty good, pool, a bit of gym equipment, sauna... I probably wouldn't go there again though, only because of the service because to me that is a major factor in whether I enjoy my stay or not.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not 4 or 5 star, though”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: Like the Jan. 1st review of the Jamison, my husband and I stayed at this hotel over NYE. It was not our first choice, but since it was NYE, other hotels required either a 6 night minimum or were just insanely expensive for the event. All right, sure the hotel has a pretty convenient location, but it is no 4 or 5 star hotel and should not advertise as such. I'd say it's a strong 3 1/2 star, but that's about as generous as I'm willing to be. Since we paid 5 star rates for NYE, I felt we should have experienced at least a 4 star hotel. We stayed on one of the Club Floors and had access to the club lounge, which did offer a pretty good continental breakfast and evening cocktails. I would recommend staying on the Club Floors if you choose this hotel. Buster at the concierge desk also did a great job for us with our NYE reservations. However, like other reviews have mentioned, the furnishings and linens were a little worn, and there's no dedicated bellman outside. Also disappointing was that the supposedly cool bar and restaurant were closed during our 3 day stay, which was pretty inconvenient on new year's day when most of the city was closed down. I'd say that if you can get a good deal on this hotel, it's probably just fine. Otherwise, the Four Seasons or the Shangrila are a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Would recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: ranj1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights for our honeymoon in December 2006. When we arrived at the hotel we had been travelling for 42 hours from the UK (our flight had been delayed 11 hours in Dubai)So we were so jet lagged. We were greeted by a very friendly lady at the reception who booked us in very quickly!! We were on the 33rd floor (1 floor from the top) & the view was amazing. The bed was so comfortable & could have taken it home with me if i could have got it in my suitcase. The Concierge were so helpful & very friendly indeed. They knew so much about the city, the best tours & the best places to eat etc. The pool was small but not busy at all & went in the jucuzzi every day!! The hotel location is also excellent. Less than a five minute walk from the harbour bridge, opera house& the rocks. Only 10-15 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Hotel is on Jamison Street wjich is off George Street - which is the main shopping area & there are many take aways within a few minutes walking distance. The underground station is just 2 mins walk from the hotel also. We had a Jamison Club room which gave us access to Jamison Club Facilities (breakfast, evening canapies 5pm-7pm, internet access etc) at only which i would highly recommend. I can go on about how amazing this hotel is but you if you visit Sydney this is a MUST stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: joeb1249
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery after seeing some other reviews, but our experience at the Amora Sydney was quite positive. The location is perfect for easy access to Circular Quay, the Opera House, and the ferries. Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable and clean. Prices at the hotel restaurants were very high, but we found many acceptable alternatives within walking distance of the hotel. I would not hestitate to stay here again and would recommend the Amora to anyone looking to stay in Sydney's central business district.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jess127
Reviews.Content: Great service, great rooms, great bathrooms, great food! A great overnight stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MysticMong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jamison for 8 nights over the week the hotel changed from Rydges to Amora. The location is excellent, just 5 mins to Circular Quay/The Rocks and 10 mins to Darling Harbour. We found the staff to be very helpful, particularly the concierge team. Our standard room was very spacious and the bathroom was superb. If we were being uber-critical the tele was in a silly position but you don't go to Sydney to watch the tv. The only gripe is that the lifts have that annoying security system where you have to swipe your room card to access your floor and it doesn't work very well. It can be frustrating. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustbackfromZante
Reviews.Content: As we stayed 2 nights in Sydney, we choosed the Amora Jamsion (ex-Rydges Jamison) which is a really a nice Hotel in the Centre of Sydney, minutes walk to Darling Harbour, The Rocks and the Financial District. Restaurant are really nearby. We loved the room on the 15th Floor with its view. Staff was very helpful and professional. Room was nice appointed as well and bathroom was beautiful with its White and Black color. Great place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Tourist Location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fifi01
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the amora as part of our holiday. The location was great and approx 5 minutes walk to most of the tourist attractions inc Circle Quays. It has the added bonus of being 20 mtrs from George Street from where you can hop on any bus including the tourist sightseeing bus to get around the city. We were allocated a room on the 5th floor which was adequate in size, modern and clean. There was however a shortage of storage space including drawers for emptying our suitcases into. Room service was lapse at times and we would find ourselves returning to the room at 4-30pm to find the room still had not been made up. An ice bucket from our room layout side the door for collection for two days prior to it being collected. Staff especially the concierge and door staff were helpful and pleasant. The main problem we experienced was from the building working from the ajacent building.Each morning we would be woken at 7am to the sound of a pneumatic drill lifting the paving on the ajacent open foyer area. This problem was exasperated by being on a low floor. Overall a good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrrible reception staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: LaineyF
Reviews.Content: uk trip advisor member. We spent 5 nights here at the beginning of Nov. Arrived at 9am but understandably the room was not ready yet, took a walk then came back and waited in lobby area for room. Staff on reception said they would call us when it was ready. After waiting for over an hour I asked again - the room had been ready for over half an hour and we had been left sat in the lobby. The room itself (a deluxe on the 19th floor) was excellent. Was very impressed with size, decor, facilities etc. Also the pool, jacuzzi facilities etc were excellent. Again though the staff lower my opinion of this hotel; on more than 2 or 3 occasssions I could get no answer from reception, even though they had posted a note asking me to contact them to arrange to refill the mini bar - this was never done. We ordered breakfast in bed which arrived on time and looked great but was stone cold. Again when I tried to phone somebody about this - no answer. I couldn't even get the huge trolley it came on removed from our room (I got through on the phone later in the afternoon and told them I had left it in the corridor). It remained there for 24hrs. At check out I informed the staff that I had tried lots but had not been able to get the mini bar refilled and had used approx $45. They told me it didn't matter and I wouldn't be charged. Because of this I didn't complain about the breakfast (which cost approx $75). I paid for my phone calls (I had a faulty phone or something went wrong disconnecting a call at reception so lost 40mins on an international phone card), and left. When I got back to the uk I had been charged the $45 dollars too! I must say that not all staff were poor; the guys who open the doors, collect and deliver luggage were pleasant, helpful and a credit to the hotel. There doesn't seem to be any conatct details on the web page and I don't really want to be phoning australia to complain about my problems, so will just have to put this one down to experience. This hotel is really nice and could be one of the best in sydney, but the customer service side of things needs to improve greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel - quite contemporary!”
Reviews.Author: MaxTraveller
Reviews.Content: While travelling here on business, I decided to take a good weekend rate for a corner king room. The hotel is modern and has a very contemporary feel. Checking in was good, no issues or delay. I was assigned a corner room on the 25th floor which had a nice view of downtown. Reading the prior reviews, I was ready to see lots of dust. Somehow, this room did not have that issue. The marble bathroom with seperate tub and shower was a nice touch. The corner room had nice room to spread out. The only improvement here would be to equip the room with a tv that's larger than 20 inches. Then again, my purpose for coming is not to look at tv all day, but rather to take advantage of the hotel's central location. The gym on the 3rd level is average. I have scene better elsewhere, plus no ellliptical exercise machine. I'd stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A long way to go”
Reviews.Author: CSRC
Reviews.Content: Booked an Executive Club king room for $270 per night. For this, you get a room on a high floor and access to the club lounge with drinks and canapes from 5:30pm to 7:30pm and continental breakfast. The room had great views (32nd floor), and the view from the bath was a highlight. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've had in a top end hotel, and although the room was small, it was reasonably well apointed. However, there was a problem with cleanliness. There were smudges on the wardrobe and the room was dusty (including the bathroom - not very nice to think that some of the bathroom surfaces hadn't been cleaned in a while). The club lounge was ok, although extremely lacking in atmosphere, even for a hotel lounge. Canapes included a good spread of sushi, dips, cheeses, quiches/dumplings etc. Breakfast was good most days, with a comprehensive range of continental breakfast items, but on Sunday (when the hotel was busy) it was a bit of a disaster - nothing was being refilled so there was hardly anything to eat (this is a good hour and a half before breakfast ended), dish clearing was happening very slowly and there were no tea/coffee cups etc. The club lounge, located away from the rest of the catering facilities, looked like it was basically understaffed at breakfast. The pool, spa, sauna and steam room were nice (not as nice as some others in a similar class in Syndey), but again the cleanliness was iffy. The area looked a little neglected. The staff were generally disinterested, though not rude, and it seemed to take hours to get the room cleaned (we ended up only getting service 2 out of 4 days, even though we left the room for hours from late morning to mid-afternoon every day). My basic impression is that this hotel is understaffed, and also that many staff members are inexperienced - there should NEVER be smudges or dust in a "5 star" hotel room. Having stayed in other hotels in the Sydney CBD for a similar price, I would choose those over the Jamison, although it does have potential - especially given the great views from the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a fan of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maddie1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was VERY dissapointing. Firstly we were not informed of the hotel's change of name and spent 15 minutes trying to locate it! The room itself (a large corner room) was spacious, but filthy. Stains on the chairs, duvet cover and floor, dust on the telephone and bedside tables. The only redeeming factor was the bathroom which was superb with a big deep bath. None of our power points worked and we were told to flick the trip switch to activate the room's electricity. Also tv and alarm clock were of a very poor standard for what promises to be a luxery hotel. The bed was not made very well - twisted sheets - what looked like a rushed job. Our bags took forever to arrive and the stink of stale smoke (even though a non-smoking room was requested) was disgusting. For the cost of the room (a reduced internet rate of $245) this hotel was definitely NOT worth it. I am just glad we spent minimal time in this horrid room - only staying 1 night, opting for somewhere else the following night. I would NEVER reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: RWML
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a city stop-over pad. The decor is modern and rooms are well-maintained with comfortable bed and excellent bathroom, albeit the room was a little small. The pool was not large but reasonable for a hotel in the CBD. It was pretty good value relative to other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: mwardle
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at this hotel. We arrived really early in the morning from London and not surprisingly no rooms were available at that time. The staff were pretty unhelpful, but we did get a shower in the swimming pool changing rooms. When we eventually returned to the hotel at 5pm we were given a smoking room despite having booked a non-smoking room weeks before. This in unnacceptable in my view, how can none be available when booked so far in advance? We had to wait an hour to have the bags brought to the room and it took a reminder phone call at that. The room itself was on the top floor and well appointed with nice views. The bathroom was good too. The gym was a disgrace and the equipment had not been maintained or cleaned in weeks. It was filthy and not a good recommendation. On the plus side, the location was excellent and within walking distance of everywhere in the city. Rydges was due to be taken over by another hotel group at the beginning of November. I hope they do better

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DeVito
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel which is in one of the best locations in sydney, just off george street, literally! The service is great and you get treated really well. The food in the restaurant is lovely and quite reasonable considering the quality and service. The room is a little small, but its very comfortable and luxurious. The only drewback is that when you open the blind, you are looking at office workers in the next building! We arrived after a 6 hour flight and got there at 10am, and there was no questions or problems about cheking in early, and when we checked out we asked for last check out at 1pm, again there was no problems or no extra charges. This hotel is known as being one of the best in sydney, and we would only stay here again in the future due to the location (10 minutes to opera house) and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Annateng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 10th August. Booked the hotel on the basis of reviews that we had read on this site and delighted to say that we were not disappointed. We arrived about 8pm after a flight from Hong Kong and the reception staff arranged for our luggage to go straight to the room whilst we went straight to the bar for an extremely welcome complimentary glass of champagne (and a smoke!). Sorted! we didn't get to the room till 1am but what a great start to our stay! We thought the room was perfectly appointed and spotless. The TV wasn't great but hey, we don't go on holiday to watch TV. The bathroom was fantastic. Only had one meal at the hotel - the seafood buffet on the Saturday night - excellent & the desserts must have been too 'cos my partner ate NINE!!!! The cafe next door was ideal for breakfast tho' unfortunately isn't open on the weekends but loads of other eateries in the area. Location of hotel ideal - walking distance everywhere and that includes Paddy's Market, Botanical Gardens and Darling Harbour etc. The hotel and area had everything we needed (didn't have time to use the hotel pool so can't comment on that), the staff were the most helpful and the friendliest we have encountered so far. In particular, the bar staff - Ngar, Laura & Laura who enlivened our nightcaps no end, so much so that we ran up quite a bar bill!!!! but it was worth it! We have already decided that we will always stay there whenever we are in Sydney which at the mo seems to be every 2 years! Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Delbertboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel ever stayed in. We upgraded to Club deluxe room which are on top 3 floors. This upgrade was worth every penny, giving you best rooms, e.g. large bathroom with bath overlooking city, playstation, but best of all you get access to exclusive club lounge on 31st floor getting complimentary drinks ..champagne if you want + canopies(e.g.sushi, chicken skewers) 5:30-7:30 every night. You can use the lounge for breakfast also. Request corner room to give dual aspects of city. Concierge couldn't do enough. Sydney itself was fantastic, disagree with previous reviewer who said London by the sea. Sydney is much better, friendly, laid back & nobody is out to stuff you. I would recommend doing bridge climb Â£70, the aquarium, ferry to Manly (walk through town to Manly beach) turn right down to Shelly beach. Eat Barramundi takeaway from Manly fish market & eat on beach. In the rocks try G'day cafe for lunch & Zia Pina dinner for good food well priced. Doyles for special dinner. Rocks market sat/sun. Paddys market for very cheap clothes....chinese imports. Opera house tour was good. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Sweep11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three week stay in Australia and spent the first week in Sydney staying at the Rydges Jamison. We chose this hotel partly because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and partly because of the impressive hotel website. We used the hotel's own website to make the reservation - using a combination of a weekend rate and a weekday rate for the best deal. We booked a room with a balcony but unfortunely it did not have much of a view. It was handy to be able to open the doors for fresh air rather than use the air conditioning. The hotel is situated in the business district of Sydney and is only five minutes walk from Circular Quay where we were able to pick up ferries and bus tours. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - we used the concierge service to book a couple of tours. The rooms spacious and clean. Dined at the hotel restaurants on two separate evenings and used the dining room for the buffet breakfast at the weekend. No complaints. Plenty of excellent restaurants locally and on a week day a fabulous food court just next to the hotel served a great selection of foods/fruits and drinks for breakfast for under AU$10 for two people. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: carderbeach
