Reviews.Content: Rydges was a great place to stay in Sydney! It is close to everything and everyone was very helpful. They set up all of our excursions and gave us helpful advice on what to do. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Quay. I stayed there alone for one night before my husband arrived and I felt completely safe walking around late at night. I would stay there again if I ever have the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: krcostel
Reviews.Content: Great location...only about a 10 minute walk from the Quay. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, and very friendly staff. The views aren't that great, but then again, how much time do you actually spend in the room? A few words of advice. Skip the breakfast buffet. It's overpriced and is not that great. You'd be better off going out on the town and finding breakfast at a cafe or restaurant. Also..the seafood buffet that they have on Saturday nights is very good. A little expensive, but it is a good alternative if you do not feel like going out on the town for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TimmyB1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a three-week vacation down under and this is where we stayed for three nights in Sydney. I will try to be brief, but it is difficult sometimes. Location is excellent. There are hotels closer to the Quay, the Rocks, the Opera House, etc., but none that I found in this price range. It was literally a 5-minute (very safe) walk to the Quay, the bridge, another 5 minutes from there to the Opera House. Also, you are one-half block from the train station (underground, no noise) that you can ride to/from the airport for A$13 one way. Staff was very young, very competent, very friendly, and very helpful. Enough said. Room was great. One comfy king-size bed, two chairs, a business desk, a very cool wall unit that contained your closets, TV, mini-bar, etc. Bathroom was HUGE with giant tub and separate glass-enclosed shower. The view from the balcony was good, not great, but that is simply because the buildings around them are so huge, it doesn't matter what floor you are on; my guess is that you are not going to have too many rooms in this location with stunning views of the bridge, Opera House, or whatever. As with most tourists, this isn't a huge deal to us as we used this hotel as a place to sleep in between our many touring activities. Also, we never heard another soul in other rooms the entire time we were there. Very peaceful! Overall, value was superb. We paid A$195 per night for three nights. I would stay in this hotel again in a heartbeat. Feel free to write me if you have any questions at all. TripAdvisor was very helpful for me in selecting hotels for this trip and I would like to help others with their decision making.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel in a fantastic location. Very well situated and conceirge staff were especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, great hotel in an overrated city”
Reviews.Author: Postcorner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our world trip and whilst some time ago just wanted to add my thoughts. The room and bathroom were of a high standard and the service was of high quality throughout. Unknown to ourselves, some friends had arranged a suprise bottle of champagne and some other gifts with the hotel staff prior to our arrival and no-one let on, a great acting job by the bellboy who told us later he had been the one to set up the whole thing. Very nice suprise on entering the room and all just added to the friendly feeling we got from the hotel staff. The restaurant was very nice and had a stunning waterfall feature. Breakfast was enjoyed there throughout our 9 day stay. Couldn't fault the hotel, one of the best we stayed in thoughout our world tour. Have to say though that Sydney was a big disappointment, could have seen it in 3 or 4 days not 9. 'London by the sea'.

Reviews.Title: “Number One for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hamishs
Reviews.Content: If you dont want to pay for a harbour view, like a good location and a nice hotel, this is for you. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “For the jetlagged traveler!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After many hours on the plane from Atlanta, GA USA...this is the place to stay while in Sydney! My husband and I arrived at the hotel around 8 am and they immediately checked us in! We then went to the pool, jacuzzi, steam and dry saunas! The indoor pool has a gorgeous floor to ceiling fountain...it made my jetlag seem to disappear it was so comforting! The hotel is only blocks from the Harbour, Rocks area, and shopping is everywhere. You do not need a car in this city...everyone walks and massive transit is available. Rydges offers a breakfast package and this buffet was exceptionally terrific...homemade yogurt, fresh squeezed juice (the juicer was a large free standing stainless steel one), western and asian options. The room was very contemporary with builtin closets/drawers. Perhaps a bit small but nicely done! The Matilda Cruise came with the package and was absolutely the best way to see Sydney Harbor! I also had a massage at the spa. I favor a traditional Thai massage so I selected an Asian vairety that included several Thai elements. There is also an open food court just downstairs outside the hotel which is great! My husband did the 4:30 am skywalk and absolutely loved it! We also took a Bondi Beach tour which takes you all around the coast line. It is a great way to see all the little towns around Sydney right on the water! We got off at the Bondi Beach stop to have lunch at the Iceberg cafe. This is a member's only club/restaurant for the locals to see and be seen. However if you are just visiting, they will let you into the waterfront restaurant. To become an "Iceberg member" you must swim in the huge pool(and I mean HUGE) 75 consecutive Sundays. The service at this hotel was just incredible. The staff was so very nice and accomodating. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: airborne
Reviews.Content: The Rydges was a great choice for my first (but not last) visit to Sydney. I stayed 8 days there. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were very nice (boutique like but not too sterile), and the location was perfect. An easy walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks, easy access to trains, and close to a lot of good restaurants and shops. I stayed on the 21st floor and it was one of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed in. I was there during the week before Easter, so it may have been slow. Cons: Don't expect much of a view. The elevator card system is finicky. On the other hand the elevators were fast and very available. The in-room television internet never worked (there is an ethernet port if you bring a laptop). Pros: The staff is young but extremely helpful. Local papers are a nice touch. The business center is small but rarely crowded. The baths are absolute heaven--deep, quiet to fill (for those late night tubs), and separate from the shower. The amenites are all nice and the minibar is not too overpriced. I normally don't write reviews because I'm always afraid the places I like will become too popular and expensive. Since it may be some time before I get back to Sydney, I felt I had to give the Rydges a big thumbs up. I'd actually like to give Sydney a huge thumbs-up. What a fantastic city. I went there because I'm visiting all of the continents before I get too old to travel (Australia was number 5). Now I'm afraid Antarctica will have to wait because I only want to go back to the land Down Under.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosky
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great hotel...and in a great location. The hotel rooms looked like they had just been redone b/c it was new and sophisticated. The location is good as it's in the CBD...across the street from a great restaurant and bar...and within walking distance of the circular quay and harbour. The only thing to warn about is their taxi service...it can take up to 15 minute to get a taxi...so I recommend calling ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: robsinclair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and would definately recommend it. The hotel is in a great location for all city centre attractions - 5 mins to circular quay and the rocks and 10 mins to darling harbour. Staff were firendly, spread of food in for breakfast was 1st class for a restaurant of this size. Rooms were clean and modern - only slight disappointment is that the bathrooms are ultramodern to the extent that they are almost a bit clinical but this is purely down to personal taste. If you're staying in sydeny stay here

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is an anomaly that this hotel is rated so highly - and not because of any random and easily repairable bad experience (such as poor service or bad meals). My low rating stems from fundamental systematic errors in this hotel including: * Appalling in room television/radio/technology. There was an old, small, black, CRT television. The channel selection was minimal, picture quality average, and inroom movie options unimpressive. It was the position of the television which was the most disappointing. A hotel room (distinguished from a suite or apartment) should have the television placed in the corner of the room or immediately in front of the bed - not in a wardrobe, on a high shelf, to the left of the bed. * Bed and pillows uncomfortable. These are not small problems because they both combine to consume more than 80% of one's time in the hotel. Yes the hotel was clean, yes the service was good, yes the bathroom was fantastic. But all of that is insignificant when compared to bed and television facilities. I would not recommend this hotel and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews on this downtown gem”
Reviews.Author: 2TxTrvlrs
Reviews.Content: We selected this downtown hotel because of previous reviews and ratings -- the largest number of stars for the money. The location can't be beat. It is a short walk to Circular Quay and the ferry system and the hotel is right on top of the underground mall leading to the Wynyard rail station. There are many good restaurants of all sorts in the immediate area, notably Est. (in the Establishment hotel building). The rooms are fine and the staff friendly and helpful. Best choice for a downtown stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fussymum
Reviews.Content: Rydges Jamison is located above the Wynard Station, so you can get the train from the airport. We used the taxi service from the airport to the hotel which cost $30, returned via the train, which cost $24.( 2 adults, 1 child- free) We booked a Park Suite for the three nights we were in Sydney....we wanted a seperate lounge area so we could put our daughter to bed without disturbing her. The cost per night was $330.00 which included their buffet breakfast. Our daughter stayed free. Portacot provided free. The room was picture perfect, the king size bed being so comfortable. My daughter and I enjoyed the seperate bath, especially me after a long day sight seeing.There were tv's in both rooms and plenty of space in the bedroom wardrobe to hang all our clothes. While this hotel may be only 4 stars it was excellent indeed. Staff were very friendly, no request was a hassle. They even prepared our daughter a meal to our requirements, that wasn't on their childrens room service menu. We only checked in on the pool and gym area, we had hoped to return but Sydney sights took over most of our days...there is so much to see and do. Housekeeping was regular and polite. Location as I said was great, we attended a comedy show in Newtown and being able to use the train service was cheap and easy. We walked everywhere and with a stroller getting to circular quay, opera house, and the rocks was easy. The bus stop for the Sydney Explorer was across the street and up about 200m, McDonalds across on the opposite corner from Jamison St. and the 7eleven 200m down from there. We found Rydges to be all we needed.I would stay here again and recommend it to those who don't require harbour/opera house views. Our bedroom window looked into offices but the blind was there for privacy and at night the drapes were pulled, our lounge window looked down onto Wynard Park...being on the 13th floor was quiet, I did hear the sound of sirens one night, but they probably could be heard from a lot of rooms. As we had breakfast included we used this service....very nice but pricey if you were paying. Under the hotel, mon - sat is many places to grab a meal..I think its called the metcentre and it is amazing...everything you can imagine, bakerys, fresh seafood, roasts, fruit, takeaways....so there are other choices. Sunday we did circular quay, its a buzz with cafes. We dined one night at Rydges Charr restaurant and the meal was divine. Hubby had the wagyu beef while I had King Island...both cooked to perfection, very trendy place to eat....nice and cosy. Enjoyed Sydney and enjoyed Rydges Jamison!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, loved the location, the staff were brilliant. Need I say more!

HotelInfo.Name: Amora Hotel Jamison Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Jamison Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Rydges Jamison Sydney)
